2798  if (need_clipping)
2799  {
2800  ImVec4 fine_clip_rect(clip_min->x, clip_min->y, clip_max->x, clip_max->y);
2801  draw_list->AddText(NULL, 0.0f, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end, 0.0f, &fine_clip_rect);
2802  }
2803  else
2804  {
2805  draw_list->AddText(NULL, 0.0f, pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), text, text_display_end, 0.0f, NULL);
2806  }
2807 }
2808 
2809 void ImGui::RenderTextClipped(const ImVec2 &pos_min, const ImVec2 &pos_max, const char *text, const char *text_end, const ImVec2 *text_size_if_known, const ImVec2 &align, const ImRect *clip_rect)
2810 {
2811  // Hide anything after a '##' string
2812  const char *text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
2813  const int text_len = (int)(text_display_end - text);
2814  if (text_len == 0)
2815  return;
2816 
2817  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2818  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
2819  RenderTextClippedEx(window->DrawList, pos_min, pos_max, text, text_display_end, text_size_if_known, align, clip_rect);
2820  if (g.LogEnabled)
2821  LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_display_end);
2822 }
2823 
2824 
2825 // Another overly complex function until we reorganize everything into a nice all-in-one helper.
2826 // This is made more complex because we have dissociated the layout rectangle (pos_min..pos_max) which define _where_ the ellipsis is, from actual clipping of text and limit of the ellipsis display.
2827 // This is because in the context of tabs we selectively hide part of the text when the Close Button appears, but we don't want the ellipsis to move.
2828 void ImGui::RenderTextEllipsis(ImDrawList *draw_list, const ImVec2 &pos_min, const ImVec2 &pos_max, float clip_max_x, float ellipsis_max_x, const char *text, const char *text_end_full, const ImVec2 *text_size_if_known)
2829 {
2830  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2831  if (text_end_full == NULL)
2832  text_end_full = FindRenderedTextEnd(text);
2833  const ImVec2 text_size = text_size_if_known ? *text_size_if_known : CalcTextSize(text, text_end_full, false, 0.0f);
2834 
2835  //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_min.y - 4), ImVec2(pos_max.x, pos_max.y + 4), IM_COL32(0, 0, 255, 255));
2836  //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_min.y-2), ImVec2(ellipsis_max_x, pos_max.y+2), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
2837  //draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_min.y), ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255));
2838  // FIXME: We could technically remove (last_glyph->AdvanceX - last_glyph->X1) from text_size.x here and save a few pixels.
2839  if (text_size.x > pos_max.x - pos_min.x)
2840  {
2841  // Hello wo...
2842  // | | |
2843  // min max ellipsis_max
2844  // <-> this is generally some padding value
2845 
2846  const ImFont *font = draw_list->_Data->Font;
2847  const float font_size = draw_list->_Data->FontSize;
2848  const char *text_end_ellipsis = NULL;
2849 
2850  ImWchar ellipsis_char = font->EllipsisChar;
2851  int ellipsis_char_count = 1;
2852  if (ellipsis_char == (ImWchar)-1)
2853  {
2854  ellipsis_char = font->DotChar;
2855  ellipsis_char_count = 3;
2856  }
2857  const ImFontGlyph *glyph = font->FindGlyph(ellipsis_char);
2858 
2859  float ellipsis_glyph_width = glyph->X1; // Width of the glyph with no padding on either side
2860  float ellipsis_total_width = ellipsis_glyph_width; // Full width of entire ellipsis
2861 
2862  if (ellipsis_char_count > 1)
2863  {
2864  // Full ellipsis size without free spacing after it.
2865  const float spacing_between_dots = 1.0f * (draw_list->_Data->FontSize / font->FontSize);
2866  ellipsis_glyph_width = glyph->X1 - glyph->X0 + spacing_between_dots;
2867  ellipsis_total_width = ellipsis_glyph_width * (float)ellipsis_char_count - spacing_between_dots;
2868  }
2869 
2870  // We can now claim the space between pos_max.x and ellipsis_max.x
2871  const float text_avail_width = ImMax((ImMax(pos_max.x, ellipsis_max_x) - ellipsis_total_width) - pos_min.x, 1.0f);
2872  float text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, text_avail_width, 0.0f, text, text_end_full, &text_end_ellipsis).x;
2873  if (text == text_end_ellipsis && text_end_ellipsis < text_end_full)
2874  {
2875  // Always display at least 1 character if there's no room for character + ellipsis
2876  text_end_ellipsis = text + ImTextCountUtf8BytesFromChar(text, text_end_full);
2877  text_size_clipped_x = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text, text_end_ellipsis).x;
2878  }
2879  while (text_end_ellipsis > text && ImCharIsBlankA(text_end_ellipsis[-1]))
2880  {
2881  // Trim trailing space before ellipsis (FIXME: Supporting non-ascii blanks would be nice, for this we need a function to backtrack in UTF-8 text)
2882  text_end_ellipsis--;
2883  text_size_clipped_x -= font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, 0.0f, text_end_ellipsis, text_end_ellipsis + 1).x; // Ascii blanks are always 1 byte
2884  }
2885 
2886  // Render text, render ellipsis
2887  RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_ellipsis, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
2888  float ellipsis_x = pos_min.x + text_size_clipped_x;
2889  if (ellipsis_x + ellipsis_total_width <= ellipsis_max_x)
2890  for (int i = 0; i < ellipsis_char_count; i++)
2891  {
2892  font->RenderChar(draw_list, font_size, ImVec2(ellipsis_x, pos_min.y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text), ellipsis_char);
2893  ellipsis_x += ellipsis_glyph_width;
2894  }
2895  }
2896  else
2897  {
2898  RenderTextClippedEx(draw_list, pos_min, ImVec2(clip_max_x, pos_max.y), text, text_end_full, &text_size, ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f));
2899  }
2900 
2901  if (g.LogEnabled)
2902  LogRenderedText(&pos_min, text, text_end_full);
2903 }
2904 
2905 // Render a rectangle shaped with optional rounding and borders
2906 void ImGui::RenderFrame(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, ImU32 fill_col, bool border, float rounding)
2907 {
2908  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2909  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
2910  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(p_min, p_max, fill_col, rounding);
2911  const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
2912  if (border && border_size > 0.0f)
2913  {
2914  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, 0, border_size);
2915  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
2916  }
2917 }
2918 
2919 void ImGui::RenderFrameBorder(ImVec2 p_min, ImVec2 p_max, float rounding)
2920 {
2921  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2922  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
2923  const float border_size = g.Style.FrameBorderSize;
2924  if (border_size > 0.0f)
2925  {
2926  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min + ImVec2(1, 1), p_max + ImVec2(1, 1), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_BorderShadow), rounding, 0, border_size);
2927  window->DrawList->AddRect(p_min, p_max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
2928  }
2929 }
2930 
2931 void ImGui::RenderNavHighlight(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags flags)
2932 {
2933  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
2934  if (id != g.NavId)
2935  return;
2936  if (g.NavDisableHighlight && !(flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_AlwaysDraw))
2937  return;
2938  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
2939  if (window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame)
2940  return;
2941 
2942  float rounding = (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_NoRounding) ? 0.0f : g.Style.FrameRounding;
2943  ImRect display_rect = bb;
2944  display_rect.ClipWith(window->ClipRect);
2945  if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeDefault)
2946  {
2947  const float THICKNESS = 2.0f;
2948  const float DISTANCE = 3.0f + THICKNESS * 0.5f;
2949  display_rect.Expand(ImVec2(DISTANCE, DISTANCE));
2950  bool fully_visible = window->ClipRect.Contains(display_rect);
2951  if (!fully_visible)
2952  window->DrawList->PushClipRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max);
2953  window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min + ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), display_rect.Max - ImVec2(THICKNESS * 0.5f, THICKNESS * 0.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, 0, THICKNESS);
2954  if (!fully_visible)
2955  window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
2956  }
2957  if (flags & ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin)
2958  {
2959  window->DrawList->AddRect(display_rect.Min, display_rect.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavHighlight), rounding, 0, 1.0f);
2960  }
2961 }
2962 
2963 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2964 // [SECTION] MAIN CODE (most of the code! lots of stuff, needs tidying up!)
2965 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2966 
2967 // ImGuiWindow is mostly a dumb struct. It merely has a constructor and a few helper methods
2968 ImGuiWindow::ImGuiWindow(ImGuiContext *context, const char *name) : DrawListInst(NULL)
2969 {
2970  memset(this, 0, sizeof(*this));
2971  Name = ImStrdup(name);
2972  NameBufLen = (int)strlen(name) + 1;
2973  ID = ImHashStr(name);
2974  IDStack.push_back(ID);
2975  MoveId = GetID("#MOVE");
2976  ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
2977  ScrollTargetCenterRatio = ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f);
2978  AutoFitFramesX = AutoFitFramesY = -1;
2979  AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
2980  SetWindowPosAllowFlags = SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = ImGuiCond_Always | ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing;
2981  SetWindowPosVal = SetWindowPosPivot = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
2982  LastFrameActive = -1;
2983  LastTimeActive = -1.0f;
2984  FontWindowScale = 1.0f;
2985  SettingsOffset = -1;
2986  DrawList = &DrawListInst;
2987  DrawList->_Data = &context->DrawListSharedData;
2988  DrawList->_OwnerName = Name;
2989 }
2990 
2991 ImGuiWindow::~ImGuiWindow()
2992 {
2993  IM_ASSERT(DrawList == &DrawListInst);
2994  IM_DELETE(Name);
2995  ColumnsStorage.clear_destruct();
2996 }
2997 
2998 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const char *str, const char *str_end)
2999 {
3000  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3001  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
3002  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3003 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
3004  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3005  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO2(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
3006 #endif
3007  return id;
3008 }
3009 
3010 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetID(const void *ptr)
3011 {
3012  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3013  ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&ptr, sizeof(void *), seed);
3014  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3015 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
3016  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3017  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_Pointer, ptr);
3018 #endif
3019  return id;
3020 }

3026  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);

3028  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3029  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO(id, ImGuiDataType_S32, (intptr_t)n);

3032 }

3067 // This is only used in rare/specific situations to manufacture an ID out of nowhere.
3068 ImGuiID ImGuiWindow::GetIDFromRectangle(const ImRect &r_abs)
3069 {
3070  ImGuiID seed = IDStack.back();
3071  const int r_rel[4] = { (int)(r_abs.Min.x - Pos.x), (int)(r_abs.Min.y - Pos.y), (int)(r_abs.Max.x - Pos.x), (int)(r_abs.Max.y - Pos.y) };
3072  ImGuiID id = ImHashData(&r_rel, sizeof(r_rel), seed);
3073  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
3074  return id;
3075 }
3076 
3077 static void SetCurrentWindow(ImGuiWindow *window)
3078 {
3079  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3080  g.CurrentWindow = window;
3081  g.CurrentTable = window && window->DC.CurrentTableIdx != -1 ? g.Tables.GetByIndex(window->DC.CurrentTableIdx) : NULL;
3082  if (window)
3083  g.FontSize = g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = window->CalcFontSize();
3084 }
3085 
3086 void ImGui::GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers()
3087 {
3088  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3089  g.ItemFlagsStack.clear();
3090  g.GroupStack.clear();
3091  TableGcCompactSettings();
3092 }
3093 
3094 // Free up/compact internal window buffers, we can use this when a window becomes unused.
3095 // Not freed:
3096 // - ImGuiWindow, ImGuiWindowSettings, Name, StateStorage, ColumnsStorage (may hold useful data)
3097 // This should have no noticeable visual effect. When the window reappear however, expect new allocation/buffer growth/copy cost.
3098 void ImGui::GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow *window)
3099 {
3100  window->MemoryCompacted = true;
3101  window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.Capacity;
3102  window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Capacity;
3103  window->IDStack.clear();
3104  window->DrawList->_ClearFreeMemory();
3105  window->DC.ChildWindows.clear();
3106  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.clear();
3107  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.clear();
3108 }
3109 
3110 void ImGui::GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(ImGuiWindow *window)
3111 {
3112  // We stored capacity of the ImDrawList buffer to reduce growth-caused allocation/copy when awakening.
3113  // The other buffers tends to amortize much faster.
3114  window->MemoryCompacted = false;
3115  window->DrawList->IdxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity);
3116  window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.reserve(window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity);
3117  window->MemoryDrawListIdxCapacity = window->MemoryDrawListVtxCapacity = 0;
3118 }
3119 
3120 void ImGui::SetActiveID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow *window)
3121 {
3122  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3123  g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = (g.ActiveId != id);
3124  if (g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated)
3125  {
3126  g.ActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3127  g.ActiveIdHasBeenPressedBefore = false;
3128  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = false;
3129  g.ActiveIdMouseButton = -1;
3130  if (id != 0)
3131  {
3132  g.LastActiveId = id;
3133  g.LastActiveIdTimer = 0.0f;
3134  }
3135  }
3136  g.ActiveId = id;
3137  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
3138  g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = false;
3139  g.ActiveIdWindow = window;
3140  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
3141  if (id)
3142  {
3143  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3144  g.ActiveIdSource = (g.NavActivateId == id || g.NavInputId == id || g.NavJustTabbedId == id || g.NavJustMovedToId == id) ? ImGuiInputSource_Nav : ImGuiInputSource_Mouse;
3145  }
3146 
3147  // Clear declaration of inputs claimed by the widget
3148  // (Please note that this is WIP and not all keys/inputs are thoroughly declared by all widgets yet)
3149  g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
3150  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
3151  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
3152  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = 0x00;
3153 }
3154 
3155 void ImGui::ClearActiveID()
3156 {
3157  SetActiveID(0, NULL); // g.ActiveId = 0;
3158 }
3159 
3160 void ImGui::SetHoveredID(ImGuiID id)
3161 {
3162  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3163  g.HoveredId = id;
3164  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
3165  g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
3166  if (id != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != id)
3167  g.HoveredIdTimer = g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
3168 }
3169 
3170 ImGuiID ImGui::GetHoveredID()
3171 {
3172  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3173  return g.HoveredId ? g.HoveredId : g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
3174 }
3175 
3176 void ImGui::KeepAliveID(ImGuiID id)
3177 {
3178  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3179  if (g.ActiveId == id)
3180  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = id;
3181  if (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == id)
3182  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = true;
3183 }
3184 
3185 void ImGui::MarkItemEdited(ImGuiID id)
3186 {
3187  // This marking is solely to be able to provide info for IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit().
3188  // ActiveId might have been released by the time we call this (as in the typical press/release button behavior) but still need need to fill the data.
3189  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3190  IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId == id || g.ActiveId == 0 || g.DragDropActive);
3191  IM_UNUSED(id); // Avoid unused variable warnings when asserts are compiled out.
3192  //IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->DC.LastItemId == id);
3193  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = true;
3194  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore = true;
3195  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
3196 }
3197 
3198 static inline bool IsWindowContentHoverable(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3199 {
3200  // An active popup disable hovering on other windows (apart from its own children)
3201  // FIXME-OPT: This could be cached/stored within the window.
3202  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3203  if (g.NavWindow)
3204  if (ImGuiWindow *focused_root_window = g.NavWindow->RootWindow)
3205  if (focused_root_window->WasActive && focused_root_window != window->RootWindow)
3206  {
3207  // For the purpose of those flags we differentiate "standard popup" from "modal popup"
3208  // NB: The order of those two tests is important because Modal windows are also Popups.
3209  if (focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
3210  return false;
3211  if ((focused_root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
3212  return false;
3213  }
3214  return true;
3215 }
3216 
3217 // This is roughly matching the behavior of internal-facing ItemHoverable()
3218 // - we allow hovering to be true when ActiveId==window->MoveID, so that clicking on non-interactive items such as a Text() item still returns true with IsItemHovered()
3219 // - this should work even for non-interactive items that have no ID, so we cannot use LastItemId
3220 bool ImGui::IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
3221 {
3222  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3223  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
3224  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover && !g.NavDisableHighlight)
3225  {
3226  if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3227  return false;
3228  return IsItemFocused();
3229  }
3230 
3231  // Test for bounding box overlap, as updated as ItemAdd()
3232  ImGuiItemStatusFlags status_flags = g.LastItemData.StatusFlags;
3233  if (!(status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
3234  return false;
3235  IM_ASSERT((flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows)) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
3236 
3237  // Test if we are hovering the right window (our window could be behind another window)
3238  // [2021/03/02] Reworked / reverted the revert, finally. Note we want e.g. BeginGroup/ItemAdd/EndGroup to work as well. (#3851)
3239  // [2017/10/16] Reverted commit 344d48be3 and testing RootWindow instead. I believe it is correct to NOT test for RootWindow but this leaves us unable
3240  // to use IsItemHovered() after EndChild() itself. Until a solution is found I believe reverting to the test from 2017/09/27 is safe since this was
3241  // the test that has been running for a long while.
3242  if (g.HoveredWindow != window && (status_flags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow) == 0)
3243  if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped) == 0)
3244  return false;
3245 
3246  // Test if another item is active (e.g. being dragged)
3247  if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem) == 0)
3248  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.LastItemData.ID && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != window->MoveId)
3249  return false;
3250 
3251  // Test if interactions on this window are blocked by an active popup or modal.
3252  // The ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup flag will be tested here.
3253  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, flags))
3254  return false;
3255 
3256  // Test if the item is disabled
3257  if ((g.LastItemData.InFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) && !(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenDisabled))
3258  return false;
3259 
3260  // Special handling for calling after Begin() which represent the title bar or tab.
3261  // When the window is collapsed (SkipItems==true) that last item will never be overwritten so we need to detect the case.
3262  if (g.LastItemData.ID == window->MoveId && window->WriteAccessed)
3263  return false;
3264  return true;
3265 }
3266 
3267 // Internal facing ItemHoverable() used when submitting widgets. Differs slightly from IsItemHovered().
3268 bool ImGui::ItemHoverable(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id)
3269 {
3270  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3271  if (g.HoveredId != 0 && g.HoveredId != id && !g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap)
3272  return false;
3273 
3274  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
3275  if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
3276  return false;
3277  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveId != id && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
3278  return false;
3279  if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
3280  return false;
3281  if (g.NavDisableMouseHover)
3282  return false;
3283  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(window, ImGuiHoveredFlags_None))
3284  {
3285  g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
3286  return false;
3287  }
3288 
3289  // We exceptionally allow this function to be called with id==0 to allow using it for easy high-level
3290  // hover test in widgets code. We could also decide to split this function is two.
3291  if (id != 0)
3292  SetHoveredID(id);
3293 
3294  // When disabled we'll return false but still set HoveredId
3295  ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = (g.LastItemData.ID == id ? g.LastItemData.InFlags : g.CurrentItemFlags);
3296  if (item_flags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)
3297  {
3298  // Release active id if turning disabled
3299  if (g.ActiveId == id)
3300  ClearActiveID();
3301  g.HoveredIdDisabled = true;
3302  return false;
3303  }
3304 
3305  if (id != 0)
3306  {
3307  // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool!
3308  // We perform the check here because SetHoveredID() is not frequently called (1~ time a frame), making
3309  // the cost of this tool near-zero. We can get slightly better call-stack and support picking non-hovered
3310  // items if we perform the test in ItemAdd(), but that would incur a small runtime cost.
3311  // #define IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX in imconfig.h if you want this check to also be performed in ItemAdd().
3312  if (g.DebugItemPickerActive && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == id)
3313  GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
3314  if (g.DebugItemPickerBreakId == id)
3315  IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
3316  }
3317 
3318  return true;
3319 }
3320 
3321 bool ImGui::IsClippedEx(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, bool clip_even_when_logged)
3322 {
3323  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3324  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
3325  if (!bb.Overlaps(window->ClipRect))
3326  if (id == 0 || (id != g.ActiveId && id != g.NavId))
3327  if (clip_even_when_logged || !g.LogEnabled)
3328  return true;
3329  return false;
3330 }
3331 
3332 // Called by ItemAdd()
3333 // Process TAB/Shift+TAB. Be mindful that this function may _clear_ the ActiveID when tabbing out.
3334 void ImGui::ItemFocusable(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiID id)
3335 {
3336  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3337  IM_ASSERT(id != 0 && id == g.LastItemData.ID);
3338 
3339  // Increment counters
3340  // FIXME: ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled should disable more.
3341  const bool is_tab_stop = (g.LastItemData.InFlags & (ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop | ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)) == 0;
3342  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular++;
3343  if (is_tab_stop)
3344  {
3345  window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop++;
3346  if (g.NavId == id)
3347  g.NavIdTabCounter = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop;
3348  }
3349 
3350  // Process TAB/Shift-TAB to tab *OUT* of the currently focused item.
3351  // (Note that we can always TAB out of a widget that doesn't allow tabbing in)
3352  if (g.ActiveId == id && g.TabFocusPressed && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Tab) && g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow == NULL)
3353  {
3354  g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow = window;
3355  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop + (g.IO.KeyShift ? (is_tab_stop ? -1 : 0) : +1); // Modulo on index will be applied at the end of frame once we've got the total counter of items.
3356  }
3357 
3358  // Handle focus requests
3359  if (g.TabFocusRequestCurrWindow == window)
3360  {
3361  if (window->DC.FocusCounterRegular == g.TabFocusRequestCurrCounterRegular)
3362  {
3363  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_FocusedByCode;
3364  return;
3365  }
3366  if (is_tab_stop && window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop == g.TabFocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop)
3367  {
3368  g.NavJustTabbedId = id;
3369  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_FocusedByTabbing;
3370  return;
3371  }
3372 
3373  // If another item is about to be focused, we clear our own active id
3374  if (g.ActiveId == id)
3375  ClearActiveID();
3376  }
3377 }
3378 
3379 float ImGui::CalcWrapWidthForPos(const ImVec2 &pos, float wrap_pos_x)
3380 {
3381  if (wrap_pos_x < 0.0f)
3382  return 0.0f;
3383 
3384  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3385  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
3386  if (wrap_pos_x == 0.0f)
3387  {
3388  // We could decide to setup a default wrapping max point for auto-resizing windows,
3389  // or have auto-wrap (with unspecified wrapping pos) behave as a ContentSize extending function?
3390  //if (window->Hidden && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
3391  // wrap_pos_x = ImMax(window->WorkRect.Min.x + g.FontSize * 10.0f, window->WorkRect.Max.x);
3392  //else
3393  wrap_pos_x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
3394  }
3395  else if (wrap_pos_x > 0.0f)
3396  {
3397  wrap_pos_x += window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x; // wrap_pos_x is provided is window local space
3398  }
3399 
3400  return ImMax(wrap_pos_x - pos.x, 1.0f);
3401 }
3402 
3403 // IM_ALLOC() == ImGui::MemAlloc()
3404 void *ImGui::MemAlloc(size_t size)
3405 {
3406  if (ImGuiContext *ctx = GImGui)
3407  ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations++;
3408  return (*GImAllocatorAllocFunc)(size, GImAllocatorUserData);
3409 }
3410 
3411 // IM_FREE() == ImGui::MemFree()
3412 void ImGui::MemFree(void *ptr)
3413 {
3414  if (ptr)
3415  if (ImGuiContext *ctx = GImGui)
3416  ctx->IO.MetricsActiveAllocations--;
3417  return (*GImAllocatorFreeFunc)(ptr, GImAllocatorUserData);
3418 }
3419 
3420 const char *ImGui::GetClipboardText()
3421 {
3422  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3423  return g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn ? g.IO.GetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData) : "";
3424 }
3425 
3426 void ImGui::SetClipboardText(const char *text)
3427 {
3428  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3429  if (g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn)
3430  g.IO.SetClipboardTextFn(g.IO.ClipboardUserData, text);
3431 }

3433 const char *ImGui::GetVersion()
3434 {
3435  return IMGUI_VERSION;
3436 }
3437 
3438 // Internal state access - if you want to share Dear ImGui state between modules (e.g. DLL) or allocate it yourself
3439 // Note that we still point to some static data and members (such as GFontAtlas), so the state instance you end up using will point to the static data within its module
3440 ImGuiContext *ImGui::GetCurrentContext()
3441 {
3442  return GImGui;
3443 }
3444 
3445 void ImGui::SetCurrentContext(ImGuiContext *ctx)
3446 {
3447 #ifdef IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC
3448  IMGUI_SET_CURRENT_CONTEXT_FUNC(ctx); // For custom thread-based hackery you may want to have control over this.
3449 #else
3450  GImGui = ctx;
3451 #endif
3452 }
3453 
3454 void ImGui::SetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc free_func, void *user_data)
3455 {
3456  GImAllocatorAllocFunc = alloc_func;
3457  GImAllocatorFreeFunc = free_func;
3458  GImAllocatorUserData = user_data;
3459 }
3460 
3461 // This is provided to facilitate copying allocators from one static/DLL boundary to another (e.g. retrieve default allocator of your executable address space)
3462 void ImGui::GetAllocatorFunctions(ImGuiMemAllocFunc *p_alloc_func, ImGuiMemFreeFunc *p_free_func, void **p_user_data)
3463 {
3464  *p_alloc_func = GImAllocatorAllocFunc;
3465  *p_free_func = GImAllocatorFreeFunc;
3466  *p_user_data = GImAllocatorUserData;
3467 }
3468 
3469 ImGuiContext *ImGui::CreateContext(ImFontAtlas *shared_font_atlas)
3470 {
3471  ImGuiContext *ctx = IM_NEW(ImGuiContext)(shared_font_atlas);
3472  if (GImGui == NULL)
3473  SetCurrentContext(ctx);
3474  Initialize(ctx);
3475  return ctx;
3476 }
3477 
3478 void ImGui::DestroyContext(ImGuiContext *ctx)
3479 {
3480  if (ctx == NULL)
3481  ctx = GImGui;
3482  Shutdown(ctx);
3483  if (GImGui == ctx)
3484  SetCurrentContext(NULL);
3485  IM_DELETE(ctx);
3486 }
3487 
3488 // No specific ordering/dependency support, will see as needed
3489 ImGuiID ImGui::AddContextHook(ImGuiContext *ctx, const ImGuiContextHook *hook)
3490 {
3491  ImGuiContext &g = *ctx;
3492  IM_ASSERT(hook->Callback != NULL && hook->HookId == 0 && hook->Type != ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_);
3493  g.Hooks.push_back(*hook);
3494  g.Hooks.back().HookId = ++g.HookIdNext;
3495  return g.HookIdNext;
3496 }
3497 
3498 // Deferred removal, avoiding issue with changing vector while iterating it
3499 void ImGui::RemoveContextHook(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiID hook_id)
3500 {
3501  ImGuiContext &g = *ctx;
3502  IM_ASSERT(hook_id != 0);
3503  for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3504  if (g.Hooks[n].HookId == hook_id)
3505  g.Hooks[n].Type = ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_;
3506 }
3507 
3508 // Call context hooks (used by e.g. test engine)
3509 // We assume a small number of hooks so all stored in same array
3510 void ImGui::CallContextHooks(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiContextHookType hook_type)
3511 {
3512  ImGuiContext &g = *ctx;
3513  for (int n = 0; n < g.Hooks.Size; n++)
3514  if (g.Hooks[n].Type == hook_type)
3515  g.Hooks[n].Callback(&g, &g.Hooks[n]);
3516 }
3517 
3518 ImGuiIO &ImGui::GetIO()
3519 {
3520  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3521  return GImGui->IO;
3522 }
3523 
3524 // Pass this to your backend rendering function! Valid after Render() and until the next call to NewFrame()
3525 ImDrawData *ImGui::GetDrawData()
3526 {
3527  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3528  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[0];
3529  return viewport->DrawDataP.Valid ? &viewport->DrawDataP : NULL;
3530 }
