3532 double ImGui::GetTime()
3533 {
3534  return GImGui->Time;
3535 }
3536 
3537 int ImGui::GetFrameCount()
3538 {
3539  return GImGui->FrameCount;
3540 }
3541 
3542 static ImDrawList *GetViewportDrawList(ImGuiViewportP *viewport, size_t drawlist_no, const char *drawlist_name)
3543 {
3544  // Create the draw list on demand, because they are not frequently used for all viewports
3545  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3546  IM_ASSERT(drawlist_no < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawLists));
3547  ImDrawList *draw_list = viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no];
3548  if (draw_list == NULL)
3549  {
3550  draw_list = IM_NEW(ImDrawList)(&g.DrawListSharedData);
3551  draw_list->_OwnerName = drawlist_name;
3552  viewport->DrawLists[drawlist_no] = draw_list;
3553  }
3554 
3555  // Our ImDrawList system requires that there is always a command
3556  if (viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] != g.FrameCount)
3557  {
3558  draw_list->_ResetForNewFrame();
3559  draw_list->PushTextureID(g.IO.Fonts->TexID);
3560  draw_list->PushClipRect(viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size, false);
3561  viewport->DrawListsLastFrame[drawlist_no] = g.FrameCount;
3562  }
3563  return draw_list;
3564 }
3565 
3566 ImDrawList *ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport *viewport)
3567 {
3568  return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP *)viewport, 0, "##Background");
3569 }
3570 
3571 ImDrawList *ImGui::GetBackgroundDrawList()
3572 {
3573  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3574  return GetBackgroundDrawList(g.Viewports[0]);
3575 }
3576 
3577 ImDrawList *ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList(ImGuiViewport *viewport)
3578 {
3579  return GetViewportDrawList((ImGuiViewportP *)viewport, 1, "##Foreground");
3580 }
3581 
3582 ImDrawList *ImGui::GetForegroundDrawList()
3583 {
3584  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3585  return GetForegroundDrawList(g.Viewports[0]);
3586 }
3587 
3588 ImDrawListSharedData *ImGui::GetDrawListSharedData()
3589 {
3590  return &GImGui->DrawListSharedData;
3591 }
3592 
3593 void ImGui::StartMouseMovingWindow(ImGuiWindow *window)
3594 {
3595  // Set ActiveId even if the _NoMove flag is set. Without it, dragging away from a window with _NoMove would activate hover on other windows.
3596  // We _also_ call this when clicking in a window empty space when io.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly is set, but clear g.MovingWindow afterward.
3597  // This is because we want ActiveId to be set even when the window is not permitted to move.
3598  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3599  FocusWindow(window);
3600  SetActiveID(window->MoveId, window);
3601  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
3602  g.ActiveIdClickOffset = g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0] - window->RootWindow->Pos;
3603  g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
3604  SetActiveIdUsingNavAndKeys();
3605 
3606  bool can_move_window = true;
3607  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove) || (window->RootWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
3608  can_move_window = false;
3609  if (can_move_window)
3610  g.MovingWindow = window;
3611 }
3612 
3613 // Handle mouse moving window
3614 // Note: moving window with the navigation keys (Square + d-pad / CTRL+TAB + Arrows) are processed in NavUpdateWindowing()
3615 // FIXME: We don't have strong guarantee that g.MovingWindow stay synched with g.ActiveId == g.MovingWindow->MoveId.
3616 // This is currently enforced by the fact that BeginDragDropSource() is setting all g.ActiveIdUsingXXXX flags to inhibit navigation inputs,
3617 // but if we should more thoroughly test cases where g.ActiveId or g.MovingWindow gets changed and not the other.
3618 void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame()
3619 {
3620  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3621  if (g.MovingWindow != NULL)
3622  {
3623  // We actually want to move the root window. g.MovingWindow == window we clicked on (could be a child window).
3624  // We track it to preserve Focus and so that generally ActiveIdWindow == MovingWindow and ActiveId == MovingWindow->MoveId for consistency.
3625  KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3626  IM_ASSERT(g.MovingWindow && g.MovingWindow->RootWindow);
3627  ImGuiWindow *moving_window = g.MovingWindow->RootWindow;
3628  if (g.IO.MouseDown[0] && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
3629  {
3630  ImVec2 pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset;
3631  if (moving_window->Pos.x != pos.x || moving_window->Pos.y != pos.y)
3632  {
3633  MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
3634  SetWindowPos(moving_window, pos, ImGuiCond_Always);
3635  }
3636  FocusWindow(g.MovingWindow);
3637  }
3638  else
3639  {
3640  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3641  ClearActiveID();
3642  }
3643  }
3644  else
3645  {
3646  // When clicking/dragging from a window that has the _NoMove flag, we still set the ActiveId in order to prevent hovering others.
3647  if (g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->MoveId == g.ActiveId)
3648  {
3649  KeepAliveID(g.ActiveId);
3650  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[0])
3651  ClearActiveID();
3652  }
3653  }
3654 }
3655 
3656 // Initiate moving window when clicking on empty space or title bar.
3657 // Handle left-click and right-click focus.
3658 void ImGui::UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame()
3659 {
3660  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3661  if (g.ActiveId != 0 || g.HoveredId != 0)
3662  return;
3663 
3664  // Unless we just made a window/popup appear
3665  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Appearing)
3666  return;
3667 
3668  // Click on empty space to focus window and start moving
3669  // (after we're done with all our widgets)
3670  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[0])
3671  {
3672  // Handle the edge case of a popup being closed while clicking in its empty space.
3673  // If we try to focus it, FocusWindow() > ClosePopupsOverWindow() will accidentally close any parent popups because they are not linked together any more.
3674  ImGuiWindow *root_window = g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow : NULL;
3675  const bool is_closed_popup = root_window && (root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !IsPopupOpen(root_window->PopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel);
3676 
3677  if (root_window != NULL && !is_closed_popup)
3678  {
3679  StartMouseMovingWindow(g.HoveredWindow); //-V595
3680 
3681  // Cancel moving if clicked outside of title bar
3682  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(root_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
3683  if (!root_window->TitleBarRect().Contains(g.IO.MouseClickedPos[0]))
3684  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3685 
3686  // Cancel moving if clicked over an item which was disabled or inhibited by popups (note that we know HoveredId == 0 already)
3687  if (g.HoveredIdDisabled)
3688  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
3689  }
3690  else if (root_window == NULL && g.NavWindow != NULL && GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
3691  {
3692  // Clicking on void disable focus
3693  FocusWindow(NULL);
3694  }
3695  }
3696 
3697  // With right mouse button we close popups without changing focus based on where the mouse is aimed
3698  // Instead, focus will be restored to the window under the bottom-most closed popup.
3699  // (The left mouse button path calls FocusWindow on the hovered window, which will lead NewFrame->ClosePopupsOverWindow to trigger)
3700  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[1])
3701  {
3702  // Find the top-most window between HoveredWindow and the top-most Modal Window.
3703  // This is where we can trim the popup stack.
3704  ImGuiWindow *modal = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3705  bool hovered_window_above_modal = g.HoveredWindow && IsWindowAbove(g.HoveredWindow, modal);
3706  ClosePopupsOverWindow(hovered_window_above_modal ? g.HoveredWindow : modal, true);
3707  }
3708 }
3709 
3710 static bool IsWindowActiveAndVisible(ImGuiWindow *window)
3711 {
3712  return (window->Active) && (!window->Hidden);
3713 }
3714 
3715 static void ImGui::UpdateMouseInputs()
3716 {
3717  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3718 
3719  // Round mouse position to avoid spreading non-rounded position (e.g. UpdateManualResize doesn't support them well)
3720  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
3721  g.IO.MousePos = g.LastValidMousePos = ImFloor(g.IO.MousePos);
3722 
3723  // If mouse just appeared or disappeared (usually denoted by -FLT_MAX components) we cancel out movement in MouseDelta
3724  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePosPrev))
3725  g.IO.MouseDelta = g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MousePosPrev;
3726  else
3727  g.IO.MouseDelta = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3728  if (g.IO.MouseDelta.x != 0.0f || g.IO.MouseDelta.y != 0.0f)
3729  g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
3730 
3731  g.IO.MousePosPrev = g.IO.MousePos;
3732  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); i++)
3733  {
3734  g.IO.MouseClicked[i] = g.IO.MouseDown[i] && g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f;
3735  g.IO.MouseReleased[i] = !g.IO.MouseDown[i] && g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] >= 0.0f;
3736  g.IO.MouseDownDurationPrev[i] = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i];
3737  g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] = g.IO.MouseDown[i] ? (g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.MouseDownDuration[i] + g.IO.Time) : -1.0f;
3738  g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = false;
3739  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i])
3740  {
3741  if ((float)(g.Time - g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i]) < g.IO.MouseDoubleClickTime)
3742  {
3743  ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3744  if (ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos) < g.IO.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist * g.IO.MouseDoubleClickMaxDist)
3745  g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i] = true;
3746  g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] = -g.IO.MouseDoubleClickTime * 2.0f; // Mark as "old enough" so the third click isn't turned into a double-click
3747  }
3748  else
3749  {
3750  g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] = g.Time;
3751  }
3752  g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i] = g.IO.MousePos;
3753  g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[i] = g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[i];
3754  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i] = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3755  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = 0.0f;
3756  }
3757  else if (g.IO.MouseDown[i])
3758  {
3759  // Maintain the maximum distance we reaching from the initial click position, which is used with dragging threshold
3760  ImVec2 delta_from_click_pos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? (g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[i]) : ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
3761  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i] = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[i], ImLengthSqr(delta_from_click_pos));
3762  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].x, delta_from_click_pos.x < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.x : delta_from_click_pos.x);
3763  g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y = ImMax(g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceAbs[i].y, delta_from_click_pos.y < 0.0f ? -delta_from_click_pos.y : delta_from_click_pos.y);
3764  }
3765  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[i] && !g.IO.MouseReleased[i])
3766  g.IO.MouseDownWasDoubleClick[i] = false;
3767  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i]) // Clicking any mouse button reactivate mouse hovering which may have been deactivated by gamepad/keyboard navigation
3768  g.NavDisableMouseHover = false;
3769  }
3770 }
3771 
3772 static void StartLockWheelingWindow(ImGuiWindow *window)
3773 {
3774  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3775  if (g.WheelingWindow == window)
3776  return;
3777  g.WheelingWindow = window;
3778  g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos = g.IO.MousePos;
3779  g.WheelingWindowTimer = WINDOWS_MOUSE_WHEEL_SCROLL_LOCK_TIMER;
3780 }
3781 
3782 void ImGui::UpdateMouseWheel()
3783 {
3784  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3785 
3786  // Reset the locked window if we move the mouse or after the timer elapses
3787  if (g.WheelingWindow != NULL)
3788  {
3789  g.WheelingWindowTimer -= g.IO.Time;
3790  if (IsMousePosValid() && ImLengthSqr(g.IO.MousePos - g.WheelingWindowRefMousePos) > g.IO.MouseDragThreshold * g.IO.MouseDragThreshold)
3791  g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
3792  if (g.WheelingWindowTimer <= 0.0f)
3793  {
3794  g.WheelingWindow = NULL;
3795  g.WheelingWindowTimer = 0.0f;
3796  }
3797  }
3798 
3799  if (g.IO.MouseWheel == 0.0f && g.IO.MouseWheelH == 0.0f)
3800  return;
3801 
3802  if ((g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel) || (g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrameUsingMouseWheel))
3803  return;
3804 
3805  ImGuiWindow *window = g.WheelingWindow ? g.WheelingWindow : g.HoveredWindow;
3806  if (!window || window->Collapsed)
3807  return;
3808 
3809  // Zoom / Scale window
3810  // FIXME-OBSOLETE: This is an old feature, it still works but pretty much nobody is using it and may be best redesigned.
3811  if (g.IO.MouseWheel != 0.0f && g.IO.KeyCtrl && g.IO.FontAllowUserScaling)
3812  {
3813  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3814  const float new_font_scale = ImClamp(window->FontWindowScale + g.IO.MouseWheel * 0.10f, 0.50f, 2.50f);
3815  const float scale = new_font_scale / window->FontWindowScale;
3816  window->FontWindowScale = new_font_scale;
3817  if (window == window->RootWindow)
3818  {
3819  const ImVec2 offset = window->Size * (1.0f - scale) * (g.IO.MousePos - window->Pos) / window->Size;
3820  SetWindowPos(window, window->Pos + offset, 0);
3821  window->Size = ImFloor(window->Size * scale);
3822  window->SizeFull = ImFloor(window->SizeFull * scale);
3823  }
3824  return;
3825  }
3826 
3827  // Mouse wheel scrolling
3828  // If a child window has the ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse flag, we give a chance to scroll its parent
3829  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl)
3830  return;
3831 
3832  // As a standard behavior holding SHIFT while using Vertical Mouse Wheel triggers Horizontal scroll instead
3833  // (we avoid doing it on OSX as it the OS input layer handles this already)
3834  const bool swap_axis = g.IO.KeyShift && !g.IO.ConfigMacOSXBehaviors;
3835  const float wheel_y = swap_axis ? 0.0f : g.IO.MouseWheel;
3836  const float wheel_x = swap_axis ? g.IO.MouseWheel : g.IO.MouseWheelH;
3837 
3838  // Vertical Mouse Wheel scrolling
3839  if (wheel_y != 0.0f)
3840  {
3841  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3842  while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.y == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
3843  window = window->ParentWindow;
3844  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
3845  {
3846  float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetHeight() * 0.67f;
3847  float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(5 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
3848  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - wheel_y * scroll_step);
3849  }
3850  }
3851 
3852  // Horizontal Mouse Wheel scrolling, or Vertical Mouse Wheel w/ Shift held
3853  if (wheel_x != 0.0f)
3854  {
3855  StartLockWheelingWindow(window);
3856  while ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && ((window->ScrollMax.x == 0.0f) || ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))))
3857  window = window->ParentWindow;
3858  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollWithMouse) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
3859  {
3860  float max_step = window->InnerRect.GetWidth() * 0.67f;
3861  float scroll_step = ImFloor(ImMin(2 * window->CalcFontSize(), max_step));
3862  SetScrollX(window, window->Scroll.x - wheel_x * scroll_step);
3863  }
3864  }
3865 }
3866 
3867 void ImGui::UpdateTabFocus()
3868 {
3869  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3870 
3871  // Pressing TAB activate widget focus
3872  g.TabFocusPressed = (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->Active && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab));
3873  if (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.TabFocusPressed)
3874  {
3875  // - This path is only taken when no widget are active/tabbed-into yet.
3876  // Subsequent tabbing will be processed by FocusableItemRegister()
3877  // - Note that SetKeyboardFocusHere() sets the Next fields mid-frame. To be consistent we also
3878  // manipulate the Next fields here even though they will be turned into Curr fields below.
3879  g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow = g.NavWindow;
3880  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterRegular = INT_MAX;
3881  if (g.NavId != 0 && g.NavIdTabCounter != INT_MAX)
3882  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = g.NavIdTabCounter + (g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : 0);
3883  else
3884  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = g.IO.KeyShift ? -1 : 0;
3885  }
3886 
3887  // Turn queued focus request into current one
3888  g.TabFocusRequestCurrWindow = NULL;
3889  g.TabFocusRequestCurrCounterRegular = g.TabFocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
3890  if (g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow != NULL)
3891  {
3892  ImGuiWindow *window = g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow;
3893  g.TabFocusRequestCurrWindow = window;
3894  if (g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterRegular != INT_MAX && window->DC.FocusCounterRegular != -1)
3895  g.TabFocusRequestCurrCounterRegular = ImModPositive(g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterRegular, window->DC.FocusCounterRegular + 1);
3896  if (g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop != INT_MAX && window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop != -1)
3897  g.TabFocusRequestCurrCounterTabStop = ImModPositive(g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop, window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop + 1);
3898  g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow = NULL;
3899  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterRegular = g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
3900  }
3901 
3902  g.NavIdTabCounter = INT_MAX;
3903 }
3904 
3905 // The reason this is exposed in imgui_internal.h is: on touch-based system that don't have hovering, we want to dispatch inputs to the right target (imgui vs imgui+app)
3906 void ImGui::UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags()
3907 {
3908  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3909  g.WindowsHoverPadding = ImMax(g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, ImVec2(WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING, WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING));
3910 
3911  // Find the window hovered by mouse:
3912  // - Child windows can extend beyond the limit of their parent so we need to derive HoveredRootWindow from HoveredWindow.
3913  // - When moving a window we can skip the search, which also conveniently bypasses the fact that window->WindowRectClipped is lagging as this point of the frame.
3914  // - We also support the moved window toggling the NoInputs flag after moving has started in order to be able to detect windows below it, which is useful for e.g. docking mechanisms.
3915  bool clear_hovered_windows = false;
3916  FindHoveredWindow();
3917 
3918  // Modal windows prevents mouse from hovering behind them.
3919  ImGuiWindow *modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
3920  if (modal_window && g.HoveredWindow && !IsWindowChildOf(g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow, modal_window))
3921  clear_hovered_windows = true;
3922 
3923  // Disabled mouse?
3924  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NoMouse)
3925  clear_hovered_windows = true;
3926 
3927  // We track click ownership. When clicked outside of a window the click is owned by the application and won't report hovering nor request capture even while dragging over our windows afterward.
3928  int mouse_earliest_button_down = -1;
3929  bool mouse_any_down = false;
3930  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); i++)
3931  {
3932  if (g.IO.MouseClicked[i])
3933  g.IO.MouseDownOwned[i] = (g.HoveredWindow != NULL) || (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
3934  mouse_any_down |= g.IO.MouseDown[i];
3935  if (g.IO.MouseDown[i])
3936  if (mouse_earliest_button_down == -1 || g.IO.MouseClickedTime[i] < g.IO.MouseClickedTime[mouse_earliest_button_down])
3937  mouse_earliest_button_down = i;
3938  }
3939  const bool mouse_avail_to_imgui = (mouse_earliest_button_down == -1) || g.IO.MouseDownOwned[mouse_earliest_button_down];
3940 
3941  // If mouse was first clicked outside of ImGui bounds we also cancel out hovering.
3942  // FIXME: For patterns of drag and drop across OS windows, we may need to rework/remove this test (first committed 311c0ca9 on 2015/02)
3943  const bool mouse_dragging_extern_payload = g.DragDropActive && (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern) != 0;
3944  if (!mouse_avail_to_imgui && !mouse_dragging_extern_payload)
3945  clear_hovered_windows = true;
3946 
3947  if (clear_hovered_windows)
3948  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
3949 
3950  // Update io.WantCaptureMouse for the user application (true = dispatch mouse info to imgui, false = dispatch mouse info to Dear ImGui + app)
3951  if (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != -1)
3952  g.IO.WantCaptureMouse = (g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame != 0);
3953  else
3954  g.IO.WantCaptureMouse = (mouse_avail_to_imgui && (g.HoveredWindow != NULL || mouse_any_down)) || (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0);
3955 
3956  // Update io.WantCaptureKeyboard for the user application (true = dispatch keyboard info to imgui, false = dispatch keyboard info to Dear ImGui + app)
3957  if (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != -1)
3958  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame != 0);
3959  else
3960  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = (g.ActiveId != 0) || (modal_window != NULL);
3961  if (g.IO.NavActive && (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavNoCaptureKeyboard))
3962  g.IO.WantCaptureKeyboard = true;
3963 
3964  // Update io.WantTextInput flag, this is to allow systems without a keyboard (e.g. mobile, hand-held) to show a software keyboard if possible
3965  g.IO.WantTextInput = (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != -1) ? (g.WantTextInputNextFrame != 0) : false;
3966 }
3967 
3968 ImGuiKeyModFlags ImGui::GetMergedKeyModFlags()
3969 {
3970  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3971  ImGuiKeyModFlags key_mod_flags = ImGuiKeyModFlags_None;
3972  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl)
3973  {
3974  key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Ctrl;
3975  }
3976  if (g.IO.KeyShift)
3977  {
3978  key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Shift;
3979  }
3980  if (g.IO.KeyAlt)
3981  {
3982  key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt;
3983  }
3984  if (g.IO.KeySuper)
3985  {
3986  key_mod_flags |= ImGuiKeyModFlags_Super;
3987  }
3988  return key_mod_flags;
3989 }
3990 
3991 void ImGui::NewFrame()
3992 {
3993  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL && "No current context. Did you call ImGui::CreateContext() and ImGui::SetCurrentContext() ?");
3994  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
3995 
3996  // Remove pending delete hooks before frame start.
3997  // This deferred removal avoid issues of removal while iterating the hook vector
3998  for (int n = g.Hooks.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
3999  if (g.Hooks[n].Type == ImGuiContextHookType_PendingRemoval_)
4000  g.Hooks.erase(&g.Hooks[n]);
4001 
4002  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePre);
4003 
4004  // Check and assert for various common IO and Configuration mistakes
4005  ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks();
4006 
4007  // Load settings on first frame, save settings when modified (after a delay)
4008  UpdateSettings();
4009 
4010  g.Time += g.IO.Time;
4011  g.WithinFrameScope = true;
4012  g.FrameCount += 1;
4013  g.TooltipOverrideCount = 0;
4014  g.WindowsActiveCount = 0;
4015  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.resize(0);
4016 
4017  // Calculate frame-rate for the user, as a purely luxurious feature
4018  g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum += g.IO.Time - g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx];
4019  g.FramerateSecPerFrame[g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx] = g.IO.Time;
4020  g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameIdx + 1) % IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame);
4021  g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount = ImMin(g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount + 1, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.FramerateSecPerFrame));
4022  g.IO.Framerate = (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum > 0.0f) ? (1.0f / (g.FramerateSecPerFrameAccum / (float)g.FramerateSecPerFrameCount)) : FLT_MAX;
4023 
4024  UpdateViewportsNewFrame();
4025 
4026  // Setup current font and draw list shared data
4027  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = true;
4028  SetCurrentFont(GetDefaultFont());
4029  IM_ASSERT(g.Font->IsLoaded());
4030  ImRect virtual_space(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
4031  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4032  virtual_space.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
4033  g.DrawListSharedData.ClipRectFullscreen = virtual_space.ToVec4();
4034  g.DrawListSharedData.CurveTessellationTol = g.Style.CurveTessellationTol;
4035  g.DrawListSharedData.SetCircleTessellationMaxError(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError);
4036  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags = ImDrawListFlags_None;
4037  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLines)
4038  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines;
4039  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedLinesUseTex && !(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines))
4040  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex;
4041  if (g.Style.AntiAliasedFill)
4042  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill;
4043  if (g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset)
4044  g.DrawListSharedData.InitialFlags |= ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset;
4045 
4046  // Mark rendering data as invalid to prevent user who may have a handle on it to use it.
4047  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4048  {
4049  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4050  viewport->DrawDataP.Clear();
4051  }
4052 
4053  // Drag and drop keep the source ID alive so even if the source disappear our state is consistent
4054  if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
4055  KeepAliveID(g.DragDropPayload.SourceId);
4056 
4057  // Update HoveredId data
4058  if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame)
4059  g.HoveredIdTimer = 0.0f;
4060  if (!g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame || (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId == g.HoveredId))
4061  g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer = 0.0f;
4062  if (g.HoveredId)
4063  g.HoveredIdTimer += g.IO.Time;
4064  if (g.HoveredId && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredId)
4065  g.HoveredIdNotActiveTimer += g.IO.Time;
4066  g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame = g.HoveredId;
4067  g.HoveredIdPreviousFrameUsingMouseWheel = g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel;
4068  g.HoveredId = 0;
4069  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = false;
4070  g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = false;
4071  g.HoveredIdDisabled = false;
4072 
4073  // Update ActiveId data (clear reference to active widget if the widget isn't alive anymore)
4074  if (g.ActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.ActiveId && g.ActiveId != 0)
4075  ClearActiveID();
4076  if (g.ActiveId)
4077  g.ActiveIdTimer += g.IO.Time;
4078  g.LastActiveIdTimer += g.IO.Time;
4079  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame = g.ActiveId;
4080  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = g.ActiveIdWindow;
4081  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore = g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore;
4082  g.ActiveIdIsAlive = 0;
4083  g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame = false;
4084  g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = false;
4085  g.ActiveIdIsJustActivated = false;
4086  if (g.TempInputId != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.TempInputId)
4087  g.TempInputId = 0;
4088  if (g.ActiveId == 0)
4089  {
4090  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = 0x00;
4091  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = 0x00;
4092  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = 0x00;
4093  }
4094 
4095  // Drag and drop
4096  g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr;
4097  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = 0;
4098  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
4099  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4100  g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
4101  g.DragDropHoldJustPressedId = 0;
4102 
4103  // Update keyboard input state
4104  // Synchronize io.KeyMods with individual modifiers io.KeyXXX bools
4105  g.IO.KeyMods = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
4106  memcpy(g.IO.KeysDownDurationPrev, g.IO.KeysDownDuration, sizeof(g.IO.KeysDownDuration));
4107  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown); i++)
4108  g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] = g.IO.KeysDown[i] ? (g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : g.IO.KeysDownDuration[i] + g.IO.Time) : -1.0f;
4109 
4110  // Update gamepad/keyboard navigation
4111  NavUpdate();
4112 
4113  // Update mouse input state
4114  UpdateMouseInputs();
4115 
4116  // Find hovered window
4117  // (needs to be before UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame so we fill g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow on the mouse release frame)
4118  UpdateHoveredWindowAndCaptureFlags();
4119 
4120  // Handle user moving window with mouse (at the beginning of the frame to avoid input lag or sheering)
4121  UpdateMouseMovingWindowNewFrame();
4122 
4123  // Background darkening/whitening
4124  if (GetTopMostPopupModal() != NULL || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha > 0.0f))
4125  g.DimBgRatio = ImMin(g.DimBgRatio + g.IO.Time * 6.0f, 1.0f);
4126  else
4127  g.DimBgRatio = ImMax(g.DimBgRatio - g.IO.Time * 10.0f, 0.0f);
4128 
4129  g.MouseCursor = ImGuiMouseCursor_Arrow;
4130  g.WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = g.WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = g.WantTextInputNextFrame = -1;
4131  g.PlatformImePos = ImVec2(1.0f, 1.0f); // OS Input Method Editor showing on top-left of our window by default
4132 
4133  // Mouse wheel scrolling, scale
4134  UpdateMouseWheel();
4135 
4136  // Update legacy TAB focus
4137  UpdateTabFocus();
4138 
4139  // Mark all windows as not visible and compact unused memory.
4140  IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size <= g.Windows.Size);
4141  const float memory_compact_start_time = (g.GcCompactAll || g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer < 0.0f) ? FLT_MAX : (float)g.Time - g.IO.ConfigMemoryCompactTimer;
4142  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4143  {
4144  ImGuiWindow *window = g.Windows[i];
4145  window->WasActive = window->Active;
4146  window->BeginCount = 0;
4147  window->Active = false;
4148  window->WriteAccessed = false;
4149 
4150  // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused windows
4151  if (!window->WasActive && !window->MemoryCompacted && window->LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4152  GcCompactTransientWindowBuffers(window);
4153  }
4154 
4155  // Garbage collect transient buffers of recently unused tables
4156  for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesLastTimeActive.Size; i++)
4157  if (g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] >= 0.0f && g.TablesLastTimeActive[i] < memory_compact_start_time)
4158  TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(g.Tables.GetByIndex(i));
4159  for (int i = 0; i < g.TablesTempDataStack.Size; i++)
4160  if (g.TablesTempDataStack[i].LastTimeActive >= 0.0f && g.TablesTempDataStack[i].LastTimeActive < memory_compact_start_time)
4161  TableGcCompactTransientBuffers(&g.TablesTempDataStack[i]);
4162  if (g.GcCompactAll)
4163  GcCompactTransientMiscBuffers();
4164  g.GcCompactAll = false;
4165 
4166  // Closing the focused window restore focus to the first active root window in descending z-order
4167  if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->WasActive)
4168  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(NULL, NULL);
4169 
4170  // No window should be open at the beginning of the frame.
4171  // But in order to allow the user to call NewFrame() multiple times without calling Render(), we are doing an explicit clear.
4172  g.CurrentWindowStack.resize(0);
4173  g.BeginPopupStack.resize(0);
4174  g.ItemFlagsStack.resize(0);
4175  g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(ImGuiItemFlags_None);
4176  g.GroupStack.resize(0);
4177 
4178  // [DEBUG] Item picker tool - start with DebugStartItemPicker() - useful to visually select an item and break into its call-stack.
4179  UpdateDebugToolItemPicker();
4180 
4181  // Create implicit/fallback window - which we will only render it if the user has added something to it.
4182  // We don't use "Debug" to avoid colliding with user trying to create a "Debug" window with custom flags.
4183  // This fallback is particularly important as it avoid ImGui:: calls from crashing.
4184  g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = true;
4185  SetNextWindowSize(ImVec2(400, 400), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver);
4186  Begin("Debug##Default");
4187  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow == true);
4188 
4189  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_NewFramePost);
4190 }
4191 
4192 // [DEBUG] Item picker tool - start with DebugStartItemPicker() - useful to visually select an item and break into its call-stack.
4193 void ImGui::UpdateDebugToolItemPicker()
4194 {
4195  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4196  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = 0;
4197  if (g.DebugItemPickerActive)
4198  {
4199  const ImGuiID hovered_id = g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame;
4200  SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor_Hand);
4201  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Escape))
4202  g.DebugItemPickerActive = false;
4203  if (IsMouseClicked(0) && hovered_id)
4204  {
4205  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = hovered_id;
4206  g.DebugItemPickerActive = false;
4207  }
4208  SetNextWindowBgAlpha(0.60f);
4209  BeginTooltip();
4210  Text("HoveredId: 0x%08X", hovered_id);
4211  Text("Press ESC to abort picking.");
4212  TextColored(GetStyleColorVec4(hovered_id ? ImGuiCol_Text : ImGuiCol_TextDisabled), "Click to break in debugger!");
4213  EndTooltip();
4214  }
4215 }
4216 
4217 void ImGui::Initialize(ImGuiContext *context)
4218 {
4219  ImGuiContext &g = *context;
4220  IM_ASSERT(!g.Initialized && !g.SettingsLoaded);
4221 
4222  // Add .ini handle for ImGuiWindow type
4223  {
4224  ImGuiSettingsHandler ini_handler;
4225  ini_handler.TypeName = "Window";
4226  ini_handler.TypeHash = ImHashStr("Window");
4227  ini_handler.ClearAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll;
4228  ini_handler.ReadOpenFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen;
4229  ini_handler.ReadLineFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine;
4230  ini_handler.ApplyAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll;
4231  ini_handler.WriteAllFn = WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll;
4232  g.SettingsHandlers.push_back(ini_handler);
4233  }
4234 
4235  // Add .ini handle for ImGuiTable type
4236  TableSettingsInstallHandler(context);
4237 
4238  // Create default viewport
4239  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = IM_NEW(ImGuiViewportP)();
4240  g.Viewports.push_back(viewport);
4241 
4242 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
4243 #endif
4244 
4245  g.Initialized = true;
4246 }
4247 
4248 // This function is merely here to free heap allocations.
4249 void ImGui::Shutdown(ImGuiContext *context)
4250 {
4251  // The fonts atlas can be used prior to calling NewFrame(), so we clear it even if g.Initialized is FALSE (which would happen if we never called NewFrame)
4252  ImGuiContext &g = *context;
4253  if (g.IO.Fonts && g.FontAtlasOwnedByContext)
4254  {
4255  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4256  IM_DELETE(g.IO.Fonts);
4257  }
4258  g.IO.Fonts = NULL;
4259 
4260  // Cleanup of other data are conditional on actually having initialized Dear ImGui.
4261  if (!g.Initialized)
4262  return;
4263 
4264  // Save settings (unless we haven't attempted to load them: CreateContext/DestroyContext without a call to NewFrame shouldn't save an empty file)
4265  if (g.SettingsLoaded && g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
4266  {
4267  ImGuiContext *backup_context = GImGui;
4268  SetCurrentContext(&g);
4269  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
4270  SetCurrentContext(backup_context);
4271  }
4272 
4273  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_Shutdown);
4274 
4275  // Clear everything else
4276  g.Windows.clear_delete();
4277  g.WindowsFocusOrder.clear();
4278  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.clear();
4279  g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
4280  g.CurrentWindowStack.clear();
4281  g.WindowsById.Clear();
4282  g.NavWindow = NULL;
4283  g.HoveredWindow = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = NULL;
4284  g.ActiveIdWindow = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameWindow = NULL;
4285  g.MovingWindow = NULL;
4286  g.ColorStack.clear();
4287  g.StyleVarStack.clear();
4288  g.FontStack.clear();
4289  g.OpenPopupStack.clear();
4290  g.BeginPopupStack.clear();
4291 
4292  g.Viewports.clear_delete();
4293 
4294  g.TabBars.Clear();
4295  g.CurrentTabBarStack.clear();
4296  g.ShrinkWidthBuffer.clear();
4297 
4298  g.Tables.Clear();
4299  g.TablesTempDataStack.clear_destruct();
4300  g.DrawChannelsTempMergeBuffer.clear();
4301 
4302  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
4303  g.MenusIdSubmittedThisFrame.clear();
4304  g.InputTextState.ClearFreeMemory();
4305 
4306  g.SettingsWindows.clear();
4307  g.SettingsHandlers.clear();
4308 
4309  if (g.LogFile)
4310  {
4311 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
4312  if (g.LogFile != stdout)
4313 #endif
4314  ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
4315  g.LogFile = NULL;
4316  }
4317  g.LogBuffer.clear();
4318 
4319  g.Initialized = false;
4320 }
4321 
4322 // FIXME: Add a more explicit sort order in the window structure.
4323 static int IMGUI_CDECL ChildWindowComparer(const void *lhs, const void *rhs)
4324 {
4325  const ImGuiWindow *const a = *(const ImGuiWindow *const *)lhs;
4326  const ImGuiWindow *const b = *(const ImGuiWindow *const *)rhs;
4327  if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
4328  return d;
4329  if (int d = (a->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) - (b->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
4330  return d;
4331  return (a->BeginOrderWithinParent - b->BeginOrderWithinParent);
4332 }
4333 
4334 static void AddWindowToSortBuffer(ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> *out_sorted_windows, ImGuiWindow *window)
4335 {
4336  out_sorted_windows->push_back(window);
4337  if (window->Active)
4338  {
4339  int count = window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
4340  if (count > 1)
4341  ImQsort(window->DC.ChildWindows.Data, (size_t)count, sizeof(ImGuiWindow *), ChildWindowComparer);
4342  for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
4343  {
4344  ImGuiWindow *child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4345  if (child->Active)
4346  AddWindowToSortBuffer(out_sorted_windows, child);
4347  }
4348  }
4349 }
4350 
4351 static void AddDrawListToDrawData(ImVector<ImDrawList *> *out_list, ImDrawList *draw_list)
4352 {
4353  // Remove trailing command if unused.
4354  // Technically we could return directly instead of popping, but this make things looks neat in Metrics/Debugger window as well.
4355  draw_list->_PopUnusedDrawCmd();
4356  if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size == 0)
4357  return;
4358 
4359  // Draw list sanity check. Detect mismatch between PrimReserve() calls and incrementing _VtxCurrentIdx, _VtxWritePtr etc.
4360  // May trigger for you if you are using PrimXXX functions incorrectly.
4361  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_VtxWritePtr == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4362  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size == 0 || draw_list->_IdxWritePtr == draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data + draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size);
4363  if (!(draw_list->Flags & ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset))
4364  IM_ASSERT((int)draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx == draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size);
4365 
4366  // Check that draw_list doesn't use more vertices than indexable (default ImDrawIdx = unsigned short = 2 bytes = 64K vertices per ImDrawList = per window)
4367  // If this assert triggers because you are drawing lots of stuff manually:
4368  // - First, make sure you are coarse clipping yourself and not trying to draw many things outside visible bounds.
4369  // Be mindful that the ImDrawList API doesn't filter vertices. Use the Metrics/Debugger window to inspect draw list contents.
4370  // - If you want large meshes with more than 64K vertices, you can either:
4371  // (A) Handle the ImDrawCmd::VtxOffset value in your renderer backend, and set 'io.BackendFlags |= ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset'.
4372  // Most example backends already support this from 1.71. Pre-1.71 backends won't.
4373  // Some graphics API such as GL ES 1/2 don't have a way to offset the starting vertex so it is not supported for them.
4374  // (B) Or handle 32-bit indices in your renderer backend, and uncomment '#define ImDrawIdx unsigned int' line in imconfig.h.
4375  // Most example backends already support this. For example, the OpenGL example code detect index size at compile-time:
4376  // glDrawElements(GL_TRIANGLES, (GLsizei)pcmd->ElemCount, sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2 ? GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT : GL_UNSIGNED_INT, idx_buffer_offset);
4377  // Your own engine or render API may use different parameters or function calls to specify index sizes.
4378  // 2 and 4 bytes indices are generally supported by most graphics API.
4379  // - If for some reason neither of those solutions works for you, a workaround is to call BeginChild()/EndChild() before reaching
4380  // the 64K limit to split your draw commands in multiple draw lists.
4381  if (sizeof(ImDrawIdx) == 2)
4382  IM_ASSERT(draw_list->_VtxCurrentIdx < (1 << 16) && "Too many vertices in ImDrawList using 16-bit indices. Read comment above");
4383 
4384  out_list->push_back(draw_list);
4385 }
4386 
4387 static void AddWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow *window, int layer)
4388 {
4389  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4390  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[0];
4391  g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows++;
4392  AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer], window->DrawList);
4393  for (int i = 0; i < window->DC.ChildWindows.Size; i++)
4394  {
4395  ImGuiWindow *child = window->DC.ChildWindows[i];
4396  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(child)) // Clipped children may have been marked not active
4397  AddWindowToDrawData(child, layer);
4398  }
4399 }
4400 
4401 // Layer is locked for the root window, however child windows may use a different viewport (e.g. extruding menu)
4402 static void AddRootWindowToDrawData(ImGuiWindow *window)
4403 {
4404  int layer = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? 1 : 0;
4405  AddWindowToDrawData(window, layer);
4406 }
4407 
4408 void ImDrawDataBuilder::FlattenIntoSingleLayer()
4409 {
4410  int n = Layers[0].Size;
4411  int size = n;
4412  for (int i = 1; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); i++)
4413  size += Layers[i].Size;
4414  Layers[0].resize(size);
4415  for (int layer_n = 1; layer_n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(Layers); layer_n++)
4416  {
4417  ImVector<ImDrawList *> &layer = Layers[layer_n];
4418  if (layer.empty())
4419  continue;
4420  memcpy(&Layers[0][n], &layer[0], layer.Size * sizeof(ImDrawList *));
4421  n += layer.Size;
4422  layer.resize(0);
4423  }
4424 }
4425 
4426 static void SetupViewportDrawData(ImGuiViewportP *viewport, ImVector<ImDrawList *> *draw_lists)
4427 {
4428  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
4429  ImDrawData *draw_data = &viewport->DrawDataP;
4430  draw_data->Valid = true;
4431  draw_data->CmdLists = (draw_lists->Size > 0) ? draw_lists->Data : NULL;
4432  draw_data->CmdListsCount = draw_lists->Size;
4433  draw_data->TotalVtxCount = draw_data->TotalIdxCount = 0;
4434  draw_data->DisplayPos = viewport->Pos;
4435  draw_data->DisplaySize = viewport->Size;
4436  draw_data->FramebufferScale = io.DisplayFramebufferScale;
4437  for (int n = 0; n < draw_lists->Size; n++)
4438  {
4439  draw_data->TotalVtxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->VtxBuffer.Size;
4440  draw_data->TotalIdxCount += draw_lists->Data[n]->IdxBuffer.Size;
4441  }
4442 }
4443 
4444 // Push a clipping rectangle for both ImGui logic (hit-testing etc.) and low-level ImDrawList rendering.
4445 // - When using this function it is sane to ensure that float are perfectly rounded to integer values,
4446 // so that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render produce correct result.
4447 // - If the code here changes, may need to update code of functions like NextColumn() and PushColumnClipRect():
4448 // some frequently called functions which to modify both channels and clipping simultaneously tend to use the
4449 // more specialized SetWindowClipRectBeforeSetChannel() to avoid extraneous updates of underlying ImDrawCmds.
4450 void ImGui::PushClipRect(const ImVec2 &clip_rect_min, const ImVec2 &clip_rect_max, bool intersect_with_current_clip_rect)
4451 {
4452  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
4453  window->DrawList->PushClipRect(clip_rect_min, clip_rect_max, intersect_with_current_clip_rect);
4454  window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4455 }
4456 
4457 void ImGui::PopClipRect()
4458 {
4459  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
4460  window->DrawList->PopClipRect();
4461  window->ClipRect = window->DrawList->_ClipRectStack.back();
4462 }
4463 
4464 // This is normally called by Render(). You may want to call it directly if you want to avoid calling Render() but the gain will be very minimal.
4465 void ImGui::EndFrame()
4466 {
4467  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4468  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4469 
4470  // Don't process EndFrame() multiple times.
4471  if (g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount)
4472  return;
4473  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope && "Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()?");
4474 
4475  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePre);
4476 
4477  ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks();
4478 
4479  // Notify OS when our Input Method Editor cursor has moved (e.g. CJK inputs using Microsoft IME)
4480  if (g.IO.ImeSetInputScreenPosFn && (g.PlatformImeLastPos.x == FLT_MAX || ImLengthSqr(g.PlatformImeLastPos - g.PlatformImePos) > 0.0001f))
4481  {
4482  g.IO.ImeSetInputScreenPosFn((int)g.PlatformImePos.x, (int)g.PlatformImePos.y);
4483  g.PlatformImeLastPos = g.PlatformImePos;
4484  }
4485 
4486  // Hide implicit/fallback "Debug" window if it hasn't been used
4487  g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow = false;
4488  if (g.CurrentWindow && !g.CurrentWindow->WriteAccessed)
4489  g.CurrentWindow->Active = false;
4490  End();
4491 
4492  // Update navigation: CTRL+Tab, wrap-around requests
4493  NavEndFrame();
4494 
4495  // Drag and Drop: Elapse payload (if delivered, or if source stops being submitted)
4496  if (g.DragDropActive)
4497  {
4498  bool is_delivered = g.DragDropPayload.Delivery;
4499  bool is_elapsed = (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount + 1 < g.FrameCount) && ((g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAutoExpirePayload) || !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton));
4500  if (is_delivered || is_elapsed)
4501  ClearDragDrop();
4502  }
4503 
4504  // Drag and Drop: Fallback for source tooltip. This is not ideal but better than nothing.
4505  if (g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropSourceFrameCount < g.FrameCount && !(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
4506  {
4507  g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
4508  SetTooltip("...");
4509  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
4510  }
4511 
4512  // End frame
4513  g.WithinFrameScope = false;
4514  g.FrameCountEnded = g.FrameCount;
4515 
4516  // Initiate moving window + handle left-click and right-click focus
4517  UpdateMouseMovingWindowEndFrame();
4518 
4519  // Sort the window list so that all child windows are after their parent
4520  // We cannot do that on FocusWindow() because children may not exist yet
4521  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.resize(0);
4522  g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.reserve(g.Windows.Size);
4523  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
4524  {
4525  ImGuiWindow *window = g.Windows[i];
4526  if (window->Active && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // if a child is active its parent will add it
4527  continue;
4528  AddWindowToSortBuffer(&g.WindowsTempSortBuffer, window);
4529  }
4530 
4531  // This usually assert if there is a mismatch between the ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow / ParentWindow values and DC.ChildWindows[] in parents, aka we've done something wrong.
4532  IM_ASSERT(g.Windows.Size == g.WindowsTempSortBuffer.Size);
4533  g.Windows.swap(g.WindowsTempSortBuffer);
4534  g.IO.MetricsActiveWindows = g.WindowsActiveCount;
4535 
4536  // Unlock font atlas
4537  g.IO.Fonts->Locked = false;
4538 
4539  // Clear Input data for next frame
4540  g.IO.MouseWheel = g.IO.MouseWheelH = 0.0f;
4541  g.IO.InputQueueCharacters.resize(0);
4542  g.IO.KeyModsPrev = g.IO.KeyMods; // doing it here is better than in NewFrame() as we'll tolerate backend writing to KeyMods. If we want to firmly disallow it we should detect it.
4543  memset(g.IO.NavInputs, 0, sizeof(g.IO.NavInputs));
4544 
4545  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_EndFramePost);
4546 }
4547 
4548 // Prepare the data for rendering so you can call GetDrawData()
4549 // (As with anything within the ImGui:: namspace this doesn't touch your GPU or graphics API at all:
4550 // it is the role of the ImGui_ImplXXXX_RenderDrawData() function provided by the renderer backend)
4551 void ImGui::Render()
4552 {
4553  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4554  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
4555 
4556  if (g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount)
4557  EndFrame();
4558  g.FrameCountRendered = g.FrameCount;
4559  g.IO.MetricsRenderWindows = 0;
4560 
4561  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPre);
4562 
4563  // Add background ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
4564  for (int n = 0; n != g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4565  {
4566  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4567  viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Clear();
4568  if (viewport->DrawLists[0] != NULL)
4569  AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetBackgroundDrawList(viewport));
4570  }
4571 
4572  // Add ImDrawList to render
4573  ImGuiWindow *windows_to_render_top_most[2];
4574  windows_to_render_top_most[0] = (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)) ? g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow : NULL;
4575  windows_to_render_top_most[1] = (g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingListWindow : NULL);
4576  for (int n = 0; n != g.Windows.Size; n++)
4577  {
4578  ImGuiWindow *window = g.Windows[n];
4579  IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(6011); // Static Analysis false positive "warning C6011: Dereferencing NULL pointer 'window'"
4580  if (IsWindowActiveAndVisible(window) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) == 0 && window != windows_to_render_top_most[0] && window != windows_to_render_top_most[1])
4581  AddRootWindowToDrawData(window);
4582  }
4583  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(windows_to_render_top_most); n++)
4584  if (windows_to_render_top_most[n] && IsWindowActiveAndVisible(windows_to_render_top_most[n])) // NavWindowingTarget is always temporarily displayed as the top-most window
4585  AddRootWindowToDrawData(windows_to_render_top_most[n]);
4586 
4587  // Setup ImDrawData structures for end-user
4588  g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices = g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices = 0;
4589  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
4590  {
4591  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[n];
4592  viewport->DrawDataBuilder.FlattenIntoSingleLayer();
4593 
4594  // Draw software mouse cursor if requested by io.MouseDrawCursor flag
4595  if (g.IO.MouseDrawCursor)
4596  RenderMouseCursor(GetForegroundDrawList(viewport), g.IO.MousePos, g.Style.MouseCursorScale, g.MouseCursor, IM_COL32_WHITE, IM_COL32_BLACK, IM_COL32(0, 0, 0, 48));
4597 
4598  // Add foreground ImDrawList (for each active viewport)
4599  if (viewport->DrawLists[1] != NULL)
4600  AddDrawListToDrawData(&viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0], GetForegroundDrawList(viewport));
4601 
4602  SetupViewportDrawData(viewport, &viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[0]);
4603  ImDrawData *draw_data = &viewport->DrawDataP;
4604  g.IO.MetricsRenderVertices += draw_data->TotalVtxCount;
4605  g.IO.MetricsRenderIndices += draw_data->TotalIdxCount;
4606  }
4607 
4608  CallContextHooks(&g, ImGuiContextHookType_RenderPost);
4609 }
4610 
4611 // Calculate text size. Text can be multi-line. Optionally ignore text after a ## marker.
4612 // CalcTextSize("") should return ImVec2(0.0f, g.FontSize)
4613 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcTextSize(const char *text, const char *text_end, bool hide_text_after_double_hash, float wrap_width)
4614 {
4615  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4616 
4617  const char *text_display_end;
4618  if (hide_text_after_double_hash)
4619  text_display_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end); // Hide anything after a '##' string
4620  else
4621  text_display_end = text_end;
4622 
4623  ImFont *font = g.Font;
4624  const float font_size = g.FontSize;
4625  if (text == text_display_end)
4626  return ImVec2(0.0f, font_size);
4627  ImVec2 text_size = font->CalcTextSizeA(font_size, FLT_MAX, wrap_width, text, text_display_end, NULL);
4628 
4629  // Round
4630  // FIXME: This has been here since Dec 2015 (7b0bf230) but down the line we want this out.
4631  // FIXME: Investigate using ceilf or e.g.
4632  // - https://git.musl-libc.org/cgit/musl/tree/src/math/ceilf.c
4633  // - https://embarkstudios.github.io/rust-gpu/api/src/libm/math/ceilf.rs.html
4634  text_size.x = IM_FLOOR(text_size.x + 0.99999f);
4635 
4636  return text_size;
4637 }
4638 
4639 // Find window given position, search front-to-back
4640 // FIXME: Note that we have an inconsequential lag here: OuterRectClipped is updated in Begin(), so windows moved programmatically
4641 // with SetWindowPos() and not SetNextWindowPos() will have that rectangle lagging by a frame at the time FindHoveredWindow() is
4642 // called, aka before the next Begin(). Moving window isn't affected.
4643 static void FindHoveredWindow()
4644 {
4645  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4646 
4647  ImGuiWindow *hovered_window = NULL;
4648  ImGuiWindow *hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = NULL;
4649  if (g.MovingWindow && !(g.MovingWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs))
4650  hovered_window = g.MovingWindow;
4651 
4652  ImVec2 padding_regular = g.Style.TouchExtraPadding;
4653  ImVec2 padding_for_resize = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? g.WindowsHoverPadding : padding_regular;
4654  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
4655  {
4656  ImGuiWindow *window = g.Windows[i];
4657  IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(28182); // [Static Analyzer] Dereferencing NULL pointer.
4658  if (!window->Active || window->Hidden)
4659  continue;
4660  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs)
4661  continue;
4662 
4663  // Using the clipped AABB, a child window will typically be clipped by its parent (not always)
4664  ImRect bb(window->OuterRectClipped);
4665  if (window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
4666  bb.Expand(padding_regular);
4667  else
4668  bb.Expand(padding_for_resize);
4669  if (!bb.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4670  continue;
4671 
4672  // Support for one rectangular hole in any given window
4673  // FIXME: Consider generalizing hit-testing override (with more generic data, callback, etc.) (#1512)
4674  if (window->HitTestHoleSize.x != 0)
4675  {
4676  ImVec2 hole_pos(window->Pos.x + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.x, window->Pos.y + (float)window->HitTestHoleOffset.y);
4677  ImVec2 hole_size((float)window->HitTestHoleSize.x, (float)window->HitTestHoleSize.y);
4678  if (ImRect(hole_pos, hole_pos + hole_size).Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4679  continue;
4680  }
4681 
4682  if (hovered_window == NULL)
4683  hovered_window = window;
4684  IM_MSVC_WARNING_SUPPRESS(28182); // [Static Analyzer] Dereferencing NULL pointer.
4685  if (hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window == NULL && (!g.MovingWindow || window->RootWindow != g.MovingWindow->RootWindow))
4686  hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window = window;
4687  if (hovered_window && hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window)
4688  break;
4689  }
4690 
4691  g.HoveredWindow = hovered_window;
4692  g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow = hovered_window_ignoring_moving_window;
4693 }
4694 
4695 // Test if mouse cursor is hovering given rectangle
4696 // NB- Rectangle is clipped by our current clip setting
4697 // NB- Expand the rectangle to be generous on imprecise inputs systems (g.Style.TouchExtraPadding)
4698 bool ImGui::IsMouseHoveringRect(const ImVec2 &r_min, const ImVec2 &r_max, bool clip)
4699 {
4700  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4701 
4702  // Clip
4703  ImRect rect_clipped(r_min, r_max);
4704  if (clip)
4705  rect_clipped.ClipWith(g.CurrentWindow->ClipRect);
4706 
4707  // Expand for touch input
4708  const ImRect rect_for_touch(rect_clipped.Min - g.Style.TouchExtraPadding, rect_clipped.Max + g.Style.TouchExtraPadding);
4709  if (!rect_for_touch.Contains(g.IO.MousePos))
4710  return false;
4711  return true;
4712 }
4713 
4714 int ImGui::GetKeyIndex(ImGuiKey imgui_key)
4715 {
4716  IM_ASSERT(imgui_key >= 0 && imgui_key < ImGuiKey_COUNT);
4717  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4718  return g.IO.KeyMap[imgui_key];
4719 }
4720 
4721 // Note that dear imgui doesn't know the semantic of each entry of io.KeysDown[]!
4722 // Use your own indices/enums according to how your backend/engine stored them into io.KeysDown[]!
4723 bool ImGui::IsKeyDown(int user_key_index)
4724 {
4725  if (user_key_index < 0)
4726  return false;
4727  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4728  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4729  return g.IO.KeysDown[user_key_index];
4730 }
4731 
4732 // t0 = previous time (e.g.: g.Time - g.IO.Time)
4733 // t1 = current time (e.g.: g.Time)
4734 // An event is triggered at:
4735 // t = 0.0f t = repeat_delay, t = repeat_delay + repeat_rate*N
4736 int ImGui::CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(float t0, float t1, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
4737 {
4738  if (t1 == 0.0f)
4739  return 1;
4740  if (t0 >= t1)
4741  return 0;
4742  if (repeat_rate <= 0.0f)
4743  return (t0 < repeat_delay) && (t1 >= repeat_delay);
4744  const int count_t0 = (t0 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t0 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
4745  const int count_t1 = (t1 < repeat_delay) ? -1 : (int)((t1 - repeat_delay) / repeat_rate);
4746  const int count = count_t1 - count_t0;
4747  return count;
4748 }
4749 
4750 int ImGui::GetKeyPressedAmount(int key_index, float repeat_delay, float repeat_rate)
4751 {
4752  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4753  if (key_index < 0)
4754  return 0;
4755  IM_ASSERT(key_index >= 0 && key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4756  const float t = g.IO.KeysDownDuration[key_index];
4757  return CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.Time, t, repeat_delay, repeat_rate);
4758 }
4759 
4760 bool ImGui::IsKeyPressed(int user_key_index, bool repeat)
4761 {
4762  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4763  if (user_key_index < 0)
4764  return false;
4765  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4766  const float t = g.IO.KeysDownDuration[user_key_index];
4767  if (t == 0.0f)
4768  return true;
4769  if (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay)
4770  return GetKeyPressedAmount(user_key_index, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate) > 0;
4771  return false;
4772 }
4773 
4774 bool ImGui::IsKeyReleased(int user_key_index)
4775 {
4776  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4777  if (user_key_index < 0) return false;
4778  IM_ASSERT(user_key_index >= 0 && user_key_index < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown));
4779  return g.IO.KeysDownDurationPrev[user_key_index] >= 0.0f && !g.IO.KeysDown[user_key_index];
4780 }
4781 
4782 bool ImGui::IsMouseDown(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4783 {
4784  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4785  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4786  return g.IO.MouseDown[button];
4787 }
4788 
4789 bool ImGui::IsMouseClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button, bool repeat)
4790 {
4791  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4792  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4793  const float t = g.IO.MouseDownDuration[button];
4794  if (t == 0.0f)
4795  return true;
4796 
4797  if (repeat && t > g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay)
4798  {
4799  // FIXME: 2019/05/03: Our old repeat code was wrong here and led to doubling the repeat rate, which made it an ok rate for repeat on mouse hold.
4800  int amount = CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.Time, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.50f);
4801  if (amount > 0)
4802  return true;
4803  }
4804  return false;
4805 }
4806 
4807 bool ImGui::IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4808 {
4809  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4810  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4811  return g.IO.MouseReleased[button];
4812 }
4813 
4814 bool ImGui::IsMouseDoubleClicked(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4815 {
4816  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4817  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4818  return g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[button];
4819 }
4820 
4821 // Return if a mouse click/drag went past the given threshold. Valid to call during the MouseReleased frame.
4822 // [Internal] This doesn't test if the button is pressed
4823 bool ImGui::IsMouseDragPastThreshold(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4824 {
4825  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4826  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4827  if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
4828  lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
4829  return g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold;
4830 }
4831 
4832 bool ImGui::IsMouseDragging(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4833 {
4834  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4835  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4836  if (!g.IO.MouseDown[button])
4837  return false;
4838  return IsMouseDragPastThreshold(button, lock_threshold);
4839 }
4840 
4841 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePos()
4842 {
4843  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4844  return g.IO.MousePos;
4845 }
4846 
4847 // NB: prefer to call right after BeginPopup(). At the time Selectable/MenuItem is activated, the popup is already closed!
4848 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup()
4849 {
4850  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4851  if (g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0)
4852  return g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1].OpenMousePos;
4853  return g.IO.MousePos;
4854 }
4855 
4856 // We typically use ImVec2(-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote an invalid mouse position.
4857 bool ImGui::IsMousePosValid(const ImVec2 *mouse_pos)
4858 {
4859  // The assert is only to silence a false-positive in XCode Static Analysis.
4860  // Because GImGui is not dereferenced in every code path, the static analyzer assume that it may be NULL (which it doesn't for other functions).
4861  IM_ASSERT(GImGui != NULL);
4862  const float MOUSE_INVALID = -256000.0f;
4863  ImVec2 p = mouse_pos ? *mouse_pos : GImGui->IO.MousePos;
4864  return p.x >= MOUSE_INVALID && p.y >= MOUSE_INVALID;
4865 }
4866 
4867 bool ImGui::IsAnyMouseDown()
4868 {
4869  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4870  for (int n = 0; n < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown); n++)
4871  if (g.IO.MouseDown[n])
4872  return true;
4873  return false;
4874 }
4875 
4876 // Return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is clicked or was just released.
4877 // This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once.
4878 // NB: This is only valid if IsMousePosValid(). backends in theory should always keep mouse position valid when dragging even outside the client window.
4879 ImVec2 ImGui::GetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button, float lock_threshold)
4880 {
4881  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4882  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4883  if (lock_threshold < 0.0f)
4884  lock_threshold = g.IO.MouseDragThreshold;
4885  if (g.IO.MouseDown[button] || g.IO.MouseReleased[button])
4886  if (g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr[button] >= lock_threshold * lock_threshold)
4887  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) && IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button]))
4888  return g.IO.MousePos - g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button];
4889  return ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
4890 }
4891 
4892 void ImGui::ResetMouseDragDelta(ImGuiMouseButton button)
4893 {
4894  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4895  IM_ASSERT(button >= 0 && button < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.MouseDown));
4896  // NB: We don't need to reset g.IO.MouseDragMaxDistanceSqr
4897  g.IO.MouseClickedPos[button] = g.IO.MousePos;
4898 }
4899 
4900 ImGuiMouseCursor ImGui::GetMouseCursor()
4901 {
4902  return GImGui->MouseCursor;
4903 }
4904 
4905 void ImGui::SetMouseCursor(ImGuiMouseCursor cursor_type)
4906 {
4907  GImGui->MouseCursor = cursor_type;
4908 }
4909 
4910 void ImGui::CaptureKeyboardFromApp(bool capture)
4911 {
4912  GImGui->WantCaptureKeyboardNextFrame = capture ? 1 : 0;
4913 }
4914 
4915 void ImGui::CaptureMouseFromApp(bool capture)
4916 {
4917  GImGui->WantCaptureMouseNextFrame = capture ? 1 : 0;
4918 }
4919 
4920 bool ImGui::IsItemActive()
4921 {
4922  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4923  if (g.ActiveId)
4924  return g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID;
4925  return false;
4926 }
4927 
4928 bool ImGui::IsItemActivated()
4929 {
4930  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4931  if (g.ActiveId)
4932  if (g.ActiveId == g.LastItemData.ID && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != g.LastItemData.ID)
4933  return true;
4934  return false;
4935 }
4936 
4937 bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivated()
4938 {
4939  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4940  if (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated)
4941  return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated) != 0;
4942  return (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame == g.LastItemData.ID && g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame != 0 && g.ActiveId != g.LastItemData.ID);
4943 }
4944 
4945 bool ImGui::IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit()
4946 {
4947  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4948  return IsItemDeactivated() && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameHasBeenEditedBefore || (g.ActiveId == 0 && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedBefore));
4949 }
4950 
4951 // == GetItemID() == GetFocusID()
4952 bool ImGui::IsItemFocused()
4953 {
4954  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4955  if (g.NavId != g.LastItemData.ID || g.NavId == 0)
4956  return false;
4957  return true;
4958 }
4959 
4960 // Important: this can be useful but it is NOT equivalent to the behavior of e.g.Button()!
4961 // Most widgets have specific reactions based on mouse-up/down state, mouse position etc.
4962 bool ImGui::IsItemClicked(ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button)
4963 {
4964  return IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_None);
4965 }

4970  return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledOpen) ? true : false;
4971 }

4976  return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_ToggledSelection) ? true : false;
4977 }
4978 
4979 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemHovered()
4980 {
4981  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4982  return g.HoveredId != 0 || g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame != 0;
4983 }
4984 
4985 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemActive()
4986 {
4987  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4988  return g.ActiveId != 0;
4989 }
4990 
4991 bool ImGui::IsAnyItemFocused()
4992 {
4993  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
4994  return g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight;
4995 }
4996 
4997 bool ImGui::IsItemVisible()
4998 {
4999  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5000  return g.CurrentWindow->ClipRect.Overlaps(g.LastItemData.Rect);
5001 }
5002 
5003 bool ImGui::IsItemEdited()
5004 {
5005  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5006  return (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited) != 0;
5007 }
5008 
5009 // Allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. Both may be activated during the same frame before the later one takes priority.
5010 // FIXME: Although this is exposed, its interaction and ideal idiom with using ImGuiButtonFlags_AllowItemOverlap flag are extremely confusing, need rework.
5011 void ImGui::SetItemAllowOverlap()
5012 {
5013  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5014  ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
5015  if (g.HoveredId == id)
5016  g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap = true;
5017  if (g.ActiveId == id)
5018  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = true;
5019 }
5020 
5021 void ImGui::SetItemUsingMouseWheel()
5022 {
5023  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5024  ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
5025  if (g.HoveredId == id)
5026  g.HoveredIdUsingMouseWheel = true;
5027  if (g.ActiveId == id)
5028  g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel = true;
5029 }
5030 
5031 void ImGui::SetActiveIdUsingNavAndKeys()
5032 {
5033  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5034  IM_ASSERT(g.ActiveId != 0);
5035  g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask = ~(ImU32)0;
5036  g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask = ~(ImU32)0;
5037  g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask = ~(ImU64)0;
5038  NavMoveRequestCancel();
5039 }

5044  return g.LastItemData.Rect.Min;

5053 ImVec2 ImGui::GetItemRectSize()
5054 {
5055  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5056  return g.LastItemData.Rect.GetSize();
5057 }
5058 
5059 bool ImGui::BeginChildEx(const char *name, ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5060 {
5061  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5062  ImGuiWindow *parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5063 
5064  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow;
5065  flags |= (parent_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove); // Inherit the NoMove flag
5066 
5067  // Size
5068  const ImVec2 content_avail = GetContentRegionAvail();
5069  ImVec2 size = ImFloor(size_arg);
5070  const int auto_fit_axises = ((size.x == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_X) : 0x00) | ((size.y == 0.0f) ? (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y) : 0x00);
5071  if (size.x <= 0.0f)
5072  size.x = ImMax(content_avail.x + size.x, 4.0f); // Arbitrary minimum child size (0.0f causing too much issues)
5073  if (size.y <= 0.0f)
5074  size.y = ImMax(content_avail.y + size.y, 4.0f);
5075  SetNextWindowSize(size);
5076 
5077  // Build up name. If you need to append to a same child from multiple location in the ID stack, use BeginChild(ImGuiID id) with a stable value.
5078  if (name)
5079  ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%s/%s_%08X", parent_window->Name, name, id);
5080  else
5081  ImFormatString(g.TempBuffer, IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.TempBuffer), "%s/%08X", parent_window->Name, id);
5082 
5083  const float backup_border_size = g.Style.ChildBorderSize;
5084  if (!border)
5085  g.Style.ChildBorderSize = 0.0f;
5086  bool ret = Begin(g.TempBuffer, NULL, flags);
5087  g.Style.ChildBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5088 
5089  ImGuiWindow *child_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5090  child_window->ChildId = id;
5091  child_window->AutoFitChildAxises = (ImS8)auto_fit_axises;
5092 
5093  // Set the cursor to handle case where the user called SetNextWindowPos()+BeginChild() manually.
5094  // While this is not really documented/defined, it seems that the expected thing to do.
5095  if (child_window->BeginCount == 1)
5096  parent_window->DC.CursorPos = child_window->Pos;
5097 
5098  // Process navigation-in immediately so NavInit can run on first frame
5099  if (g.NavActivateId == id && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened) && (child_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask != 0 || child_window->DC.NavHasScroll))
5100  {
5101  FocusWindow(child_window);
5102  NavInitWindow(child_window, false);
5103  SetActiveID(id + 1, child_window); // Steal ActiveId with another arbitrary id so that key-press won't activate child item
5104  g.ActiveIdSource = ImGuiInputSource_Nav;
5105  }
5106  return ret;
5107 }
5108 
5109 bool ImGui::BeginChild(const char *str_id, const ImVec2 &size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5110 {
5111  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
5112  return BeginChildEx(str_id, window->GetID(str_id), size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5113 }
5114 
5115 bool ImGui::BeginChild(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &size_arg, bool border, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5116 {
5117  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
5118  return BeginChildEx(NULL, id, size_arg, border, extra_flags);
5119 }
5120 
5121 void ImGui::EndChild()
5122 {
5123  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5124  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
5125 
5126  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
5127  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow); // Mismatched BeginChild()/EndChild() calls
5128 
5129  g.WithinEndChild = true;
5130  if (window->BeginCount > 1)
5131  {
5132  End();
5133  }
5134  else
5135  {
5136  ImVec2 sz = window->Size;
5137  if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_X)) // Arbitrary minimum zero-ish child size of 4.0f causes less trouble than a 0.0f
5138  sz.x = ImMax(4.0f, sz.x);
5139  if (window->AutoFitChildAxises & (1 << ImGuiAxis_Y))
5140  sz.y = ImMax(4.0f, sz.y);
5141  End();
5142 
5143  ImGuiWindow *parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
5144  ImRect bb(parent_window->DC.CursorPos, parent_window->DC.CursorPos + sz);
5145  ItemSize(sz);
5146  if ((window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask != 0 || window->DC.NavHasScroll) && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
5147  {
5148  ItemAdd(bb, window->ChildId);
5149  RenderNavHighlight(bb, window->ChildId);
5150 
5151  // When browsing a window that has no activable items (scroll only) we keep a highlight on the child
5152  if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0 && window == g.NavWindow)
5153  RenderNavHighlight(ImRect(bb.Min - ImVec2(2, 2), bb.Max + ImVec2(2, 2)), g.NavId, ImGuiNavHighlightFlags_TypeThin);
5154  }
5155  else
5156  {
5157  // Not navigable into
5158  ItemAdd(bb, 0);
5159  }
5160  if (g.HoveredWindow == window)
5161  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
5162  }
5163  g.WithinEndChild = false;
5164  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
5165 }
5166 
5167 // Helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame.
5168 bool ImGui::BeginChildFrame(ImGuiID id, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags)
5169 {
5170  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5171  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
5172  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_ChildBg, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_FrameBg]);
5173  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildRounding, style.FrameRounding);
5174  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_ChildBorderSize, style.FrameBorderSize);
5175  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, style.FramePadding);
5176  bool ret = BeginChild(id, size, true, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | extra_flags);
5177  PopStyleVar(3);
5178  PopStyleColor();
5179  return ret;
5180 }
5181 
5182 void ImGui::EndChildFrame()
5183 {
5184  EndChild();
5185 }
5186 
5187 static void SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiCond flags, bool enabled)
5188 {
5189  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & ~flags);
5190  window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & ~flags);
5191  window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags = enabled ? (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags | flags) : (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & ~flags);
5192 }
5193 
5194 ImGuiWindow *ImGui::FindWindowByID(ImGuiID id)
5195 {
5196  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5197  return (ImGuiWindow *)g.WindowsById.GetVoidPtr(id);
5198 }
5199 
5200 ImGuiWindow *ImGui::FindWindowByName(const char *name)
5201 {
5202  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(name);
5203  return FindWindowByID(id);
5204 }
5205 
5206 static void ApplyWindowSettings(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindowSettings *settings)
5207 {
5208  window->Pos = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y));
5209  if (settings->Size.x > 0 && settings->Size.y > 0)
5210  window->Size = window->SizeFull = ImFloor(ImVec2(settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y));
5211  window->Collapsed = settings->Collapsed;
5212 }
5213 
5214 static ImGuiWindow *CreateNewWindow(const char *name, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5215 {
5216  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5217  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("CreateNewWindow '%s', flags = 0x%08X\n", name, flags);
5218 
5219  // Create window the first time
5220  ImGuiWindow *window = IM_NEW(ImGuiWindow)(&g, name);
5221  window->Flags = flags;
5222  g.WindowsById.SetVoidPtr(window->ID, window);
5223 
5224  // Default/arbitrary window position. Use SetNextWindowPos() with the appropriate condition flag to change the initial position of a window.
5225  const ImGuiViewport *main_viewport = ImGui::GetMainViewport();
5226  window->Pos = main_viewport->Pos + ImVec2(60, 60);
5227 
5228  // User can disable loading and saving of settings. Tooltip and child windows also don't store settings.
5229  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
5230  if (ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID))
5231  {
5232  // Retrieve settings from .ini file
5233  window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
5234  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, false);
5235  ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
5236  }
5237  window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->Pos; // So first call to CalcContentSize() doesn't return crazy values
5238 
5239  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) != 0)
5240  {
5241  window->AutoFitFramesX = window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5242  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
5243  }
5244  else
5245  {
5246  if (window->Size.x <= 0.0f)
5247  window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
5248  if (window->Size.y <= 0.0f)
5249  window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
5250  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0) || (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0);
5251  }
5252 
5253  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
5254  {
5255  g.WindowsFocusOrder.push_back(window);
5256  window->FocusOrder = (short)(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1);
5257  }
5258 
5259  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus)
5260  g.Windows.push_front(window); // Quite slow but rare and only once
5261  else
5262  g.Windows.push_back(window);
5263  return window;
5264 }
5265 
5266 static ImVec2 CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &size_desired)
5267 {
5268  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5269  ImVec2 new_size = size_desired;
5270  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint)
5271  {
5272  // Using -1,-1 on either X/Y axis to preserve the current size.
5273  ImRect cr = g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect;
5274  new_size.x = (cr.Min.x >= 0 && cr.Max.x >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.x, cr.Min.x, cr.Max.x) : window->SizeFull.x;
5275  new_size.y = (cr.Min.y >= 0 && cr.Max.y >= 0) ? ImClamp(new_size.y, cr.Min.y, cr.Max.y) : window->SizeFull.y;
5276  if (g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback)
5277  {
5278  ImGuiSizeCallbackData data;
5279  data.UserData = g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData;
5280  data.Pos = window->Pos;
5281  data.CurrentSize = window->SizeFull;
5282  data.DesiredSize = new_size;
5283  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback(&data);
5284  new_size = data.DesiredSize;
5285  }
5286  new_size.x = IM_FLOOR(new_size.x);
5287  new_size.y = IM_FLOOR(new_size.y);
5288  }
5289 
5290  // Minimum size
5291  if (!(window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)))
5292  {
5293  ImGuiWindow *window_for_height = window;
5294  const float decoration_up_height = window_for_height->TitleBarHeight() + window_for_height->MenuBarHeight();
5295  new_size = ImMax(new_size, g.Style.WindowMinSize);
5296  new_size.y = ImMax(new_size.y, decoration_up_height + ImMax(0.0f, g.Style.WindowRounding - 1.0f)); // Reduce artifacts with very small windows
5297  }
5298  return new_size;
5299 }
5300 
5301 static void CalcWindowContentSizes(ImGuiWindow *window, ImVec2 *content_size_current, ImVec2 *content_size_ideal)
5302 {
5303  bool preserve_old_content_sizes = false;
5304  if (window->Collapsed && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
5305  preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5306  else if (window->Hidden && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0 && window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
5307  preserve_old_content_sizes = true;
5308  if (preserve_old_content_sizes)
5309  {
5310  *content_size_current = window->ContentSize;
5311  *content_size_ideal = window->ContentSizeIdeal;
5312  return;
5313  }
5314 
5315  content_size_current->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5316  content_size_current->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5317  content_size_ideal->x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.x) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.x);
5318  content_size_ideal->y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f) ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : IM_FLOOR(ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.IdealMaxPos.y) - window->DC.CursorStartPos.y);
5319 }
5320 
5321 static ImVec2 CalcWindowAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &size_contents)
5322 {
5323  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5324  ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
5325  const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
5326  ImVec2 size_pad = window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
5327  ImVec2 size_desired = size_contents + size_pad + ImVec2(0.0f, decoration_up_height);
5328  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
5329  {
5330  // Tooltip always resize
5331  return size_desired;
5332  }
5333  else
5334  {
5335  // Maximum window size is determined by the viewport size or monitor size
5336  const bool is_popup = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0;
5337  const bool is_menu = (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0;
5338  ImVec2 size_min = style.WindowMinSize;
5339  if (is_popup || is_menu) // Popups and menus bypass style.WindowMinSize by default, but we give then a non-zero minimum size to facilitate understanding problematic cases (e.g. empty popups)
5340  size_min = ImMin(size_min, ImVec2(4.0f, 4.0f));
5341 
5342  // FIXME-VIEWPORT-WORKAREA: May want to use GetWorkSize() instead of Size depending on the type of windows?
5343  ImVec2 avail_size = ImGui::GetMainViewport()->Size;
