5344  ImVec2 size_auto_fit = ImClamp(size_desired, size_min, ImMax(size_min, avail_size - style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding * 2.0f));
5345 
5346  // When the window cannot fit all contents (either because of constraints, either because screen is too small),
5347  // we are growing the size on the other axis to compensate for expected scrollbar. FIXME: Might turn bigger than ViewportSize-WindowPadding.
5348  ImVec2 size_auto_fit_after_constraint = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5349  bool will_have_scrollbar_x = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.x - size_pad.x - 0.0f < size_contents.x && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar);
5350  bool will_have_scrollbar_y = (size_auto_fit_after_constraint.y - size_pad.y - decoration_up_height < size_contents.y && !(window->Flags &ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar)) || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar);
5351  if (will_have_scrollbar_x)
5352  size_auto_fit.y += style.ScrollbarSize;
5353  if (will_have_scrollbar_y)
5354  size_auto_fit.x += style.ScrollbarSize;
5355  return size_auto_fit;
5356  }
5357 }
5358 
5359 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcWindowNextAutoFitSize(ImGuiWindow *window)
5360 {
5361  ImVec2 size_contents_current;
5362  ImVec2 size_contents_ideal;
5363  CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &size_contents_current, &size_contents_ideal);
5364  ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, size_contents_ideal);
5365  ImVec2 size_final = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5366  return size_final;
5367 }
5368 
5369 static ImGuiCol GetWindowBgColorIdxFromFlags(ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5370 {
5371  if (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup))
5372  return ImGuiCol_PopupBg;
5373  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
5374  return ImGuiCol_ChildBg;
5375  return ImGuiCol_WindowBg;
5376 }
5377 
5378 static void CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &corner_target, const ImVec2 &corner_norm, ImVec2 *out_pos, ImVec2 *out_size)
5379 {
5380  ImVec2 pos_min = ImLerp(corner_target, window->Pos, corner_norm); // Expected window upper-left
5381  ImVec2 pos_max = ImLerp(window->Pos + window->Size, corner_target, corner_norm); // Expected window lower-right
5382  ImVec2 size_expected = pos_max - pos_min;
5383  ImVec2 size_constrained = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_expected);
5384  *out_pos = pos_min;
5385  if (corner_norm.x == 0.0f)
5386  out_pos->x -= (size_constrained.x - size_expected.x);
5387  if (corner_norm.y == 0.0f)
5388  out_pos->y -= (size_constrained.y - size_expected.y);
5389  *out_size = size_constrained;
5390 }
5391 
5392 // Data for resizing from corner
5393 struct ImGuiResizeGripDef
5394 {
5395  ImVec2 CornerPosN;
5396  ImVec2 InnerDir;
5397  int AngleMin12, AngleMax12;
5398 };
5399 static const ImGuiResizeGripDef resize_grip_def[4] =
5400 {
5401  { ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(-1, -1), 0, 3 }, // Lower-right
5402  { ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(+1, -1), 3, 6 }, // Lower-left
5403  { ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(+1, +1), 6, 9 }, // Upper-left (Unused)
5404  { ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(-1, +1), 9, 12 } // Upper-right (Unused)
5405 };
5406 
5407 // Data for resizing from borders
5408 struct ImGuiResizeBorderDef
5409 {
5410  ImVec2 InnerDir;
5411  ImVec2 SegmentN1, SegmentN2;
5412  float OuterAngle;
5413 };
5414 static const ImGuiResizeBorderDef resize_border_def[4] =
5415 {
5416  { ImVec2(+1, 0), ImVec2(0, 1), ImVec2(0, 0), IM_PI * 1.00f }, // Left
5417  { ImVec2(-1, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), ImVec2(1, 1), IM_PI * 0.00f }, // Right
5418  { ImVec2(0, +1), ImVec2(0, 0), ImVec2(1, 0), IM_PI * 1.50f }, // Up
5419  { ImVec2(0, -1), ImVec2(1, 1), ImVec2(0, 1), IM_PI * 0.50f } // Down
5420 };
5421 
5422 static ImRect GetResizeBorderRect(ImGuiWindow *window, int border_n, float perp_padding, float thickness)
5423 {
5424  ImRect rect = window->Rect();
5425  if (thickness == 0.0f)
5426  rect.Max -= ImVec2(1, 1);
5427  if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Left)
5428  {
5429  return ImRect(rect.Min.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Min.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding);
5430  }
5431  if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Right)
5432  {
5433  return ImRect(rect.Max.x - thickness, rect.Min.y + perp_padding, rect.Max.x + thickness, rect.Max.y - perp_padding);
5434  }
5435  if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Up)
5436  {
5437  return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Min.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Min.y + thickness);
5438  }
5439  if (border_n == ImGuiDir_Down)
5440  {
5441  return ImRect(rect.Min.x + perp_padding, rect.Max.y - thickness, rect.Max.x - perp_padding, rect.Max.y + thickness);
5442  }
5443  IM_ASSERT(0);
5444  return ImRect();
5445 }
5446 
5447 // 0..3: corners (Lower-right, Lower-left, Unused, Unused)
5448 ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeCornerID(ImGuiWindow *window, int n)
5449 {
5450  IM_ASSERT(n >= 0 && n < 4);
5451  ImGuiID id = window->ID;
5452  id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5453  id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5454  return id;
5455 }
5456 
5457 // Borders (Left, Right, Up, Down)
5458 ImGuiID ImGui::GetWindowResizeBorderID(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiDir dir)
5459 {
5460  IM_ASSERT(dir >= 0 && dir < 4);
5461  int n = (int)dir + 4;
5462  ImGuiID id = window->ID;
5463  id = ImHashStr("#RESIZE", 0, id);
5464  id = ImHashData(&n, sizeof(int), id);
5465  return id;
5466 }
5467 
5468 // Handle resize for: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
5469 // Return true when using auto-fit (double click on resize grip)
5470 static bool ImGui::UpdateWindowManualResize(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &size_auto_fit, int *border_held, int resize_grip_count, ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], const ImRect &visibility_rect)
5471 {
5472  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5473  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5474 
5475  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize) || (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) || window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
5476  return false;
5477  if (window->WasActive == false) // Early out to avoid running this code for e.g. an hidden implicit/fallback Debug window.
5478  return false;
5479 
5480  bool ret_auto_fit = false;
5481  const int resize_border_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 4 : 0;
5482  const float grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.35f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
5483  const float grip_hover_inner_size = IM_FLOOR(grip_draw_size * 0.75f);
5484  const float grip_hover_outer_size = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING : 0.0f;
5485 
5486  ImVec2 pos_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5487  ImVec2 size_target(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
5488 
5489  // Resize grips and borders are on layer 1
5490  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5491 
5492  // Manual resize grips
5493  PushID("#RESIZE");
5494  for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5495  {
5496  const ImGuiResizeGripDef &def = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5497  const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, def.CornerPosN);
5498 
5499  // Using the FlattenChilds button flag we make the resize button accessible even if we are hovering over a child window
5500  bool hovered, held;
5501  ImRect resize_rect(corner - def.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, corner + def.InnerDir * grip_hover_inner_size);
5502  if (resize_rect.Min.x > resize_rect.Max.x) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.x, resize_rect.Max.x);
5503  if (resize_rect.Min.y > resize_rect.Max.y) ImSwap(resize_rect.Min.y, resize_rect.Max.y);
5504  ImGuiID resize_grip_id = window->GetID(resize_grip_n); // == GetWindowResizeCornerID()
5505  ButtonBehavior(resize_rect, resize_grip_id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren | ImGuiButtonFlags_NoNavFocus);
5506  //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(resize_rect.Min, resize_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5507  if (hovered || held)
5508  g.MouseCursor = (resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNESW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNWSE;
5509 
5510  if (held && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0] && resize_grip_n == 0)
5511  {
5512  // Manual auto-fit when double-clicking
5513  size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, size_auto_fit);
5514  ret_auto_fit = true;
5515  ClearActiveID();
5516  }
5517  else if (held)
5518  {
5519  // Resize from any of the four corners
5520  // We don't use an incremental MouseDelta but rather compute an absolute target size based on mouse position
5521  ImVec2 clamp_min = ImVec2(def.CornerPosN.x == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, def.CornerPosN.y == 1.0f ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5522  ImVec2 clamp_max = ImVec2(def.CornerPosN.x == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, def.CornerPosN.y == 0.0f ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5523  ImVec2 corner_target = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset + ImLerp(def.InnerDir * grip_hover_outer_size, def.InnerDir * -grip_hover_inner_size, def.CornerPosN); // Corner of the window corresponding to our corner grip
5524  corner_target = ImClamp(corner_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5525  CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, corner_target, def.CornerPosN, &pos_target, &size_target);
5526  }
5527 
5528  // Only lower-left grip is visible before hovering/activating
5529  if (resize_grip_n == 0 || held || hovered)
5530  resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n] = GetColorU32(held ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive : hovered ? ImGuiCol_ResizeGripHovered : ImGuiCol_ResizeGrip);
5531  }
5532  for (int border_n = 0; border_n < resize_border_count; border_n++)
5533  {
5534  const ImGuiResizeBorderDef &def = resize_border_def[border_n];
5535  const ImGuiAxis axis = (border_n == ImGuiDir_Left || border_n == ImGuiDir_Right) ? ImGuiAxis_X : ImGuiAxis_Y;
5536 
5537  bool hovered, held;
5538  ImRect border_rect = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_n, grip_hover_inner_size, WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING);
5539  ImGuiID border_id = window->GetID(border_n + 4); // == GetWindowResizeBorderID()
5540  ButtonBehavior(border_rect, border_id, &hovered, &held, ImGuiButtonFlags_FlattenChildren);
5541  //GetForegroundDrawLists(window)->AddRect(border_rect.Min, border_rect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
5542  if ((hovered && g.HoveredIdTimer > WINDOWS_RESIZE_FROM_EDGES_FEEDBACK_TIMER) || held)
5543  {
5544  g.MouseCursor = (axis == ImGuiAxis_X) ? ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeEW : ImGuiMouseCursor_ResizeNS;
5545  if (held)
5546  *border_held = border_n;
5547  }
5548  if (held)
5549  {
5550  ImVec2 clamp_min(border_n == ImGuiDir_Right ? visibility_rect.Min.x : -FLT_MAX, border_n == ImGuiDir_Down ? visibility_rect.Min.y : -FLT_MAX);
5551  ImVec2 clamp_max(border_n == ImGuiDir_Left ? visibility_rect.Max.x : +FLT_MAX, border_n == ImGuiDir_Up ? visibility_rect.Max.y : +FLT_MAX);
5552  ImVec2 border_target = window->Pos;
5553  border_target[axis] = g.IO.MousePos[axis] - g.ActiveIdClickOffset[axis] + WINDOWS_HOVER_PADDING;
5554  border_target = ImClamp(border_target, clamp_min, clamp_max);
5555  CalcResizePosSizeFromAnyCorner(window, border_target, ImMin(def.SegmentN1, def.SegmentN2), &pos_target, &size_target);
5556  }
5557  }
5558  PopID();
5559 
5560  // Restore nav layer
5561  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5562 
5563  // Navigation resize (keyboard/gamepad)
5564  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow == window)
5565  {
5566  ImVec2 nav_resize_delta;
5567  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard && g.IO.KeyShift)
5568  nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5569  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
5570  nav_resize_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
5571  if (nav_resize_delta.x != 0.0f || nav_resize_delta.y != 0.0f)
5572  {
5573  const float NAV_RESIZE_SPEED = 600.0f;
5574  nav_resize_delta *= ImFloor(NAV_RESIZE_SPEED * g.IO.Time * ImMin(g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, g.IO.DisplayFramebufferScale.y));
5575  nav_resize_delta = ImMax(nav_resize_delta, visibility_rect.Min - window->Pos - window->Size);
5576  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
5577  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
5578  resize_grip_col[0] = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_ResizeGripActive);
5579  // FIXME-NAV: Should store and accumulate into a separate size buffer to handle sizing constraints properly, right now a constraint will make us stuck.
5580  size_target = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull + nav_resize_delta);
5581  }
5582  }
5583 
5584  // Apply back modified position/size to window
5585  if (size_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5586  {
5587  window->SizeFull = size_target;
5588  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5589  }
5590  if (pos_target.x != FLT_MAX)
5591  {
5592  window->Pos = ImFloor(pos_target);
5593  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
5594  }
5595 
5596  window->Size = window->SizeFull;
5597  return ret_auto_fit;
5598 }
5599 
5600 static inline void ClampWindowRect(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &visibility_rect)
5601 {
5602  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5603  ImVec2 size_for_clamping = window->Size;
5604  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsMoveFromTitleBarOnly && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5605  size_for_clamping.y = window->TitleBarHeight();
5606  window->Pos = ImClamp(window->Pos, visibility_rect.Min - size_for_clamping, visibility_rect.Max);
5607 }
5608 
5609 static void ImGui::RenderWindowOuterBorders(ImGuiWindow *window)
5610 {
5611  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5612  float rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5613  float border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5614  if (border_size > 0.0f && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5615  window->DrawList->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), rounding, 0, border_size);
5616 
5617  int border_held = window->ResizeBorderHeld;
5618  if (border_held != -1)
5619  {
5620  const ImGuiResizeBorderDef &def = resize_border_def[border_held];
5621  ImRect border_r = GetResizeBorderRect(window, border_held, rounding, 0.0f);
5622  window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.SegmentN1) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle - IM_PI * 0.25f, def.OuterAngle);
5623  window->DrawList->PathArcTo(ImLerp(border_r.Min, border_r.Max, def.SegmentN2) + ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f) + def.InnerDir * rounding, rounding, def.OuterAngle, def.OuterAngle + IM_PI * 0.25f);
5624  window->DrawList->PathStroke(GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_SeparatorActive), 0, ImMax(2.0f, border_size)); // Thicker than usual
5625  }
5626  if (g.Style.FrameBorderSize > 0 && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5627  {
5628  float y = window->Pos.y + window->TitleBarHeight() - 1;
5629  window->DrawList->AddLine(ImVec2(window->Pos.x + border_size, y), ImVec2(window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - border_size, y), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), g.Style.FrameBorderSize);
5630  }
5631 }
5632 
5633 // Draw background and borders
5634 // Draw and handle scrollbars
5635 void ImGui::RenderWindowDecorations(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &title_bar_rect, bool title_bar_is_highlight, int resize_grip_count, const ImU32 resize_grip_col[4], float resize_grip_draw_size)
5636 {
5637  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5638  ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
5639  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5640 
5641  // Ensure that ScrollBar doesn't read last frame's SkipItems
5642  IM_ASSERT(window->BeginCount == 0);
5643  window->SkipItems = false;
5644 
5645  // Draw window + handle manual resize
5646  // As we highlight the title bar when want_focus is set, multiple reappearing windows will have have their title bar highlighted on their reappearing frame.
5647  const float window_rounding = window->WindowRounding;
5648  const float window_border_size = window->WindowBorderSize;
5649  if (window->Collapsed)
5650  {
5651  // Title bar only
5652  float backup_border_size = style.FrameBorderSize;
5653  g.Style.FrameBorderSize = window->WindowBorderSize;
5654  ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32((title_bar_is_highlight && !g.NavDisableHighlight) ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBgCollapsed);
5655  RenderFrame(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, true, window_rounding);
5656  g.Style.FrameBorderSize = backup_border_size;
5657  }
5658  else
5659  {
5660  // Window background
5661  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground))
5662  {
5663  ImU32 bg_col = GetColorU32(GetWindowBgColorIdxFromFlags(flags));
5664  bool override_alpha = false;
5665  float alpha = 1.0f;
5666  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasBgAlpha)
5667  {
5668  alpha = g.NextWindowData.BgAlphaVal;
5669  override_alpha = true;
5670  }
5671  if (override_alpha)
5672  bg_col = (bg_col & ~IM_COL32_A_MASK) | (IM_F32_TO_INT8_SAT(alpha) << IM_COL32_A_SHIFT);
5673  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(window->Pos + ImVec2(0, window->TitleBarHeight()), window->Pos + window->Size, bg_col, window_rounding, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? 0 : ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottom);
5674  }
5675 
5676  // Title bar
5677  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
5678  {
5679  ImU32 title_bar_col = GetColorU32(title_bar_is_highlight ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg);
5680  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, title_bar_col, window_rounding, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop);
5681  }
5682 
5683  // Menu bar
5684  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar)
5685  {
5686  ImRect menu_bar_rect = window->MenuBarRect();
5687  menu_bar_rect.ClipWith(window->Rect()); // Soft clipping, in particular child window don't have minimum size covering the menu bar so this is useful for them.
5688  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(menu_bar_rect.Min + ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), menu_bar_rect.Max - ImVec2(window_border_size, 0), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_MenuBarBg), (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) ? window_rounding : 0.0f, ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTop);
5689  if (style.FrameBorderSize > 0.0f && menu_bar_rect.Max.y < window->Pos.y + window->Size.y)
5690  window->DrawList->AddLine(menu_bar_rect.GetBL(), menu_bar_rect.GetBR(), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border), style.FrameBorderSize);
5691  }
5692 
5693  // Scrollbars
5694  if (window->ScrollbarX)
5695  Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_X);
5696  if (window->ScrollbarY)
5697  Scrollbar(ImGuiAxis_Y);
5698 
5699  // Render resize grips (after their input handling so we don't have a frame of latency)
5700  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize))
5701  {
5702  for (int resize_grip_n = 0; resize_grip_n < resize_grip_count; resize_grip_n++)
5703  {
5704  const ImGuiResizeGripDef &grip = resize_grip_def[resize_grip_n];
5705  const ImVec2 corner = ImLerp(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, grip.CornerPosN);
5706  window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size) : ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size)));
5707  window->DrawList->PathLineTo(corner + grip.InnerDir * ((resize_grip_n & 1) ? ImVec2(resize_grip_draw_size, window_border_size) : ImVec2(window_border_size, resize_grip_draw_size)));
5708  window->DrawList->PathArcToFast(ImVec2(corner.x + grip.InnerDir.x * (window_rounding + window_border_size), corner.y + grip.InnerDir.y * (window_rounding + window_border_size)), window_rounding, grip.AngleMin12, grip.AngleMax12);
5709  window->DrawList->PathFillConvex(resize_grip_col[resize_grip_n]);
5710  }
5711  }
5712 
5713  // Borders
5714  RenderWindowOuterBorders(window);
5715  }
5716 }
5717 
5718 // Render title text, collapse button, close button
5719 void ImGui::RenderWindowTitleBarContents(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &title_bar_rect, const char *name, bool *p_open)
5720 {
5721  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5722  ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
5723  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
5724 
5725  const bool has_close_button = (p_open != NULL);
5726  const bool has_collapse_button = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse) && (style.WindowMenuButtonPosition != ImGuiDir_None);
5727 
5728  // Close & Collapse button are on the Menu NavLayer and don't default focus (unless there's nothing else on that layer)
5729  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags_backup = g.CurrentItemFlags;
5730  g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus;
5731  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
5732 
5733  // Layout buttons
5734  // FIXME: Would be nice to generalize the subtleties expressed here into reusable code.
5735  float pad_l = style.FramePadding.x;
5736  float pad_r = style.FramePadding.x;
5737  float button_sz = g.FontSize;
5738  ImVec2 close_button_pos;
5739  ImVec2 collapse_button_pos;
5740  if (has_close_button)
5741  {
5742  pad_r += button_sz;
5743  close_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5744  }
5745  if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right)
5746  {
5747  pad_r += button_sz;
5748  collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5749  }
5750  if (has_collapse_button && style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left)
5751  {
5752  collapse_button_pos = ImVec2(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l - style.FramePadding.x, title_bar_rect.Min.y);
5753  pad_l += button_sz;
5754  }
5755 
5756  // Collapse button (submitting first so it gets priority when choosing a navigation init fallback)
5757  if (has_collapse_button)
5758  if (CollapseButton(window->GetID("#COLLAPSE"), collapse_button_pos))
5759  window->WantCollapseToggle = true; // Defer actual collapsing to next frame as we are too far in the Begin() function
5760 
5761  // Close button
5762  if (has_close_button)
5763  if (CloseButton(window->GetID("#CLOSE"), close_button_pos))
5764  *p_open = false;
5765 
5766  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
5767  g.CurrentItemFlags = item_flags_backup;
5768 
5769  // Title bar text (with: horizontal alignment, avoiding collapse/close button, optional "unsaved document" marker)
5770  // FIXME: Refactor text alignment facilities along with RenderText helpers, this is WAY too much messy code..
5771  const float marker_size_x = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument) ? button_sz * 0.80f : 0.0f;
5772  const ImVec2 text_size = CalcTextSize(name, NULL, true) + ImVec2(marker_size_x, 0.0f);
5773 
5774  // As a nice touch we try to ensure that centered title text doesn't get affected by visibility of Close/Collapse button,
5775  // while uncentered title text will still reach edges correctly.
5776  if (pad_l > style.FramePadding.x)
5777  pad_l += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5778  if (pad_r > style.FramePadding.x)
5779  pad_r += g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x;
5780  if (style.WindowTitleAlign.x > 0.0f && style.WindowTitleAlign.x < 1.0f)
5781  {
5782  float centerness = ImSaturate(1.0f - ImFabs(style.WindowTitleAlign.x - 0.5f) * 2.0f); // 0.0f on either edges, 1.0f on center
5783  float pad_extend = ImMin(ImMax(pad_l, pad_r), title_bar_rect.GetWidth() - pad_l - pad_r - text_size.x);
5784  pad_l = ImMax(pad_l, pad_extend * centerness);
5785  pad_r = ImMax(pad_r, pad_extend * centerness);
5786  }
5787 
5788  ImRect layout_r(title_bar_rect.Min.x + pad_l, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - pad_r, title_bar_rect.Max.y);
5789  ImRect clip_r(layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Min.y, ImMin(layout_r.Max.x + g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x, title_bar_rect.Max.x), layout_r.Max.y);
5790  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_UnsavedDocument)
5791  {
5792  ImVec2 marker_pos;
5793  marker_pos.x = ImClamp(layout_r.Min.x + (layout_r.GetWidth() - text_size.x) * style.WindowTitleAlign.x + text_size.x, layout_r.Min.x, layout_r.Max.x);
5794  marker_pos.y = (layout_r.Min.y + layout_r.Max.y) * 0.5f;
5795  if (marker_pos.x > layout_r.Min.x)
5796  {
5797  RenderBullet(window->DrawList, marker_pos, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text));
5798  clip_r.Max.x = ImMin(clip_r.Max.x, marker_pos.x - (int)(marker_size_x * 0.5f));
5799  }
5800  }
5801  //if (g.IO.KeyShift) window->DrawList->AddRect(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
5802  //if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) window->DrawList->AddRect(clip_r.Min, clip_r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 128, 0, 255)); // [DEBUG]
5803  RenderTextClipped(layout_r.Min, layout_r.Max, name, NULL, &text_size, style.WindowTitleAlign, &clip_r);
5804 }
5805 
5806 void ImGui::UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindowFlags flags, ImGuiWindow *parent_window)
5807 {
5808  window->ParentWindow = parent_window;
5809  window->RootWindow = window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = window->RootWindowForNav = window;
5810  if (parent_window && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip))
5811  window->RootWindow = parent_window->RootWindow;
5812  if (parent_window && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)))
5813  window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight = parent_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight;
5814  while (window->RootWindowForNav->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
5815  {
5816  IM_ASSERT(window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow != NULL);
5817  window->RootWindowForNav = window->RootWindowForNav->ParentWindow;
5818  }
5819 }
5820 
5821 // Push a new Dear ImGui window to add widgets to.
5822 // - A default window called "Debug" is automatically stacked at the beginning of every frame so you can use widgets without explicitly calling a Begin/End pair.
5823 // - Begin/End can be called multiple times during the frame with the same window name to append content.
5824 // - The window name is used as a unique identifier to preserve window information across frames (and save rudimentary information to the .ini file).
5825 // You can use the "##" or "###" markers to use the same label with different id, or same id with different label. See documentation at the top of this file.
5826 // - Return false when window is collapsed, so you can early out in your code. You always need to call ImGui::End() even if false is returned.
5827 // - Passing 'bool* p_open' displays a Close button on the upper-right corner of the window, the pointed value will be set to false when the button is pressed.
5828 bool ImGui::Begin(const char *name, bool *p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
5829 {
5830  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
5831  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
5832  IM_ASSERT(name != NULL && name[0] != '\0'); // Window name required
5833  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinFrameScope); // Forgot to call ImGui::NewFrame()
5834  IM_ASSERT(g.FrameCountEnded != g.FrameCount); // Called ImGui::Render() or ImGui::EndFrame() and haven't called ImGui::NewFrame() again yet
5835 
5836  // Find or create
5837  ImGuiWindow *window = FindWindowByName(name);
5838  const bool window_just_created = (window == NULL);
5839  if (window_just_created)
5840  window = CreateNewWindow(name, flags);
5841 
5842  // Automatically disable manual moving/resizing when NoInputs is set
5843  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs) == ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs)
5844  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize;
5845 
5846  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened)
5847  IM_ASSERT(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow);
5848 
5849  const int current_frame = g.FrameCount;
5850  const bool first_begin_of_the_frame = (window->LastFrameActive != current_frame);
5851  window->IsFallbackWindow = (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 0 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow);
5852 
5853  // Update the Appearing flag
5854  bool window_just_activated_by_user = (window->LastFrameActive < current_frame - 1); // Not using !WasActive because the implicit "Debug" window would always toggle off->on
5855  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
5856  {
5857  ImGuiPopupData &popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
5858  window_just_activated_by_user |= (window->PopupId != popup_ref.PopupId); // We recycle popups so treat window as activated if popup id changed
5859  window_just_activated_by_user |= (window != popup_ref.Window);
5860  }
5861  window->Appearing = window_just_activated_by_user;
5862  if (window->Appearing)
5863  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, true);
5864 
5865  // Update Flags, LastFrameActive, BeginOrderXXX fields
5866  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5867  {
5868  window->Flags = (ImGuiWindowFlags)flags;
5869  window->LastFrameActive = current_frame;
5870  window->LastTimeActive = (float)g.Time;
5871  window->BeginOrderWithinParent = 0;
5872  window->BeginOrderWithinContext = (short)(g.WindowsActiveCount++);
5873  }
5874  else
5875  {
5876  flags = window->Flags;
5877  }
5878 
5879  // Parent window is latched only on the first call to Begin() of the frame, so further append-calls can be done from a different window stack
5880  ImGuiWindow *parent_window_in_stack = g.CurrentWindowStack.empty() ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back().Window;
5881  ImGuiWindow *parent_window = first_begin_of_the_frame ? ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) ? parent_window_in_stack : NULL) : window->ParentWindow;
5882  IM_ASSERT(parent_window != NULL || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow));
5883 
5884  // We allow window memory to be compacted so recreate the base stack when needed.
5885  if (window->IDStack.Size == 0)
5886  window->IDStack.push_back(window->ID);
5887 
5888  // Add to stack
5889  // We intentionally set g.CurrentWindow to NULL to prevent usage until when the viewport is set, then will call SetCurrentWindow()
5890  ImGuiWindowStackData window_stack_data;
5891  window_stack_data.Window = window;
5892  window_stack_data.ParentLastItemDataBackup = g.LastItemData;
5893  g.CurrentWindowStack.push_back(window_stack_data);
5894  g.CurrentWindow = window;
5895  window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SetToCurrentState();
5896  g.CurrentWindow = NULL;
5897 
5898  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
5899  {
5900  ImGuiPopupData &popup_ref = g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size];
5901  popup_ref.Window = window;
5902  g.BeginPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
5903  window->PopupId = popup_ref.PopupId;
5904  }
5905 
5906  // Update ->RootWindow and others pointers (before any possible call to FocusWindow)
5907  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5908  UpdateWindowParentAndRootLinks(window, flags, parent_window);
5909 
5910  // Process SetNextWindow***() calls
5911  // (FIXME: Consider splitting the HasXXX flags into X/Y components
5912  bool window_pos_set_by_api = false;
5913  bool window_size_x_set_by_api = false, window_size_y_set_by_api = false;
5914  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos)
5915  {
5916  window_pos_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.PosCond) != 0;
5917  if (window_pos_set_by_api && ImLengthSqr(g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal) > 0.00001f)
5918  {
5919  // May be processed on the next frame if this is our first frame and we are measuring size
5920  // FIXME: Look into removing the branch so everything can go through this same code path for consistency.
5921  window->SetWindowPosVal = g.NextWindowData.PosVal;
5922  window->SetWindowPosPivot = g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal;
5923  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
5924  }
5925  else
5926  {
5927  SetWindowPos(window, g.NextWindowData.PosVal, g.NextWindowData.PosCond);
5928  }
5929  }
5930  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize)
5931  {
5932  window_size_x_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.x > 0.0f);
5933  window_size_y_set_by_api = (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & g.NextWindowData.SizeCond) != 0 && (g.NextWindowData.SizeVal.y > 0.0f);
5934  SetWindowSize(window, g.NextWindowData.SizeVal, g.NextWindowData.SizeCond);
5935  }
5936  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasScroll)
5937  {
5938  if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x >= 0.0f)
5939  {
5940  window->ScrollTarget.x = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.x;
5941  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
5942  }
5943  if (g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y >= 0.0f)
5944  {
5945  window->ScrollTarget.y = g.NextWindowData.ScrollVal.y;
5946  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
5947  }
5948  }
5949  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize)
5950  window->ContentSizeExplicit = g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal;
5951  else if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5952  window->ContentSizeExplicit = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
5953  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed)
5954  SetWindowCollapsed(window, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal, g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond);
5955  if (g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasFocus)
5956  FocusWindow(window);
5957  if (window->Appearing)
5958  SetWindowConditionAllowFlags(window, ImGuiCond_Appearing, false);
5959 
5960  // When reusing window again multiple times a frame, just append content (don't need to setup again)
5961  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
5962  {
5963  // Initialize
5964  const bool window_is_child_tooltip = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // FIXME-WIP: Undocumented behavior of Child+Tooltip for pinned tooltip (#1345)
5965  window->Active = true;
5966  window->HasCloseButton = (p_open != NULL);
5967  window->ClipRect = ImVec4(-FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX, +FLT_MAX);
5968  window->IDStack.resize(1);
5969  window->DrawList->_ResetForNewFrame();
5970  window->DC.CurrentTableIdx = -1;
5971 
5972  // Restore buffer capacity when woken from a compacted state, to avoid
5973  if (window->MemoryCompacted)
5974  GcAwakeTransientWindowBuffers(window);
5975 
5976  // Update stored window name when it changes (which can _only_ happen with the "###" operator, so the ID would stay unchanged).
5977  // The title bar always display the 'name' parameter, so we only update the string storage if it needs to be visible to the end-user elsewhere.
5978  bool window_title_visible_elsewhere = false;
5979  if (g.NavWindowingListWindow != NULL && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus) == 0) // Window titles visible when using CTRL+TAB
5980  window_title_visible_elsewhere = true;
5981  if (window_title_visible_elsewhere && !window_just_created && strcmp(name, window->Name) != 0)
5982  {
5983  size_t buf_len = (size_t)window->NameBufLen;
5984  window->Name = ImStrdupcpy(window->Name, &buf_len, name);
5985  window->NameBufLen = (int)buf_len;
5986  }
5987 
5988  // UPDATE CONTENTS SIZE, UPDATE HIDDEN STATUS
5989 
5990  // Update contents size from last frame for auto-fitting (or use explicit size)
5991  const bool window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize = (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0);
5992  CalcWindowContentSizes(window, &window->ContentSize, &window->ContentSizeIdeal);
5993  if (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0)
5994  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems--;
5995  if (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0)
5996  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems--;
5997  if (window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly > 0)
5998  window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly--;
5999 
6000  // Hide new windows for one frame until they calculate their size
6001  if (window_just_created && (!window_size_x_set_by_api || !window_size_y_set_by_api))
6002  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6003 
6004  // Hide popup/tooltip window when re-opening while we measure size (because we recycle the windows)
6005  // We reset Size/ContentSize for reappearing popups/tooltips early in this function, so further code won't be tempted to use the old size.
6006  if (window_just_activated_by_user && (flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) != 0)
6007  {
6008  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6009  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize)
6010  {
6011  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
6012  window->Size.x = window->SizeFull.x = 0.f;
6013  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
6014  window->Size.y = window->SizeFull.y = 0.f;
6015  window->ContentSize = window->ContentSizeIdeal = ImVec2(0.f, 0.f);
6016  }
6017  }
6018 
6019  // SELECT VIEWPORT
6020  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: In the docking/viewport branch, this is the point where we select the current viewport (which may affect the style)
6021  SetCurrentWindow(window);
6022 
6023  // LOCK BORDER SIZE AND PADDING FOR THE FRAME (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
6024 
6025  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6026  window->WindowBorderSize = style.ChildBorderSize;
6027  else
6028  window->WindowBorderSize = ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupBorderSize : style.WindowBorderSize;
6029  window->WindowPadding = style.WindowPadding;
6030  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysUseWindowPadding | ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)) && window->WindowBorderSize == 0.0f)
6031  window->WindowPadding = ImVec2(0.0f, (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) ? style.WindowPadding.y : 0.0f);
6032 
6033  // Lock menu offset so size calculation can use it as menu-bar windows need a minimum size.
6034  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.x = ImMax(ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, style.ItemSpacing.x), g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.x);
6035  window->DC.MenuBarOffset.y = g.NextWindowData.MenuBarOffsetMinVal.y;
6036 
6037  // Collapse window by double-clicking on title bar
6038  // At this point we don't have a clipping rectangle setup yet, so we can use the title bar area for hit detection and drawing
6039  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse))
6040  {
6041  // We don't use a regular button+id to test for double-click on title bar (mostly due to legacy reason, could be fixed), so verify that we don't have items over the title bar.
6042  ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
6043  if (g.HoveredWindow == window && g.HoveredId == 0 && g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame == 0 && IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max) && g.IO.MouseDoubleClicked[0])
6044  window->WantCollapseToggle = true;
6045  if (window->WantCollapseToggle)
6046  {
6047  window->Collapsed = !window->Collapsed;
6048  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6049  }
6050  }
6051  else
6052  {
6053  window->Collapsed = false;
6054  }
6055  window->WantCollapseToggle = false;
6056 
6057  // SIZE
6058 
6059  // Calculate auto-fit size, handle automatic resize
6060  const ImVec2 size_auto_fit = CalcWindowAutoFitSize(window, window->ContentSizeIdeal);
6061  bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = window_just_created;
6062  bool use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = window_just_created;
6063  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && !window->Collapsed)
6064  {
6065  // Using SetNextWindowSize() overrides ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize, so it can be used on tooltips/popups, etc.
6066  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api)
6067  {
6068  window->SizeFull.x = size_auto_fit.x;
6069  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
6070  }
6071  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api)
6072  {
6073  window->SizeFull.y = size_auto_fit.y;
6074  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6075  }
6076  }
6077  else if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0 || window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6078  {
6079  // Auto-fit may only grow window during the first few frames
6080  // We still process initial auto-fit on collapsed windows to get a window width, but otherwise don't honor ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize when collapsed.
6081  if (!window_size_x_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
6082  {
6083  window->SizeFull.x = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, size_auto_fit.x) : size_auto_fit.x;
6084  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = true;
6085  }
6086  if (!window_size_y_set_by_api && window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6087  {
6088  window->SizeFull.y = window->AutoFitOnlyGrows ? ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, size_auto_fit.y) : size_auto_fit.y;
6089  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6090  }
6091  if (!window->Collapsed)
6092  MarkIniSettingsDirty(window);
6093  }
6094 
6095  // Apply minimum/maximum window size constraints and final size
6096  window->SizeFull = CalcWindowSizeAfterConstraint(window, window->SizeFull);
6097  window->Size = window->Collapsed && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? window->TitleBarRect().GetSize() : window->SizeFull;
6098 
6099  // Decoration size
6100  const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight();
6101 
6102  // POSITION
6103 
6104  // Popup latch its initial position, will position itself when it appears next frame
6105  if (window_just_activated_by_user)
6106  {
6107  window->AutoPosLastDirection = ImGuiDir_None;
6108  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && !window_pos_set_by_api) // FIXME: BeginPopup() could use SetNextWindowPos()
6109  window->Pos = g.BeginPopupStack.back().OpenPopupPos;
6110  }
6111 
6112  // Position child window
6113  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6114  {
6115  IM_ASSERT(parent_window && parent_window->Active);
6116  window->BeginOrderWithinParent = (short)parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.Size;
6117  parent_window->DC.ChildWindows.push_back(window);
6118  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6119  window->Pos = parent_window->DC.CursorPos;
6120  }
6121 
6122  const bool window_pos_with_pivot = (window->SetWindowPosVal.x != FLT_MAX && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems == 0);
6123  if (window_pos_with_pivot)
6124  SetWindowPos(window, window->SetWindowPosVal - window->Size * window->SetWindowPosPivot, 0); // Position given a pivot (e.g. for centering)
6125  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) != 0)
6126  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6127  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && window_just_appearing_after_hidden_for_resize)
6128  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6129  else if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) != 0 && !window_pos_set_by_api && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6130  window->Pos = FindBestWindowPosForPopup(window);
6131 
6132  // Calculate the range of allowed position for that window (to be movable and visible past safe area padding)
6133  // When clamping to stay visible, we will enforce that window->Pos stays inside of visibility_rect.
6134  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = (ImGuiViewportP *)(void *)GetMainViewport();
6135  ImRect viewport_rect(viewport->GetMainRect());
6136  ImRect viewport_work_rect(viewport->GetWorkRect());
6137  ImVec2 visibility_padding = ImMax(style.DisplayWindowPadding, style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding);
6138  ImRect visibility_rect(viewport_work_rect.Min + visibility_padding, viewport_work_rect.Max - visibility_padding);
6139 
6140  // Clamp position/size so window stays visible within its viewport or monitor
6141  // Ignore zero-sized display explicitly to avoid losing positions if a window manager reports zero-sized window when initializing or minimizing.
6142  if (!window_pos_set_by_api && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0)
6143  if (viewport_rect.GetWidth() > 0.0f && viewport_rect.GetHeight() > 0.0f)
6144  ClampWindowRect(window, visibility_rect);
6145  window->Pos = ImFloor(window->Pos);
6146 
6147  // Lock window rounding for the frame (so that altering them doesn't cause inconsistencies)
6148  // Large values tend to lead to variety of artifacts and are not recommended.
6149  window->WindowRounding = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? style.ChildRounding : ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)) ? style.PopupRounding : style.WindowRounding;
6150 
6151  // For windows with title bar or menu bar, we clamp to FrameHeight(FontSize + FramePadding.y * 2.0f) to completely hide artifacts.
6152  //if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6153  // window->WindowRounding = ImMin(window->WindowRounding, g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f);
6154 
6155  // Apply window focus (new and reactivated windows are moved to front)
6156  bool want_focus = false;
6157  if (window_just_activated_by_user && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing))
6158  {
6159  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6160  want_focus = true;
6161  else if ((flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow | ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)) == 0)
6162  want_focus = true;
6163  }
6164 
6165  // Handle manual resize: Resize Grips, Borders, Gamepad
6166  int border_held = -1;
6167  ImU32 resize_grip_col[4] = {};
6168  const int resize_grip_count = g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges ? 2 : 1; // Allow resize from lower-left if we have the mouse cursor feedback for it.
6169  const float resize_grip_draw_size = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(g.FontSize * 1.10f, window->WindowRounding + 1.0f + g.FontSize * 0.2f));
6170  if (!window->Collapsed)
6171  if (UpdateWindowManualResize(window, size_auto_fit, &border_held, resize_grip_count, &resize_grip_col[0], visibility_rect))
6172  use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y = true;
6173  window->ResizeBorderHeld = (signed char)border_held;
6174 
6175  // SCROLLBAR VISIBILITY
6176 
6177  // Update scrollbar visibility (based on the Size that was effective during last frame or the auto-resized Size).
6178  if (!window->Collapsed)
6179  {
6180  // When reading the current size we need to read it after size constraints have been applied.
6181  // When we use InnerRect here we are intentionally reading last frame size, same for ScrollbarSizes values before we set them again.
6182  ImVec2 avail_size_from_current_frame = ImVec2(window->SizeFull.x, window->SizeFull.y - decoration_up_height);
6183  ImVec2 avail_size_from_last_frame = window->InnerRect.GetSize() + window->ScrollbarSizes;
6184  ImVec2 needed_size_from_last_frame = window_just_created ? ImVec2(0, 0) : window->ContentSize + window->WindowPadding * 2.0f;
6185  float size_x_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_x ? avail_size_from_current_frame.x : avail_size_from_last_frame.x;
6186  float size_y_for_scrollbars = use_current_size_for_scrollbar_y ? avail_size_from_current_frame.y : avail_size_from_last_frame.y;
6187  //bool scrollbar_y_from_last_frame = window->ScrollbarY; // FIXME: May want to use that in the ScrollbarX expression? How many pros vs cons?
6188  window->ScrollbarY = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysVerticalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar));
6189  window->ScrollbarX = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysHorizontalScrollbar) || ((needed_size_from_last_frame.x > size_x_for_scrollbars - (window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f)) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar));
6190  if (window->ScrollbarX && !window->ScrollbarY)
6191  window->ScrollbarY = (needed_size_from_last_frame.y > size_y_for_scrollbars) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
6192  window->ScrollbarSizes = ImVec2(window->ScrollbarY ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f, window->ScrollbarX ? style.ScrollbarSize : 0.0f);
6193  }
6194 
6195  // UPDATE RECTANGLES (1- THOSE NOT AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
6196  // Update various regions. Variables they depends on should be set above in this function.
6197  // We set this up after processing the resize grip so that our rectangles doesn't lag by a frame.
6198 
6199  // Outer rectangle
6200  // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
6201  // - FindHoveredWindow() (w/ extra padding when border resize is enabled)
6202  // - Begin() initial clipping rect for drawing window background and borders.
6203  // - Begin() clipping whole child
6204  const ImRect host_rect = ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip) ? parent_window->ClipRect : viewport_rect;
6205  const ImRect outer_rect = window->Rect();
6206  const ImRect title_bar_rect = window->TitleBarRect();
6207  window->OuterRectClipped = outer_rect;
6208  window->OuterRectClipped.ClipWith(host_rect);
6209 
6210  // Inner rectangle
6211  // Not affected by window border size. Used by:
6212  // - InnerClipRect
6213  // - ScrollToBringRectIntoView()
6214  // - NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
6215  // - Scrollbar()
6216  window->InnerRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x;
6217  window->InnerRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y + decoration_up_height;
6218  window->InnerRect.Max.x = window->Pos.x + window->Size.x - window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
6219  window->InnerRect.Max.y = window->Pos.y + window->Size.y - window->ScrollbarSizes.y;
6220 
6221  // Inner clipping rectangle.
6222  // Will extend a little bit outside the normal work region.
6223  // This is to allow e.g. Selectable or CollapsingHeader or some separators to cover that space.
6224  // Force round operator last to ensure that e.g. (int)(max.x-min.x) in user's render code produce correct result.
6225  // Note that if our window is collapsed we will end up with an inverted (~null) clipping rectangle which is the correct behavior.
6226  // Affected by window/frame border size. Used by:
6227  // - Begin() initial clip rect
6228  float top_border_size = (((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) || !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar)) ? style.FrameBorderSize : window->WindowBorderSize);
6229  window->InnerClipRect.Min.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.x + ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
6230  window->InnerClipRect.Min.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Min.y + top_border_size);
6231  window->InnerClipRect.Max.x = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.x - ImMax(ImFloor(window->WindowPadding.x * 0.5f), window->WindowBorderSize));
6232  window->InnerClipRect.Max.y = ImFloor(0.5f + window->InnerRect.Max.y - window->WindowBorderSize);
6233  window->InnerClipRect.ClipWithFull(host_rect);
6234 
6235  // Default item width. Make it proportional to window size if window manually resizes
6236  if (window->Size.x > 0.0f && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize))
6237  window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(window->Size.x * 0.65f);
6238  else
6239  window->ItemWidthDefault = ImFloor(g.FontSize * 16.0f);
6240 
6241  // SCROLLING
6242 
6243  // Lock down maximum scrolling
6244  // The value of ScrollMax are ahead from ScrollbarX/ScrollbarY which is intentionally using InnerRect from previous rect in order to accommodate
6245  // for right/bottom aligned items without creating a scrollbar.
6246  window->ScrollMax.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetWidth());
6247  window->ScrollMax.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
6248 
6249  // Apply scrolling
6250  window->Scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
6251  window->ScrollTarget = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
6252 
6253  // DRAWING
6254 
6255  // Setup draw list and outer clipping rectangle
6256  IM_ASSERT(window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.Size == 1 && window->DrawList->CmdBuffer[0].ElemCount == 0);
6257  window->DrawList->PushTextureID(g.Font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
6258  PushClipRect(host_rect.Min, host_rect.Max, false);
6259 
6260  // Draw modal window background (darkens what is behind them, all viewports)
6261  const bool dim_bg_for_modal = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) && window == GetTopMostPopupModal() && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0;
6262  const bool dim_bg_for_window_list = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && (window == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim->RootWindow);
6263  if (dim_bg_for_modal || dim_bg_for_window_list)
6264  {
6265  const ImU32 dim_bg_col = GetColorU32(dim_bg_for_modal ? ImGuiCol_ModalWindowDimBg : ImGuiCol_NavWindowingDimBg, g.DimBgRatio);
6266  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(viewport_rect.Min, viewport_rect.Max, dim_bg_col);
6267  }
6268 
6269  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle background
6270  if (dim_bg_for_window_list && window == g.NavWindowingTargetAnim)
6271  {
6272  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
6273  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
6274  if (!bb.Contains(viewport_rect)) // Avoid drawing if the window covers all the viewport anyway
6275  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha * 0.25f), g.Style.WindowRounding);
6276  }
6277 
6278  // Since 1.71, child window can render their decoration (bg color, border, scrollbars, etc.) within their parent to save a draw call.
6279  // When using overlapping child windows, this will break the assumption that child z-order is mapped to submission order.
6280  // We disable this when the parent window has zero vertices, which is a common pattern leading to laying out multiple overlapping child.
6281  // We also disabled this when we have dimming overlay behind this specific one child.
6282  // FIXME: More code may rely on explicit sorting of overlapping child window and would need to disable this somehow. Please get in contact if you are affected.
6283  {
6284  bool render_decorations_in_parent = false;
6285  if ((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) && !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && !window_is_child_tooltip)
6286  if (window->DrawList->CmdBuffer.back().ElemCount == 0 && parent_window->DrawList->VtxBuffer.Size > 0)
6287  render_decorations_in_parent = true;
6288  if (render_decorations_in_parent)
6289  window->DrawList = parent_window->DrawList;
6290 
6291  // Handle title bar, scrollbar, resize grips and resize borders
6292  const ImGuiWindow *window_to_highlight = g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget : g.NavWindow;
6293  const bool title_bar_is_highlight = want_focus || (window_to_highlight && window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == window_to_highlight->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight);
6294  RenderWindowDecorations(window, title_bar_rect, title_bar_is_highlight, resize_grip_count, resize_grip_col, resize_grip_draw_size);
6295 
6296  if (render_decorations_in_parent)
6297  window->DrawList = &window->DrawListInst;
6298  }
6299 
6300  // Draw navigation selection/windowing rectangle border
6301  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim == window)
6302  {
6303  float rounding = ImMax(window->WindowRounding, g.Style.WindowRounding);
6304  ImRect bb = window->Rect();
6305  bb.Expand(g.FontSize);
6306  if (bb.Contains(viewport_rect)) // If a window fits the entire viewport, adjust its highlight inward
6307  {
6308  bb.Expand(-g.FontSize - 1.0f);
6309  rounding = window->WindowRounding;
6310  }
6311  window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_NavWindowingHighlight, g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha), rounding, 0, 3.0f);
6312  }
6313 
6314  // UPDATE RECTANGLES (2- THOSE AFFECTED BY SCROLLING)
6315 
6316  // Work rectangle.
6317  // Affected by window padding and border size. Used by:
6318  // - Columns() for right-most edge
6319  // - TreeNode(), CollapsingHeader() for right-most edge
6320  // - BeginTabBar() for right-most edge
6321  const bool allow_scrollbar_x = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar) && (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_HorizontalScrollbar);
6322  const bool allow_scrollbar_y = !(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoScrollbar);
6323  const float work_rect_size_x = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_x ? window->ContentSize.x : 0.0f, window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
6324  const float work_rect_size_y = (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : ImMax(allow_scrollbar_y ? window->ContentSize.y : 0.0f, window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
6325  window->WorkRect.Min.x = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.x - window->Scroll.x + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, window->WindowBorderSize));
6326  window->WorkRect.Min.y = ImFloor(window->InnerRect.Min.y - window->Scroll.y + ImMax(window->WindowPadding.y, window->WindowBorderSize));
6327  window->WorkRect.Max.x = window->WorkRect.Min.x + work_rect_size_x;
6328  window->WorkRect.Max.y = window->WorkRect.Min.y + work_rect_size_y;
6329  window->ParentWorkRect = window->WorkRect;
6330 
6331  // [LEGACY] Content Region
6332  // FIXME-OBSOLETE: window->ContentRegionRect.Max is currently very misleading / partly faulty, but some BeginChild() patterns relies on it.
6333  // Used by:
6334  // - Mouse wheel scrolling + many other things
6335  window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + window->WindowPadding.x;
6336  window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + window->WindowPadding.y + decoration_up_height;
6337  window->ContentRegionRect.Max.x = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.x + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.x != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.x : (window->Size.x - window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f - window->ScrollbarSizes.x));
6338  window->ContentRegionRect.Max.y = window->ContentRegionRect.Min.y + (window->ContentSizeExplicit.y != 0.0f ? window->ContentSizeExplicit.y : (window->Size.y - window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f - decoration_up_height - window->ScrollbarSizes.y));
6339 
6340  // Setup drawing context
6341  // (NB: That term "drawing context / DC" lost its meaning a long time ago. Initially was meant to hold transient data only. Nowadays difference between window-> and window->DC-> is dubious.)
6342  window->DC.Indent.x = 0.0f + window->WindowPadding.x - window->Scroll.x;
6343  window->DC.GroupOffset.x = 0.0f;
6344  window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x = 0.0f;
6345  window->DC.CursorStartPos = window->Pos + ImVec2(window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x, decoration_up_height + window->WindowPadding.y - window->Scroll.y);
6346  window->DC.CursorPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6347  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine = window->DC.CursorPos;
6348  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6349  window->DC.IdealMaxPos = window->DC.CursorStartPos;
6350  window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
6351  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
6352 
6353  window->DC.NavLayerCurrent = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6354  window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask = window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext;
6355  window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext = 0x00;
6356  window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = false;
6357  window->DC.NavHasScroll = (window->ScrollMax.y > 0.0f);
6358 
6359  window->DC.MenuBarAppending = false;
6360  window->DC.MenuColumns.Update(style.ItemSpacing.x, window_just_activated_by_user);
6361  window->DC.TreeDepth = 0;
6362  window->DC.TreeJumpToParentOnPopMask = 0x00;
6363  window->DC.ChildWindows.resize(0);
6364  window->DC.StateStorage = &window->StateStorage;
6365  window->DC.CurrentColumns = NULL;
6366  window->DC.LayoutType = ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6367  window->DC.ParentLayoutType = parent_window ? parent_window->DC.LayoutType : ImGuiLayoutType_Vertical;
6368  window->DC.FocusCounterRegular = window->DC.FocusCounterTabStop = -1;
6369 
6370  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->ItemWidthDefault;
6371  window->DC.TextWrapPos = -1.0f; // disabled
6372  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.resize(0);
6373  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.resize(0);
6374 
6375  if (window->AutoFitFramesX > 0)
6376  window->AutoFitFramesX--;
6377  if (window->AutoFitFramesY > 0)
6378  window->AutoFitFramesY--;
6379 
6380  // Apply focus (we need to call FocusWindow() AFTER setting DC.CursorStartPos so our initial navigation reference rectangle can start around there)
6381  if (want_focus)
6382  {
6383  FocusWindow(window);
6384  NavInitWindow(window, false); // <-- this is in the way for us to be able to defer and sort reappearing FocusWindow() calls
6385  }
6386 
6387  // Title bar
6388  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6389  RenderWindowTitleBarContents(window, ImRect(title_bar_rect.Min.x + window->WindowBorderSize, title_bar_rect.Min.y, title_bar_rect.Max.x - window->WindowBorderSize, title_bar_rect.Max.y), name, p_open);
6390 
6391  // Clear hit test shape every frame
6392  window->HitTestHoleSize.x = window->HitTestHoleSize.y = 0;
6393 
6394  // Pressing CTRL+C while holding on a window copy its content to the clipboard
6395  // This works but 1. doesn't handle multiple Begin/End pairs, 2. recursing into another Begin/End pair - so we need to work that out and add better logging scope.
6396  // Maybe we can support CTRL+C on every element?
6397  /*
6398  //if (g.NavWindow == window && g.ActiveId == 0)
6399  if (g.ActiveId == window->MoveId)
6400  if (g.IO.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C))
6401  LogToClipboard();
6402  */
6403 
6404  // We fill last item data based on Title Bar/Tab, in order for IsItemHovered() and IsItemActive() to be usable after Begin().
6405  // This is useful to allow creating context menus on title bar only, etc.
6406  g.LastItemData.ID = window->MoveId;
6407  g.LastItemData.InFlags = g.CurrentItemFlags;
6408  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = IsMouseHoveringRect(title_bar_rect.Min, title_bar_rect.Max, false) ? ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect : 0;
6409  g.LastItemData.Rect = title_bar_rect;
6410 
6411 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
6412  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar))
6413  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(g.LastItemData.Rect, g.LastItemData.ID);
6414 #endif
6415  }
6416  else
6417  {
6418  // Append
6419  SetCurrentWindow(window);
6420  }
6421 
6422  // Pull/inherit current state
6423  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? parent_window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent : window->GetID("#FOCUSSCOPE"); // Inherit from parent only // -V595
6424 
6425  PushClipRect(window->InnerClipRect.Min, window->InnerClipRect.Max, true);
6426 
6427  // Clear 'accessed' flag last thing (After PushClipRect which will set the flag. We want the flag to stay false when the default "Debug" window is unused)
6428  window->WriteAccessed = false;
6429  window->BeginCount++;
6430  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags();
6431 
6432  // Update visibility
6433  if (first_begin_of_the_frame)
6434  {
6435  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6436  {
6437  // Child window can be out of sight and have "negative" clip windows.
6438  // Mark them as collapsed so commands are skipped earlier (we can't manually collapse them because they have no title bar).
6439  IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar) != 0);
6440  if (!(flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) && window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0) // FIXME: Doesn't make sense for ChildWindow??
6441  if (!g.LogEnabled)
6442  if (window->OuterRectClipped.Min.x >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.x || window->OuterRectClipped.Min.y >= window->OuterRectClipped.Max.y)
6443  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6444 
6445  // Hide along with parent or if parent is collapsed
6446  if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0))
6447  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6448  if (parent_window && (parent_window->Collapsed || parent_window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0))
6449  window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems = 1;
6450  }
6451 
6452  // Don't render if style alpha is 0.0 at the time of Begin(). This is arbitrary and inconsistent but has been there for a long while (may remove at some point)
6453  if (style.Alpha <= 0.0f)
6454  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
6455 
6456  // Update the Hidden flag
6457  window->Hidden = (window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems > 0) || (window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems > 0) || (window->HiddenFramesForRenderOnly > 0);
6458 
6459  // Disable inputs for requested number of frames
6460  if (window->DisableInputsFrames > 0)
6461  {
6462  window->DisableInputsFrames--;
6463  window->Flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs;
6464  }
6465 
6466  // Update the SkipItems flag, used to early out of all items functions (no layout required)
6467  bool skip_items = false;
6468  if (window->Collapsed || !window->Active || window->Hidden)
6469  if (window->AutoFitFramesX <= 0 && window->AutoFitFramesY <= 0 && window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems <= 0)
6470  skip_items = true;
6471  window->SkipItems = skip_items;
6472  }
6473 
6474  return !window->SkipItems;
6475 }
6476 
6477 void ImGui::End()
6478 {
6479  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6480  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
6481 
6482  // Error checking: verify that user hasn't called End() too many times!
6483  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size <= 1 && g.WithinFrameScopeWithImplicitWindow)
6484  {
6485  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1, "Calling End() too many times!");
6486  return;
6487  }
6488  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0);
6489 
6490  // Error checking: verify that user doesn't directly call End() on a child window.
6491  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
6492  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.WithinEndChild, "Must call EndChild() and not End()!");
6493 
6494  // Close anything that is open
6495  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns)
6496  EndColumns();
6497  PopClipRect(); // Inner window clip rectangle
6498 
6499  // Stop logging
6500  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)) // FIXME: add more options for scope of logging
6501  LogFinish();
6502 
6503  // Pop from window stack
6504  g.LastItemData = g.CurrentWindowStack.back().ParentLastItemDataBackup;
6505  g.CurrentWindowStack.pop_back();
6506  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
6507  g.BeginPopupStack.pop_back();
6508  window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.CompareWithCurrentState();
6509  SetCurrentWindow(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 0 ? NULL : g.CurrentWindowStack.back().Window);
6510 }
6511 
6512 void ImGui::BringWindowToFocusFront(ImGuiWindow *window)
6513 {
6514  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6515  IM_ASSERT(window == window->RootWindow);
6516 
6517  const int cur_order = window->FocusOrder;
6518  IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[cur_order] == window);
6519  if (g.WindowsFocusOrder.back() == window)
6520  return;
6521 
6522  const int new_order = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1;
6523  for (int n = cur_order; n < new_order; n++)
6524  {
6525  g.WindowsFocusOrder[n] = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n + 1];
6526  g.WindowsFocusOrder[n]->FocusOrder--;
6527  IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[n]->FocusOrder == n);
6528  }
6529  g.WindowsFocusOrder[new_order] = window;
6530  window->FocusOrder = (short)new_order;
6531 }
6532 
6533 void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayFront(ImGuiWindow *window)
6534 {
6535  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6536  ImGuiWindow *current_front_window = g.Windows.back();
6537  if (current_front_window == window || current_front_window->RootWindow == window) // Cheap early out (could be better)
6538  return;
6539  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 2; i >= 0; i--) // We can ignore the top-most window
6540  if (g.Windows[i] == window)
6541  {
6542  memmove(&g.Windows[i], &g.Windows[i + 1], (size_t)(g.Windows.Size - i - 1) * sizeof(ImGuiWindow *));
6543  g.Windows[g.Windows.Size - 1] = window;
6544  break;
6545  }
6546 }
6547 
6548 void ImGui::BringWindowToDisplayBack(ImGuiWindow *window)
6549 {
6550  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6551  if (g.Windows[0] == window)
6552  return;
6553  for (int i = 0; i < g.Windows.Size; i++)
6554  if (g.Windows[i] == window)
6555  {
6556  memmove(&g.Windows[1], &g.Windows[0], (size_t)i * sizeof(ImGuiWindow *));
6557  g.Windows[0] = window;
6558  break;
6559  }
6560 }
6561 
6562 // Moving window to front of display and set focus (which happens to be back of our sorted list)
6563 void ImGui::FocusWindow(ImGuiWindow *window)
6564 {
6565  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6566 
6567  if (g.NavWindow != window)
6568  {
6569  g.NavWindow = window;
6570  if (window && g.NavDisableMouseHover)
6571  g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
6572  g.NavId = window ? window->NavLastIds[0] : 0; // Restore NavId
6573  g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
6574  g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
6575  g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
6576  g.NavInitRequest = g.NavMoveRequest = false;
6577  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
6578  //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("FocusWindow(\"%s\")\n", window ? window->Name : NULL);
6579  }
6580 
6581  // Close popups if any
6582  ClosePopupsOverWindow(window, false);
6583 
6584  // Move the root window to the top of the pile
6585  IM_ASSERT(window == NULL || window->RootWindow != NULL);
6586  ImGuiWindow *focus_front_window = window ? window->RootWindow : NULL; // NB: In docking branch this is window->RootWindowDockStop
6587  ImGuiWindow *display_front_window = window ? window->RootWindow : NULL;
6588 
6589  // Steal active widgets. Some of the cases it triggers includes:
6590  // - Focus a window while an InputText in another window is active, if focus happens before the old InputText can run.
6591  // - When using Nav to activate menu items (due to timing of activating on press->new window appears->losing ActiveId)
6592  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && g.ActiveIdWindow && g.ActiveIdWindow->RootWindow != focus_front_window)
6593  if (!g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss)
6594  ClearActiveID();
6595 
6596  // Passing NULL allow to disable keyboard focus
6597  if (!window)
6598  return;
6599 
6600  // Bring to front
6601  BringWindowToFocusFront(focus_front_window);
6602  if (((window->Flags | display_front_window->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBringToFrontOnFocus) == 0)
6603  BringWindowToDisplayFront(display_front_window);
6604 }
6605 
6606 void ImGui::FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(ImGuiWindow *under_this_window, ImGuiWindow *ignore_window)
6607 {
6608  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6609 
6610  const int start_idx = ((under_this_window != NULL) ? FindWindowFocusIndex(under_this_window) : g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size) - 1;
6611  for (int i = start_idx; i >= 0; i--)
6612  {
6613  // We may later decide to test for different NoXXXInputs based on the active navigation input (mouse vs nav) but that may feel more confusing to the user.
6614  ImGuiWindow *window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
6615  IM_ASSERT(window == window->RootWindow);
6616  if (window != ignore_window && window->WasActive)
6617  if ((window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)) != (ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
6618  {
6619  ImGuiWindow *focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(window);
6620  FocusWindow(focus_window);
6621  return;
6622  }
6623  }
6624  FocusWindow(NULL);
6625 }
6626 
6627 // Important: this alone doesn't alter current ImDrawList state. This is called by PushFont/PopFont only.
6628 void ImGui::SetCurrentFont(ImFont *font)
6629 {
6630  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6631  IM_ASSERT(font && font->IsLoaded()); // Font Atlas not created. Did you call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32 / GetTexDataAsAlpha8 ?
6632  IM_ASSERT(font->Scale > 0.0f);
6633  g.Font = font;
6634  g.FontBaseSize = ImMax(1.0f, g.IO.FontGlobalScale * g.Font->FontSize * g.Font->Scale);
6635  g.FontSize = g.CurrentWindow ? g.CurrentWindow->CalcFontSize() : 0.0f;
6636 
6637  ImFontAtlas *atlas = g.Font->ContainerAtlas;
6638  g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvWhitePixel = atlas->TexUvWhitePixel;
6639  g.DrawListSharedData.TexUvLines = atlas->TexUvLines;
6640  g.DrawListSharedData.Font = g.Font;
6641  g.DrawListSharedData.FontSize = g.FontSize;
6642 }
6643 
6644 void ImGui::PushFont(ImFont *font)
6645 {
6646  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6647  if (!font)
6648  font = GetDefaultFont();
6649  SetCurrentFont(font);
6650  g.FontStack.push_back(font);
6651  g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PushTextureID(font->ContainerAtlas->TexID);
6652 }
6653 
6654 void ImGui::PopFont()
6655 {
6656  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6657  g.CurrentWindow->DrawList->PopTextureID();
6658  g.FontStack.pop_back();
6659  SetCurrentFont(g.FontStack.empty() ? GetDefaultFont() : g.FontStack.back());
6660 }
6661 
6662 void ImGui::PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags option, bool enabled)
6663 {
6664  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6665  ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = g.CurrentItemFlags;
6666  IM_ASSERT(item_flags == g.ItemFlagsStack.back());
6667  if (enabled)
6668  item_flags |= option;
6669  else
6670  item_flags &= ~option;
6671  g.CurrentItemFlags = item_flags;
6672  g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(item_flags);
6673 }
6674 
6675 void ImGui::PopItemFlag()
6676 {
6677  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6678  IM_ASSERT(g.ItemFlagsStack.Size > 1); // Too many calls to PopItemFlag() - we always leave a 0 at the bottom of the stack.
6679  g.ItemFlagsStack.pop_back();
6680  g.CurrentItemFlags = g.ItemFlagsStack.back();
6681 }
6682 
6683 // BeginDisabled()/EndDisabled()
6684 // - Those can be nested but this cannot be used to enable an already disabled section (a single BeginDisabled(true) in the stack is enough to keep things disabled)
6685 // - Visually this is currently altering alpha, but it is expected that in a future styling system this would work differently.
6686 // - Feedback welcome at https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/issues/211
6687 // - BeginDisabled(false) essentially does nothing useful but is provided to facilitate use of boolean expressions. If you can avoid calling BeginDisabled(False)/EndDisabled() best to avoid it.
6688 // - Optimized shortcuts instead of PushStyleVar() + PushItemFlag()
6689 void ImGui::BeginDisabled(bool disabled)
6690 {
6691  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6692  bool was_disabled = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
6693  if (!was_disabled && disabled)
6694  {
6695  g.DisabledAlphaBackup = g.Style.Alpha;
6696  g.Style.Alpha *= g.Style.DisabledAlpha; // PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, g.Style.Alpha * g.Style.DisabledAlpha);
6697  }
6698  if (was_disabled || disabled)
6699  g.CurrentItemFlags |= ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled;
6700  g.ItemFlagsStack.push_back(g.CurrentItemFlags);
6701 }
6702 
6703 void ImGui::EndDisabled()
6704 {
6705  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6706  bool was_disabled = (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) != 0;
6707  //PopItemFlag();
6708  g.ItemFlagsStack.pop_back();
6709  g.CurrentItemFlags = g.ItemFlagsStack.back();
6710  if (was_disabled && (g.CurrentItemFlags & ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled) == 0)
6711  g.Style.Alpha = g.DisabledAlphaBackup; //PopStyleVar();
6712 }
6713 
6714 // FIXME: Look into renaming this once we have settled the new Focus/Activation/TabStop system.
6715 void ImGui::PushAllowKeyboardFocus(bool allow_keyboard_focus)
6716 {
6717  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_NoTabStop, !allow_keyboard_focus);
6718 }
6719 
6720 void ImGui::PopAllowKeyboardFocus()
6721 {
6722  PopItemFlag();
6723 }
6724 
6725 void ImGui::PushButtonRepeat(bool repeat)
6726 {
6727  PushItemFlag(ImGuiItemFlags_ButtonRepeat, repeat);
6728 }
6729 
6730 void ImGui::PopButtonRepeat()
6731 {
6732  PopItemFlag();
6733 }
6734 
6735 void ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(float wrap_pos_x)
6736 {
6737  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6738  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.push_back(window->DC.TextWrapPos);
6739  window->DC.TextWrapPos = wrap_pos_x;
6740 }
6741 
6742 void ImGui::PopTextWrapPos()
6743 {
6744  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
6745  window->DC.TextWrapPos = window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.back();
6746  window->DC.TextWrapPosStack.pop_back();
6747 }
6748 
6749 bool ImGui::IsWindowChildOf(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiWindow *potential_parent)
6750 {
6751  if (window->RootWindow == potential_parent)
6752  return true;
6753  while (window != NULL)
6754  {
6755  if (window == potential_parent)
6756  return true;
6757  window = window->ParentWindow;
6758  }
6759  return false;
6760 }
6761 
6762 bool ImGui::IsWindowAbove(ImGuiWindow *potential_above, ImGuiWindow *potential_below)
6763 {
6764  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6765  for (int i = g.Windows.Size - 1; i >= 0; i--)
6766  {
6767  ImGuiWindow *candidate_window = g.Windows[i];
6768  if (candidate_window == potential_above)
6769  return true;
6770  if (candidate_window == potential_below)
6771  return false;
6772  }
6773  return false;
6774 }
6775 
6776 bool ImGui::IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags flags)
6777 {
6778  IM_ASSERT((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenOverlapped) == 0); // Flags not supported by this function
6779  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6780  if (g.HoveredWindow == NULL)
6781  return false;
6782 
6783  if ((flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow) == 0)
6784  {
6785  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
6786  switch (flags & (ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows))
6787  {
6788  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows:
6789  if (g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow != window->RootWindow)
6790  return false;
6791  break;
6792  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_RootWindow:
6793  if (g.HoveredWindow != window->RootWindow)
6794  return false;
6795  break;
6796  case ImGuiHoveredFlags_ChildWindows:
6797  if (!IsWindowChildOf(g.HoveredWindow, window))
6798  return false;
6799  break;
6800  default:
6801  if (g.HoveredWindow != window)
6802  return false;
6803  break;
6804  }
6805  }
6806 
6807  if (!IsWindowContentHoverable(g.HoveredWindow, flags))
6808  return false;
6809  if (!(flags & ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByActiveItem))
6810  if (g.ActiveId != 0 && !g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap && g.ActiveId != g.HoveredWindow->MoveId)
6811  return false;
6812  return true;
6813 }
6814 
6815 bool ImGui::IsWindowFocused(ImGuiFocusedFlags flags)
6816 {
6817  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6818 
6819  if (flags & ImGuiFocusedFlags_AnyWindow)
6820  return g.NavWindow != NULL;
6821 
6822  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow); // Not inside a Begin()/End()
6823  switch (flags & (ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows))
6824  {
6825  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow | ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows:
6826  return g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->RootWindow == g.CurrentWindow->RootWindow;
6827  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_RootWindow:
6828  return g.NavWindow == g.CurrentWindow->RootWindow;
6829  case ImGuiFocusedFlags_ChildWindows:
6830  return g.NavWindow && IsWindowChildOf(g.NavWindow, g.CurrentWindow);
6831  default:
6832  return g.NavWindow == g.CurrentWindow;
6833  }
6834 }
6835 
6836 // Can we focus this window with CTRL+TAB (or PadMenu + PadFocusPrev/PadFocusNext)
6837 // Note that NoNavFocus makes the window not reachable with CTRL+TAB but it can still be focused with mouse or programmatically.
6838 // If you want a window to never be focused, you may use the e.g. NoInputs flag.
6839 bool ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(ImGuiWindow *window)
6840 {
6841  return window->WasActive && window == window->RootWindow && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavFocus);
6842 }
6843 
6844 float ImGui::GetWindowWidth()
6845 {
6846  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
6847  return window->Size.x;
6848 }
6849 
6850 float ImGui::GetWindowHeight()
6851 {
6852  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
6853  return window->Size.y;
6854 }
6855 
6856 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowPos()
6857 {
6858  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
6859  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
6860  return window->Pos;
6861 }
6862 
6863 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond)
6864 {
6865  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
6866  if (cond && (window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
6867  return;
6868 
6869  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6870  window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6871  window->SetWindowPosVal = ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX);
6872 
6873  // Set
6874  const ImVec2 old_pos = window->Pos;
6875  window->Pos = ImFloor(pos);
6876  ImVec2 offset = window->Pos - old_pos;
6877  window->DC.CursorPos += offset; // As we happen to move the window while it is being appended to (which is a bad idea - will smear) let's at least offset the cursor
6878  window->DC.CursorMaxPos += offset; // And more importantly we need to offset CursorMaxPos/CursorStartPos this so ContentSize calculation doesn't get affected.
6879  window->DC.IdealMaxPos += offset;
6880  window->DC.CursorStartPos += offset;
6881 }
6882 
6883 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond)
6884 {
6885  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6886  SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
6887 }
6888
