6889 void ImGui::SetWindowPos(const char *name, const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond)
6890 {
6891  if (ImGuiWindow *window = FindWindowByName(name))
6892  SetWindowPos(window, pos, cond);
6893 }
6894 
6895 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowSize()
6896 {
6897  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
6898  return window->Size;
6899 }
6900 
6901 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiCond cond)
6902 {
6903  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
6904  if (cond && (window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
6905  return;
6906 
6907  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
6908  window->SetWindowSizeAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6909 
6910  // Set
6911  if (size.x > 0.0f)
6912  {
6913  window->AutoFitFramesX = 0;
6914  window->SizeFull.x = IM_FLOOR(size.x);
6915  }
6916  else
6917  {
6918  window->AutoFitFramesX = 2;
6919  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
6920  }
6921  if (size.y > 0.0f)
6922  {
6923  window->AutoFitFramesY = 0;
6924  window->SizeFull.y = IM_FLOOR(size.y);
6925  }
6926  else
6927  {
6928  window->AutoFitFramesY = 2;
6929  window->AutoFitOnlyGrows = false;
6930  }
6931 }
6932 
6933 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiCond cond)
6934 {
6935  SetWindowSize(GImGui->CurrentWindow, size, cond);
6936 }
6937 
6938 void ImGui::SetWindowSize(const char *name, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiCond cond)
6939 {
6940  if (ImGuiWindow *window = FindWindowByName(name))
6941  SetWindowSize(window, size, cond);
6942 }
6943 
6944 void ImGui::SetWindowCollapsed(ImGuiWindow *window, bool collapsed, ImGuiCond cond)
6945 {
6946  // Test condition (NB: bit 0 is always true) and clear flags for next time
6947  if (cond && (window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags & cond) == 0)
6948  return;
6949  window->SetWindowCollapsedAllowFlags &= ~(ImGuiCond_Once | ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver | ImGuiCond_Appearing);
6950 
6951  // Set
6952  window->Collapsed = collapsed;
6953 }
6954 
6955 void ImGui::SetWindowHitTestHole(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImVec2 &pos, const ImVec2 &size)
6956 {
6957  IM_ASSERT(window->HitTestHoleSize.x == 0); // We don't support multiple holes/hit test filters
6958  window->HitTestHoleSize = ImVec2ih(size);
6959  window->HitTestHoleOffset = ImVec2ih(pos - window->Pos);
6960 }

6964  SetWindowCollapsed(GImGui->CurrentWindow, collapsed, cond);
6965 }

6990 void ImGui::SetWindowFocus(const char *name)
6991 {
6992  if (name)
6993  {
6994  if (ImGuiWindow *window = FindWindowByName(name))
6995  FocusWindow(window);
6996  }
6997  else
6998  {
6999  FocusWindow(NULL);
7000  }
7001 }
7002 
7003 void ImGui::SetNextWindowPos(const ImVec2 &pos, ImGuiCond cond, const ImVec2 &pivot)
7004 {
7005  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7006  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7007  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos;
7008  g.NextWindowData.PosVal = pos;
7009  g.NextWindowData.PosPivotVal = pivot;
7010  g.NextWindowData.PosCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7011 }
7012 
7013 void ImGui::SetNextWindowSize(const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiCond cond)
7014 {
7015  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7016  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7017  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSize;
7018  g.NextWindowData.SizeVal = size;
7019  g.NextWindowData.SizeCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7020 }
7021 
7022 void ImGui::SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(const ImVec2 &size_min, const ImVec2 &size_max, ImGuiSizeCallback custom_callback, void *custom_callback_user_data)
7023 {
7024  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7025  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasSizeConstraint;
7026  g.NextWindowData.SizeConstraintRect = ImRect(size_min, size_max);
7027  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallback = custom_callback;
7028  g.NextWindowData.SizeCallbackUserData = custom_callback_user_data;
7029 }

7031 // Content size = inner scrollable rectangle, padded with WindowPadding.
7032 // SetNextWindowContentSize(ImVec2(100,100) + ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize will always allow submitting a 100x100 item.
7033 void ImGui::SetNextWindowContentSize(const ImVec2 &size)
7034 {
7035  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7036  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasContentSize;
7037  g.NextWindowData.ContentSizeVal = ImFloor(size);
7038 }

7045 }

7048 {

7050  IM_ASSERT(cond == 0 || ImIsPowerOfTwo(cond)); // Make sure the user doesn't attempt to combine multiple condition flags.
7051  g.NextWindowData.Flags |= ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasCollapsed;
7052  g.NextWindowData.CollapsedVal = collapsed;
7053  g.NextWindowData.CollapsedCond = cond ? cond : ImGuiCond_Always;
7054 }

7105 void ImGui::PushFocusScope(ImGuiID id)
7106 {
7107  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7108  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7109  g.FocusScopeStack.push_back(window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent);
7110  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = id;
7111 }
7112 
7113 void ImGui::PopFocusScope()
7114 {
7115  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7116  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7117  IM_ASSERT(g.FocusScopeStack.Size > 0); // Too many PopFocusScope() ?
7118  window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent = g.FocusScopeStack.back();
7119  g.FocusScopeStack.pop_back();
7120 }
7121 
7122 void ImGui::SetKeyboardFocusHere(int offset)
7123 {
7124  IM_ASSERT(offset >= -1); // -1 is allowed but not below
7125  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7126  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7127  g.TabFocusRequestNextWindow = window;
7128  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterRegular = window->DC.FocusCounterRegular + 1 + offset;
7129  g.TabFocusRequestNextCounterTabStop = INT_MAX;
7130 }
7131 
7132 void ImGui::SetItemDefaultFocus()
7133 {
7134  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7135  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7136  if (!window->Appearing)
7137  return;
7138  if (g.NavWindow == window->RootWindowForNav && (g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0) && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
7139  {
7140  g.NavInitRequest = false;
7141  g.NavInitResultId = g.LastItemData.ID;
7142  g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min - window->Pos, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max - window->Pos);
7143  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
7144  if (!IsItemVisible())
7145  SetScrollHereY();
7146  }
7147 }
7148

7152  window->DC.StateStorage = tree ? tree : &window->StateStorage;
7153 }

7159 }
7160 
7161 void ImGui::PushID(const char *str_id)

7164  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7165  ImGuiID id = window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(str_id);
7166  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7167 }

7172  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7173  ImGuiID id = window->GetIDNoKeepAlive(str_id_begin, str_id_end);
7174  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7175 }

7193 // Push a given id value ignoring the ID stack as a seed.
7194 void ImGui::PushOverrideID(ImGuiID id)
7195 {
7196  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7197  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7198  window->IDStack.push_back(id);
7199 }
7200 
7201 // Helper to avoid a common series of PushOverrideID -> GetID() -> PopID() call
7202 // (note that when using this pattern, TestEngine's "Stack Tool" will tend to not display the intermediate stack level.
7203 // for that to work we would need to do PushOverrideID() -> ItemAdd() -> PopID() which would alter widget code a little more)
7204 ImGuiID ImGui::GetIDWithSeed(const char *str, const char *str_end, ImGuiID seed)
7205 {
7206  ImGuiID id = ImHashStr(str, str_end ? (str_end - str) : 0, seed);
7207  ImGui::KeepAliveID(id);
7208 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
7209  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7210  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ID_INFO2(id, ImGuiDataType_String, str, str_end);
7211 #endif
7212  return id;
7213 }
7214 
7215 void ImGui::PopID()
7216 {
7217  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7218  IM_ASSERT(window->IDStack.Size > 1); // Too many PopID(), or could be popping in a wrong/different window?
7219  window->IDStack.pop_back();
7220 }
7221 
7222 ImGuiID ImGui::GetID(const char *str_id)
7223 {
7224  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7225  return window->GetID(str_id);
7226 }
7227 
7228 ImGuiID ImGui::GetID(const char *str_id_begin, const char *str_id_end)
7229 {
7230  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7231  return window->GetID(str_id_begin, str_id_end);
7232 }

7236  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7237  return window->GetID(ptr_id);
7238 }

7240 bool ImGui::IsRectVisible(const ImVec2 &size)
7241 {
7242  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7243  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(ImRect(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + size));
7244 }
7245 
7246 bool ImGui::IsRectVisible(const ImVec2 &rect_min, const ImVec2 &rect_max)
7247 {
7248  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7249  return window->ClipRect.Overlaps(ImRect(rect_min, rect_max));
7250 }
7251 
7252 
7253 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7254 // [SECTION] ERROR CHECKING
7255 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7256 
7257 // Helper function to verify ABI compatibility between caller code and compiled version of Dear ImGui.
7258 // Verify that the type sizes are matching between the calling file's compilation unit and imgui.cpp's compilation unit
7259 // If the user has inconsistent compilation settings, imgui configuration #define, packing pragma, etc. your user code
7260 // may see different structures than what imgui.cpp sees, which is problematic.
7261 // We usually require settings to be in imconfig.h to make sure that they are accessible to all compilation units involved with Dear ImGui.
7262 bool ImGui::DebugCheckVersionAndDataLayout(const char *version, size_t sz_io, size_t sz_style, size_t sz_vec2, size_t sz_vec4, size_t sz_vert, size_t sz_idx)
7263 {
7264  bool error = false;
7265  if (strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) != 0)
7266  {
7267  error = true; IM_ASSERT(strcmp(version, IMGUI_VERSION) == 0 && "Mismatched version string!");
7268  }
7269  if (sz_io != sizeof(ImGuiIO))
7270  {
7271  error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_io == sizeof(ImGuiIO) && "Mismatched struct layout!");
7272  }
7273  if (sz_style != sizeof(ImGuiStyle))
7274  {
7275  error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_style == sizeof(ImGuiStyle) && "Mismatched struct layout!");
7276  }
7277  if (sz_vec2 != sizeof(ImVec2))
7278  {
7279  error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec2 == sizeof(ImVec2) && "Mismatched struct layout!");
7280  }
7281  if (sz_vec4 != sizeof(ImVec4))
7282  {
7283  error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vec4 == sizeof(ImVec4) && "Mismatched struct layout!");
7284  }
7285  if (sz_vert != sizeof(ImDrawVert))
7286  {
7287  error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_vert == sizeof(ImDrawVert) && "Mismatched struct layout!");
7288  }
7289  if (sz_idx != sizeof(ImDrawIdx))
7290  {
7291  error = true; IM_ASSERT(sz_idx == sizeof(ImDrawIdx) && "Mismatched struct layout!");
7292  }
7293  return !error;
7294 }
7295 
7296 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckNewFrameSanityChecks()
7297 {
7298  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7299 
7300  // Check user IM_ASSERT macro
7301  // (IF YOU GET A WARNING OR COMPILE ERROR HERE: it means your assert macro is incorrectly defined!
7302  // If your macro uses multiple statements, it NEEDS to be surrounded by a 'do { ... } while (0)' block.
7303  // This is a common C/C++ idiom to allow multiple statements macros to be used in control flow blocks.)
7304  // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) if (SomeCode(EXPR)) SomeMoreCode(); // Wrong!
7305  // #define IM_ASSERT(EXPR) do { if (SomeCode(EXPR)) SomeMoreCode(); } while (0) // Correct!
7306  if (true) IM_ASSERT(1); else IM_ASSERT(0);
7307 
7308  // Check user data
7309  // (We pass an error message in the assert expression to make it visible to programmers who are not using a debugger, as most assert handlers display their argument)
7310  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
7311  IM_ASSERT((g.IO.Time > 0.0f || g.FrameCount == 0) && "Need a positive Time!");
7312  IM_ASSERT((g.FrameCount == 0 || g.FrameCountEnded == g.FrameCount) && "Forgot to call Render() or EndFrame() at the end of the previous frame?");
7313  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.DisplaySize.x >= 0.0f && g.IO.DisplaySize.y >= 0.0f && "Invalid DisplaySize value!");
7314  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.Fonts->IsBuilt() && "Font Atlas not built! Make sure you called ImGui_ImplXXXX_NewFrame() function for renderer backend, which should call io.Fonts->GetTexDataAsRGBA32() / GetTexDataAsAlpha8()");
7315  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CurveTessellationTol > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
7316  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.CircleTessellationMaxError > 0.0f && "Invalid style setting!");
7317  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.Alpha >= 0.0f && g.Style.Alpha <= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting!"); // Allows us to avoid a few clamps in color computations
7318  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMinSize.x >= 1.0f && g.Style.WindowMinSize.y >= 1.0f && "Invalid style setting.");
7319  IM_ASSERT(g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_None || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Left || g.Style.WindowMenuButtonPosition == ImGuiDir_Right);
7320  for (int n = 0; n < ImGuiKey_COUNT; n++)
7321  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[n] >= -1 && g.IO.KeyMap[n] < IM_ARRAYSIZE(g.IO.KeysDown) && "io.KeyMap[] contains an out of bound value (need to be 0..512, or -1 for unmapped key)");
7322 
7323  // Check: required key mapping (we intentionally do NOT check all keys to not pressure user into setting up everything, but Space is required and was only added in 1.60 WIP)
7324  if (g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard)
7325  IM_ASSERT(g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Space] != -1 && "ImGuiKey_Space is not mapped, required for keyboard navigation.");
7326 
7327  // Check: the io.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges option requires backend to honor mouse cursor changes and set the ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors flag accordingly.
7328  if (g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges && !(g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors))
7329  g.IO.ConfigWindowsResizeFromEdges = false;
7330 }
7331 
7332 static void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameSanityChecks()
7333 {
7334  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7335 
7336  // Verify that io.KeyXXX fields haven't been tampered with. Key mods should not be modified between NewFrame() and EndFrame()
7337  // One possible reason leading to this assert is that your backends update inputs _AFTER_ NewFrame().
7338  // It is known that when some modal native windows called mid-frame takes focus away, some backends such as GLFW will
7339  // send key release events mid-frame. This would normally trigger this assertion and lead to sheared inputs.
7340  // We silently accommodate for this case by ignoring/ the case where all io.KeyXXX modifiers were released (aka key_mod_flags == 0),
7341  // while still correctly asserting on mid-frame key press events.
7342  const ImGuiKeyModFlags key_mod_flags = GetMergedKeyModFlags();
7343  IM_ASSERT((key_mod_flags == 0 || g.IO.KeyMods == key_mod_flags) && "Mismatching io.KeyCtrl/io.KeyShift/io.KeyAlt/io.KeySuper vs io.KeyMods");
7344  IM_UNUSED(key_mod_flags);
7345 
7346  // Recover from errors
7347  //ErrorCheckEndFrameRecover();
7348 
7349  // Report when there is a mismatch of Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls. Important: Remember that the Begin/BeginChild API requires you
7350  // to always call End/EndChild even if Begin/BeginChild returns false! (this is unfortunately inconsistent with most other Begin* API).
7351  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size != 1)
7352  {
7353  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
7354  {
7355  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you forget to call End/EndChild?");
7356  while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 1)
7357  End();
7358  }
7359  else
7360  {
7361  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1, "Mismatched Begin/BeginChild vs End/EndChild calls: did you call End/EndChild too much?");
7362  }
7363  }
7364 
7365  IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(g.GroupStack.Size == 0, "Missing EndGroup call!");
7366 }
7367 
7368 // Experimental recovery from incorrect usage of BeginXXX/EndXXX/PushXXX/PopXXX calls.
7369 // Must be called during or before EndFrame().
7370 // This is generally flawed as we are not necessarily End/Popping things in the right order.
7371 // FIXME: Can't recover from inside BeginTabItem/EndTabItem yet.
7372 // FIXME: Can't recover from interleaved BeginTabBar/Begin
7373 void ImGui::ErrorCheckEndFrameRecover(ImGuiErrorLogCallback log_callback, void *user_data)
7374 {
7375  // PVS-Studio V1044 is "Loop break conditions do not depend on the number of iterations"
7376  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7377  while (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size > 0)
7378  {
7379  while (g.CurrentTable && (g.CurrentTable->OuterWindow == g.CurrentWindow || g.CurrentTable->InnerWindow == g.CurrentWindow))
7380  {
7381  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndTable() in '%s'", g.CurrentTable->OuterWindow->Name);
7382  EndTable();
7383  }
7384  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7385  IM_ASSERT(window != NULL);
7386  while (g.CurrentTabBar != NULL) //-V1044
7387  {
7388  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndTabBar() in '%s'", window->Name);
7389  EndTabBar();
7390  }
7391  while (window->DC.TreeDepth > 0)
7392  {
7393  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing TreePop() in '%s'", window->Name);
7394  TreePop();
7395  }
7396  while (g.GroupStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfGroupStack)
7397  {
7398  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndGroup() in '%s'", window->Name);
7399  EndGroup();
7400  }
7401  while (window->IDStack.Size > 1)
7402  {
7403  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopID() in '%s'", window->Name);
7404  PopID();
7405  }
7406  while (g.ColorStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfColorStack)
7407  {
7408  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopStyleColor() in '%s' for ImGuiCol_%s", window->Name, GetStyleColorName(g.ColorStack.back().Col));
7409  PopStyleColor();
7410  }
7411  while (g.StyleVarStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfStyleVarStack)
7412  {
7413  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopStyleVar() in '%s'", window->Name);
7414  PopStyleVar();
7415  }
7416  while (g.FocusScopeStack.Size > window->DC.StackSizesOnBegin.SizeOfFocusScopeStack)
7417  {
7418  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing PopFocusScope() in '%s'", window->Name);
7419  PopFocusScope();
7420  }
7421  if (g.CurrentWindowStack.Size == 1)
7422  {
7423  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow->IsFallbackWindow);
7424  break;
7425  }
7426  IM_ASSERT(window == g.CurrentWindow);
7427  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
7428  {
7429  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing EndChild() for '%s'", window->Name);
7430  EndChild();
7431  }
7432  else
7433  {
7434  if (log_callback) log_callback(user_data, "Recovered from missing End() for '%s'", window->Name);
7435  End();
7436  }
7437  }
7438 }
7439 
7440 // Save current stack sizes for later compare
7441 void ImGuiStackSizes::SetToCurrentState()
7442 {
7443  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7444  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7445  SizeOfIDStack = (short)window->IDStack.Size;
7446  SizeOfColorStack = (short)g.ColorStack.Size;
7447  SizeOfStyleVarStack = (short)g.StyleVarStack.Size;
7448  SizeOfFontStack = (short)g.FontStack.Size;
7449  SizeOfFocusScopeStack = (short)g.FocusScopeStack.Size;
7450  SizeOfGroupStack = (short)g.GroupStack.Size;
7451  SizeOfBeginPopupStack = (short)g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
7452 }
7453 
7454 // Compare to detect usage errors
7455 void ImGuiStackSizes::CompareWithCurrentState()
7456 {
7457  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7458  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7459  IM_UNUSED(window);
7460 
7461  // Window stacks
7462  // NOT checking: DC.ItemWidth, DC.TextWrapPos (per window) to allow user to conveniently push once and not pop (they are cleared on Begin)
7463  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfIDStack == window->IDStack.Size && "PushID/PopID or TreeNode/TreePop Mismatch!");
7464 
7465  // Global stacks
7466  // For color, style and font stacks there is an incentive to use Push/Begin/Pop/.../End patterns, so we relax our checks a little to allow them.
7467  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfGroupStack == g.GroupStack.Size && "BeginGroup/EndGroup Mismatch!");
7468  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfBeginPopupStack == g.BeginPopupStack.Size && "BeginPopup/EndPopup or BeginMenu/EndMenu Mismatch!");
7469  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfColorStack >= g.ColorStack.Size && "PushStyleColor/PopStyleColor Mismatch!");
7470  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfStyleVarStack >= g.StyleVarStack.Size && "PushStyleVar/PopStyleVar Mismatch!");
7471  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfFontStack >= g.FontStack.Size && "PushFont/PopFont Mismatch!");
7472  IM_ASSERT(SizeOfFocusScopeStack == g.FocusScopeStack.Size && "PushFocusScope/PopFocusScope Mismatch!");
7473 }
7474 
7475 
7476 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7477 // [SECTION] LAYOUT
7478 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7479 // - ItemSize()
7480 // - ItemAdd()
7481 // - SameLine()
7482 // - GetCursorScreenPos()
7483 // - SetCursorScreenPos()
7484 // - GetCursorPos(), GetCursorPosX(), GetCursorPosY()
7485 // - SetCursorPos(), SetCursorPosX(), SetCursorPosY()
7486 // - GetCursorStartPos()
7487 // - Indent()
7488 // - Unindent()
7489 // - SetNextItemWidth()
7490 // - PushItemWidth()
7491 // - PushMultiItemsWidths()
7492 // - PopItemWidth()
7493 // - CalcItemWidth()
7494 // - CalcItemSize()
7495 // - GetTextLineHeight()
7496 // - GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
7497 // - GetFrameHeight()
7498 // - GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
7499 // - GetContentRegionMax()
7500 // - GetContentRegionMaxAbs() [Internal]
7501 // - GetContentRegionAvail(),
7502 // - GetWindowContentRegionMin(), GetWindowContentRegionMax()
7503 // - GetWindowContentRegionWidth()
7504 // - BeginGroup()
7505 // - EndGroup()
7506 // Also see in imgui_widgets: tab bars, columns.
7507 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7508 
7509 // Advance cursor given item size for layout.
7510 // Register minimum needed size so it can extend the bounding box used for auto-fit calculation.
7511 // See comments in ItemAdd() about how/why the size provided to ItemSize() vs ItemAdd() may often different.
7512 void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImVec2 &size, float text_baseline_y)
7513 {
7514  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7515  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7516  if (window->SkipItems)
7517  return;
7518 
7519  // We increase the height in this function to accommodate for baseline offset.
7520  // In theory we should be offsetting the starting position (window->DC.CursorPos), that will be the topic of a larger refactor,
7521  // but since ItemSize() is not yet an API that moves the cursor (to handle e.g. wrapping) enlarging the height has the same effect.
7522  const float offset_to_match_baseline_y = (text_baseline_y >= 0) ? ImMax(0.0f, window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset - text_baseline_y) : 0.0f;
7523  const float line_height = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineSize.y, size.y + offset_to_match_baseline_y);
7524 
7525  // Always align ourselves on pixel boundaries
7526  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(window->DC.CursorPos, window->DC.CursorPos + ImVec2(size.x, line_height), IM_COL32(255,0,0,200)); // [DEBUG]
7527  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x;
7528  window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y = window->DC.CursorPos.y;
7529  window->DC.CursorPos.x = IM_FLOOR(window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x); // Next line
7530  window->DC.CursorPos.y = IM_FLOOR(window->DC.CursorPos.y + line_height + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y); // Next line
7531  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x);
7532  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
7533  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddCircle(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, 3.0f, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255), 4); // [DEBUG]
7534 
7535  window->DC.PrevLineSize.y = line_height;
7536  window->DC.CurrLineSize.y = 0.0f;
7537  window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset, text_baseline_y);
7538  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = 0.0f;
7539 
7540  // Horizontal layout mode
7541  if (window->DC.LayoutType == ImGuiLayoutType_Horizontal)
7542  SameLine();
7543 }
7544 
7545 void ImGui::ItemSize(const ImRect &bb, float text_baseline_y)
7546 {
7547  ItemSize(bb.GetSize(), text_baseline_y);
7548 }
7549 
7550 // Declare item bounding box for clipping and interaction.
7551 // Note that the size can be different than the one provided to ItemSize(). Typically, widgets that spread over available surface
7552 // declare their minimum size requirement to ItemSize() and provide a larger region to ItemAdd() which is used drawing/interaction.
7553 bool ImGui::ItemAdd(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id, const ImRect *nav_bb_arg, ImGuiItemAddFlags flags)
7554 {
7555  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7556  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7557 
7558  // Set item data
7559  g.LastItemData.ID = id;
7560  g.LastItemData.Rect = bb;
7561  g.LastItemData.InFlags = g.CurrentItemFlags;
7562  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags = ImGuiItemStatusFlags_None;
7563 
7564  // Directional navigation processing
7565  if (id != 0)
7566  {
7567  // Runs prior to clipping early-out
7568  // (a) So that NavInitRequest can be honored, for newly opened windows to select a default widget
7569  // (b) So that we can scroll up/down past clipped items. This adds a small O(N) cost to regular navigation requests
7570  // unfortunately, but it is still limited to one window. It may not scale very well for windows with ten of
7571  // thousands of item, but at least NavMoveRequest is only set on user interaction, aka maximum once a frame.
7572  // We could early out with "if (is_clipped && !g.NavInitRequest) return false;" but when we wouldn't be able
7573  // to reach unclipped widgets. This would work if user had explicit scrolling control (e.g. mapped on a stick).
7574  // We intentionally don't check if g.NavWindow != NULL because g.NavAnyRequest should only be set when it is non null.
7575  // If we crash on a NULL g.NavWindow we need to fix the bug elsewhere.
7576  window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext |= (1 << window->DC.NavLayerCurrent);
7577  if (g.NavId == id || g.NavAnyRequest)
7578  if (g.NavWindow->RootWindowForNav == window->RootWindowForNav)
7579  if (window == g.NavWindow || ((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened))
7580  NavProcessItem(window, nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb, id);
7581 
7582  // [DEBUG] Item Picker tool, when enabling the "extended" version we perform the check in ItemAdd()
7583 #ifdef IMGUI_DEBUG_TOOL_ITEM_PICKER_EX
7584  if (id == g.DebugItemPickerBreakId)
7585  {
7586  IM_DEBUG_BREAK();
7587  g.DebugItemPickerBreakId = 0;
7588  }
7589 #endif
7590  }
7591  g.NextItemData.Flags = ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_None;
7592 
7593 #ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_TEST_ENGINE
7594  if (id != 0)
7595  IMGUI_TEST_ENGINE_ITEM_ADD(nav_bb_arg ? *nav_bb_arg : bb, id);
7596 #endif
7597 
7598  // Clipping test
7599  const bool is_clipped = IsClippedEx(bb, id, false);
7600  if (is_clipped)
7601  return false;
7602  //if (g.IO.KeyAlt) window->DrawList->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,255,0,120)); // [DEBUG]
7603 
7604  // Tab stop handling (previously was using internal ItemFocusable() api)
7605  // FIXME-NAV: We would now want to move this above the clipping test, but this would require being able to scroll and currently this would mean an extra frame. (#4079, #343)
7606  if (flags & ImGuiItemAddFlags_Focusable)
7607  ItemFocusable(window, id);
7608 
7609  // We need to calculate this now to take account of the current clipping rectangle (as items like Selectable may change them)
7610  if (IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max))
7611  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
7612  return true;
7613 }
7614 
7615 // Gets back to previous line and continue with horizontal layout
7616 // offset_from_start_x == 0 : follow right after previous item
7617 // offset_from_start_x != 0 : align to specified x position (relative to window/group left)
7618 // spacing_w < 0 : use default spacing if pos_x == 0, no spacing if pos_x != 0
7619 // spacing_w >= 0 : enforce spacing amount
7620 void ImGui::SameLine(float offset_from_start_x, float spacing_w)
7621 {
7622  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7623  if (window->SkipItems)
7624  return;
7625 
7626  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7627  if (offset_from_start_x != 0.0f)
7628  {
7629  if (spacing_w < 0.0f) spacing_w = 0.0f;
7630  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + offset_from_start_x + spacing_w + window->DC.GroupOffset.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7631  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
7632  }
7633  else
7634  {
7635  if (spacing_w < 0.0f) spacing_w = g.Style.ItemSpacing.x;
7636  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.x + spacing_w;
7637  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y;
7638  }
7639  window->DC.CurrLineSize = window->DC.PrevLineSize;
7640  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset;
7641 }
7642 
7643 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorScreenPos()
7644 {
7645  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7646  return window->DC.CursorPos;
7647 }
7648 
7649 void ImGui::SetCursorScreenPos(const ImVec2 &pos)
7650 {
7651  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7652  window->DC.CursorPos = pos;
7653  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
7654 }
7655 
7656 // User generally sees positions in window coordinates. Internally we store CursorPos in absolute screen coordinates because it is more convenient.
7657 // Conversion happens as we pass the value to user, but it makes our naming convention confusing because GetCursorPos() == (DC.CursorPos - window.Pos). May want to rename 'DC.CursorPos'.
7658 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorPos()
7659 {
7660  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7661  return window->DC.CursorPos - window->Pos + window->Scroll;
7662 }
7663 
7664 float ImGui::GetCursorPosX()
7665 {
7666  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7667  return window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x + window->Scroll.x;
7668 }
7669 
7670 float ImGui::GetCursorPosY()
7671 {
7672  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7673  return window->DC.CursorPos.y - window->Pos.y + window->Scroll.y;
7674 }
7675 
7676 void ImGui::SetCursorPos(const ImVec2 &local_pos)
7677 {
7678  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7679  window->DC.CursorPos = window->Pos - window->Scroll + local_pos;
7680  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorPos);
7681 }
7682 
7683 void ImGui::SetCursorPosX(float x)
7684 {
7685  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7686  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x - window->Scroll.x + x;
7687  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.x, window->DC.CursorPos.x);
7688 }
7689 
7690 void ImGui::SetCursorPosY(float y)
7691 {
7692  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7693  window->DC.CursorPos.y = window->Pos.y - window->Scroll.y + y;
7694  window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y = ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos.y, window->DC.CursorPos.y);
7695 }
7696 
7697 ImVec2 ImGui::GetCursorStartPos()
7698 {
7699  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindowRead();
7700  return window->DC.CursorStartPos - window->Pos;
7701 }
7702 
7703 void ImGui::Indent(float indent_w)
7704 {
7705  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7706  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7707  window->DC.Indent.x += (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
7708  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7709 }
7710 
7711 void ImGui::Unindent(float indent_w)
7712 {
7713  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7714  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7715  window->DC.Indent.x -= (indent_w != 0.0f) ? indent_w : g.Style.IndentSpacing;
7716  window->DC.CursorPos.x = window->Pos.x + window->DC.Indent.x + window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7717 }
7718 
7719 // Affect large frame+labels widgets only.
7720 void ImGui::SetNextItemWidth(float item_width)
7721 {
7722  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7723  g.NextItemData.Flags |= ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
7724  g.NextItemData.Width = item_width;
7725 }
7726 
7727 // FIXME: Remove the == 0.0f behavior?
7728 void ImGui::PushItemWidth(float item_width)
7729 {
7730  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7731  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7732  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth); // Backup current width
7733  window->DC.ItemWidth = (item_width == 0.0f ? window->ItemWidthDefault : item_width);
7734  g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
7735 }
7736 
7737 void ImGui::PushMultiItemsWidths(int components, float w_full)
7738 {
7739  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7740  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7741  const ImGuiStyle &style = g.Style;
7742  const float w_item_one = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR((w_full - (style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)) / (float)components));
7743  const float w_item_last = ImMax(1.0f, IM_FLOOR(w_full - (w_item_one + style.ItemInnerSpacing.x) * (components - 1)));
7744  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(window->DC.ItemWidth); // Backup current width
7745  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_last);
7746  for (int i = 0; i < components - 2; i++)
7747  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.push_back(w_item_one);
7748  window->DC.ItemWidth = (components == 1) ? w_item_last : w_item_one;
7749  g.NextItemData.Flags &= ~ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth;
7750 }
7751 
7752 void ImGui::PopItemWidth()
7753 {
7754  ImGuiWindow *window = GetCurrentWindow();
7755  window->DC.ItemWidth = window->DC.ItemWidthStack.back();
7756  window->DC.ItemWidthStack.pop_back();
7757 }
7758 
7759 // Calculate default item width given value passed to PushItemWidth() or SetNextItemWidth().
7760 // The SetNextItemWidth() data is generally cleared/consumed by ItemAdd() or NextItemData.ClearFlags()
7761 float ImGui::CalcItemWidth()
7762 {
7763  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7764  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7765  float w;
7766  if (g.NextItemData.Flags & ImGuiNextItemDataFlags_HasWidth)
7767  w = g.NextItemData.Width;
7768  else
7769  w = window->DC.ItemWidth;
7770  if (w < 0.0f)
7771  {
7772  float region_max_x = GetContentRegionMaxAbs().x;
7773  w = ImMax(1.0f, region_max_x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + w);
7774  }
7775  w = IM_FLOOR(w);
7776  return w;
7777 }
7778 
7779 // [Internal] Calculate full item size given user provided 'size' parameter and default width/height. Default width is often == CalcItemWidth().
7780 // Those two functions CalcItemWidth vs CalcItemSize are awkwardly named because they are not fully symmetrical.
7781 // Note that only CalcItemWidth() is publicly exposed.
7782 // The 4.0f here may be changed to match CalcItemWidth() and/or BeginChild() (right now we have a mismatch which is harmless but undesirable)
7783 ImVec2 ImGui::CalcItemSize(ImVec2 size, float default_w, float default_h)
7784 {
7785  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7786 
7787  ImVec2 region_max;
7788  if (size.x < 0.0f || size.y < 0.0f)
7789  region_max = GetContentRegionMaxAbs();
7790 
7791  if (size.x == 0.0f)
7792  size.x = default_w;
7793  else if (size.x < 0.0f)
7794  size.x = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.x - window->DC.CursorPos.x + size.x);
7795 
7796  if (size.y == 0.0f)
7797  size.y = default_h;
7798  else if (size.y < 0.0f)
7799  size.y = ImMax(4.0f, region_max.y - window->DC.CursorPos.y + size.y);
7800 
7801  return size;
7802 }
7803 
7804 float ImGui::GetTextLineHeight()
7805 {
7806  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7807  return g.FontSize;
7808 }
7809 
7810 float ImGui::GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing()
7811 {
7812  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7813  return g.FontSize + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
7814 }
7815 
7816 float ImGui::GetFrameHeight()
7817 {
7818  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7819  return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f;
7820 }
7821 
7822 float ImGui::GetFrameHeightWithSpacing()
7823 {
7824  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7825  return g.FontSize + g.Style.FramePadding.y * 2.0f + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y;
7826 }
7827 
7828 // FIXME: All the Contents Region function are messy or misleading. WE WILL AIM TO OBSOLETE ALL OF THEM WITH A NEW "WORK RECT" API. Thanks for your patience!
7829 
7830 // FIXME: This is in window space (not screen space!).
7831 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMax()
7832 {
7833  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7834  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7835  ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
7836  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns || g.CurrentTable)
7837  mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x - window->Pos.x;
7838  return mx;
7839 }
7840 
7841 // [Internal] Absolute coordinate. Saner. This is not exposed until we finishing refactoring work rect features.
7842 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionMaxAbs()
7843 {
7844  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7845  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7846  ImVec2 mx = window->ContentRegionRect.Max;
7847  if (window->DC.CurrentColumns || g.CurrentTable)
7848  mx.x = window->WorkRect.Max.x;
7849  return mx;
7850 }
7851 
7852 ImVec2 ImGui::GetContentRegionAvail()
7853 {
7854  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7855  return GetContentRegionMaxAbs() - window->DC.CursorPos;
7856 }
7857 
7858 // In window space (not screen space!)
7859 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMin()
7860 {
7861  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7862  return window->ContentRegionRect.Min - window->Pos;
7863 }
7864 
7865 ImVec2 ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionMax()
7866 {
7867  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7868  return window->ContentRegionRect.Max - window->Pos;
7869 }
7870 
7871 float ImGui::GetWindowContentRegionWidth()
7872 {
7873  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
7874  return window->ContentRegionRect.GetWidth();
7875 }
7876 
7877 // Lock horizontal starting position + capture group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.)
7878 // Groups are currently a mishmash of functionalities which should perhaps be clarified and separated.
7879 void ImGui::BeginGroup()
7880 {
7881  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7882  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7883 
7884  g.GroupStack.resize(g.GroupStack.Size + 1);
7885  ImGuiGroupData &group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
7886  group_data.WindowID = window->ID;
7887  group_data.BackupCursorPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7888  group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorMaxPos;
7889  group_data.BackupIndent = window->DC.Indent;
7890  group_data.BackupGroupOffset = window->DC.GroupOffset;
7891  group_data.BackupCurrLineSize = window->DC.CurrLineSize;
7892  group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset = window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset;
7893  group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive = g.ActiveIdIsAlive;
7894  group_data.BackupHoveredIdIsAlive = g.HoveredId != 0;
7895  group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive;
7896  group_data.EmitItem = true;
7897 
7898  window->DC.GroupOffset.x = window->DC.CursorPos.x - window->Pos.x - window->DC.ColumnsOffset.x;
7899  window->DC.Indent = window->DC.GroupOffset;
7900  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = window->DC.CursorPos;
7901  window->DC.CurrLineSize = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
7902  if (g.LogEnabled)
7903  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
7904 }
7905 
7906 void ImGui::EndGroup()
7907 {
7908  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
7909  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
7910  IM_ASSERT(g.GroupStack.Size > 0); // Mismatched BeginGroup()/EndGroup() calls
7911 
7912  ImGuiGroupData &group_data = g.GroupStack.back();
7913  IM_ASSERT(group_data.WindowID == window->ID); // EndGroup() in wrong window?
7914 
7915  ImRect group_bb(group_data.BackupCursorPos, ImMax(window->DC.CursorMaxPos, group_data.BackupCursorPos));
7916 
7917  window->DC.CursorPos = group_data.BackupCursorPos;
7918  window->DC.CursorMaxPos = ImMax(group_data.BackupCursorMaxPos, window->DC.CursorMaxPos);
7919  window->DC.Indent = group_data.BackupIndent;
7920  window->DC.GroupOffset = group_data.BackupGroupOffset;
7921  window->DC.CurrLineSize = group_data.BackupCurrLineSize;
7922  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset;
7923  if (g.LogEnabled)
7924  g.LogLinePosY = -FLT_MAX; // To enforce a carriage return
7925 
7926  if (!group_data.EmitItem)
7927  {
7928  g.GroupStack.pop_back();
7929  return;
7930  }
7931 
7932  window->DC.CurrLineTextBaseOffset = ImMax(window->DC.PrevLineTextBaseOffset, group_data.BackupCurrLineTextBaseOffset); // FIXME: Incorrect, we should grab the base offset from the *first line* of the group but it is hard to obtain now.
7933  ItemSize(group_bb.GetSize());
7934  ItemAdd(group_bb, 0);
7935 
7936  // If the current ActiveId was declared within the boundary of our group, we copy it to LastItemId so IsItemActive(), IsItemDeactivated() etc. will be functional on the entire group.
7937  // It would be be neater if we replaced window.DC.LastItemId by e.g. 'bool LastItemIsActive', but would put a little more burden on individual widgets.
7938  // Also if you grep for LastItemId you'll notice it is only used in that context.
7939  // (The two tests not the same because ActiveIdIsAlive is an ID itself, in order to be able to handle ActiveId being overwritten during the frame.)
7940  const bool group_contains_curr_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdIsAlive != g.ActiveId) && (g.ActiveIdIsAlive == g.ActiveId) && g.ActiveId;
7941  const bool group_contains_prev_active_id = (group_data.BackupActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive == false) && (g.ActiveIdPreviousFrameIsAlive == true);
7942  if (group_contains_curr_active_id)
7943  g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveId;
7944  else if (group_contains_prev_active_id)
7945  g.LastItemData.ID = g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame;
7946  g.LastItemData.Rect = group_bb;
7947 
7948  // Forward Hovered flag
7949  const bool group_contains_curr_hovered_id = (group_data.BackupHoveredIdIsAlive == false) && g.HoveredId != 0;
7950  if (group_contains_curr_hovered_id)
7951  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredWindow;
7952 
7953  // Forward Edited flag
7954  if (group_contains_curr_active_id && g.ActiveIdHasBeenEditedThisFrame)
7955  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Edited;
7956 
7957  // Forward Deactivated flag
7958  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDeactivated;
7959  if (group_contains_prev_active_id && g.ActiveId != g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame)
7960  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags |= ImGuiItemStatusFlags_Deactivated;
7961 
7962  g.GroupStack.pop_back();
7963  //window->DrawList->AddRect(group_bb.Min, group_bb.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,255,255)); // [Debug]
7964 }
7965 
7966 
7967 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7968 // [SECTION] SCROLLING
7969 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
7970 
7971 // Helper to snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge,
7972 // So the difference between WindowPadding and ItemSpacing will be in the visible area after scrolling.
7973 // When we refactor the scrolling API this may be configurable with a flag?
7974 // Note that the effect for this won't be visible on X axis with default Style settings as WindowPadding.x == ItemSpacing.x by default.
7975 static float CalcScrollEdgeSnap(float target, float snap_min, float snap_max, float snap_threshold, float center_ratio)
7976 {
7977  if (target <= snap_min + snap_threshold)
7978  return ImLerp(snap_min, target, center_ratio);
7979  if (target >= snap_max - snap_threshold)
7980  return ImLerp(target, snap_max, center_ratio);
7981  return target;
7982 }
7983 
7984 static ImVec2 CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(ImGuiWindow *window)
7985 {
7986  ImVec2 scroll = window->Scroll;
7987  if (window->ScrollTarget.x < FLT_MAX)
7988  {
7989  float decoration_total_width = window->ScrollbarSizes.x;
7990  float center_x_ratio = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x;
7991  float scroll_target_x = window->ScrollTarget.x;
7992  if (window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x > 0.0f)
7993  {
7994  float snap_x_min = 0.0f;
7995  float snap_x_max = window->ScrollMax.x + window->SizeFull.x - decoration_total_width;
7996  scroll_target_x = CalcScrollEdgeSnap(scroll_target_x, snap_x_min, snap_x_max, window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x, center_x_ratio);
7997  }
7998  scroll.x = scroll_target_x - center_x_ratio * (window->SizeFull.x - decoration_total_width);
7999  }
8000  if (window->ScrollTarget.y < FLT_MAX)
8001  {
8002  float decoration_total_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight() + window->ScrollbarSizes.y;
8003  float center_y_ratio = window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y;
8004  float scroll_target_y = window->ScrollTarget.y;
8005  if (window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y > 0.0f)
8006  {
8007  float snap_y_min = 0.0f;
8008  float snap_y_max = window->ScrollMax.y + window->SizeFull.y - decoration_total_height;
8009  scroll_target_y = CalcScrollEdgeSnap(scroll_target_y, snap_y_min, snap_y_max, window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y, center_y_ratio);
8010  }
8011  scroll.y = scroll_target_y - center_y_ratio * (window->SizeFull.y - decoration_total_height);
8012  }
8013  scroll.x = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll.x, 0.0f));
8014  scroll.y = IM_FLOOR(ImMax(scroll.y, 0.0f));
8015  if (!window->Collapsed && !window->SkipItems)
8016  {
8017  scroll.x = ImMin(scroll.x, window->ScrollMax.x);
8018  scroll.y = ImMin(scroll.y, window->ScrollMax.y);
8019  }
8020  return scroll;
8021 }
8022 
8023 // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view
8024 ImVec2 ImGui::ScrollToBringRectIntoView(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &item_rect)
8025 {
8026  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8027  ImRect window_rect(window->InnerRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1));
8028  //GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(window_rect.Min, window_rect.Max, IM_COL32_WHITE); // [DEBUG]
8029 
8030  ImVec2 delta_scroll;
8031  if (!window_rect.Contains(item_rect))
8032  {
8033  if (window->ScrollbarX && item_rect.Min.x < window_rect.Min.x)
8034  SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Min.x - window->Pos.x - g.Style.ItemSpacing.x, 0.0f);
8035  else if (window->ScrollbarX && item_rect.Max.x >= window_rect.Max.x)
8036  SetScrollFromPosX(window, item_rect.Max.x - window->Pos.x + g.Style.ItemSpacing.x, 1.0f);
8037  if (item_rect.Min.y < window_rect.Min.y)
8038  SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Min.y - window->Pos.y - g.Style.ItemSpacing.y, 0.0f);
8039  else if (item_rect.Max.y >= window_rect.Max.y)
8040  SetScrollFromPosY(window, item_rect.Max.y - window->Pos.y + g.Style.ItemSpacing.y, 1.0f);
8041 
8042  ImVec2 next_scroll = CalcNextScrollFromScrollTargetAndClamp(window);
8043  delta_scroll = next_scroll - window->Scroll;
8044  }
8045 
8046  // Also scroll parent window to keep us into view if necessary
8047  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
8048  delta_scroll += ScrollToBringRectIntoView(window->ParentWindow, ImRect(item_rect.Min - delta_scroll, item_rect.Max - delta_scroll));
8049 
8050  return delta_scroll;
8051 }
8052 
8053 float ImGui::GetScrollX()
8054 {
8055  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8056  return window->Scroll.x;
8057 }
8058 
8059 float ImGui::GetScrollY()
8060 {
8061  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8062  return window->Scroll.y;
8063 }
8064 
8065 float ImGui::GetScrollMaxX()
8066 {
8067  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8068  return window->ScrollMax.x;
8069 }
8070 
8071 float ImGui::GetScrollMaxY()
8072 {
8073  ImGuiWindow *window = GImGui->CurrentWindow;
8074  return window->ScrollMax.y;
8075 }
8076 
8077 void ImGui::SetScrollX(ImGuiWindow *window, float scroll_x)
8078 {
8079  window->ScrollTarget.x = scroll_x;
8080  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = 0.0f;
8081  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = 0.0f;
8082 }
8083 
8084 void ImGui::SetScrollY(ImGuiWindow *window, float scroll_y)
8085 {
8086  window->ScrollTarget.y = scroll_y;
8087  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = 0.0f;
8088  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = 0.0f;
8089 }
8090 
8091 void ImGui::SetScrollX(float scroll_x)
8092 {
8093  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8094  SetScrollX(g.CurrentWindow, scroll_x);
8095 }
8096 
8097 void ImGui::SetScrollY(float scroll_y)
8098 {
8099  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8100  SetScrollY(g.CurrentWindow, scroll_y);
8101 }
8102 
8103 // Note that a local position will vary depending on initial scroll value,
8104 // This is a little bit confusing so bear with us:
8105 // - local_pos = (absolution_pos - window->Pos)
8106 // - So local_x/local_y are 0.0f for a position at the upper-left corner of a window,
8107 // and generally local_x/local_y are >(padding+decoration) && <(size-padding-decoration) when in the visible area.
8108 // - They mostly exists because of legacy API.
8109 // Following the rules above, when trying to work with scrolling code, consider that:
8110 // - SetScrollFromPosY(0.0f) == SetScrollY(0.0f + scroll.y) == has no effect!
8111 // - SetScrollFromPosY(-scroll.y) == SetScrollY(-scroll.y + scroll.y) == SetScrollY(0.0f) == reset scroll. Of course writing SetScrollY(0.0f) directly then makes more sense
8112 // We store a target position so centering and clamping can occur on the next frame when we are guaranteed to have a known window size
8113 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(ImGuiWindow *window, float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
8114 {
8115  IM_ASSERT(center_x_ratio >= 0.0f && center_x_ratio <= 1.0f);
8116  window->ScrollTarget.x = IM_FLOOR(local_x + window->Scroll.x); // Convert local position to scroll offset
8117  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.x = center_x_ratio;
8118  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = 0.0f;
8119 }
8120 
8121 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(ImGuiWindow *window, float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
8122 {
8123  IM_ASSERT(center_y_ratio >= 0.0f && center_y_ratio <= 1.0f);
8124  const float decoration_up_height = window->TitleBarHeight() + window->MenuBarHeight(); // FIXME: Would be nice to have a more standardized access to our scrollable/client rect;
8125  local_y -= decoration_up_height;
8126  window->ScrollTarget.y = IM_FLOOR(local_y + window->Scroll.y); // Convert local position to scroll offset
8127  window->ScrollTargetCenterRatio.y = center_y_ratio;
8128  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = 0.0f;
8129 }
8130 
8131 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosX(float local_x, float center_x_ratio)
8132 {
8133  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8134  SetScrollFromPosX(g.CurrentWindow, local_x, center_x_ratio);
8135 }
8136 
8137 void ImGui::SetScrollFromPosY(float local_y, float center_y_ratio)
8138 {
8139  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8140  SetScrollFromPosY(g.CurrentWindow, local_y, center_y_ratio);
8141 }
8142 
8143 // center_x_ratio: 0.0f left of last item, 0.5f horizontal center of last item, 1.0f right of last item.
8144 void ImGui::SetScrollHereX(float center_x_ratio)
8145 {
8146  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8147  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8148  float spacing_x = ImMax(window->WindowPadding.x, g.Style.ItemSpacing.x);
8149  float target_pos_x = ImLerp(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min.x - spacing_x, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max.x + spacing_x, center_x_ratio);
8150  SetScrollFromPosX(window, target_pos_x - window->Pos.x, center_x_ratio); // Convert from absolute to local pos
8151 
8152  // Tweak: snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge
8153  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.x = ImMax(0.0f, window->WindowPadding.x - spacing_x);
8154 }
8155 
8156 // center_y_ratio: 0.0f top of last item, 0.5f vertical center of last item, 1.0f bottom of last item.
8157 void ImGui::SetScrollHereY(float center_y_ratio)
8158 {
8159  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8160  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8161  float spacing_y = ImMax(window->WindowPadding.y, g.Style.ItemSpacing.y);
8162  float target_pos_y = ImLerp(window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y - spacing_y, window->DC.CursorPosPrevLine.y + window->DC.PrevLineSize.y + spacing_y, center_y_ratio);
8163  SetScrollFromPosY(window, target_pos_y - window->Pos.y, center_y_ratio); // Convert from absolute to local pos
8164 
8165  // Tweak: snap on edges when aiming at an item very close to the edge
8166  window->ScrollTargetEdgeSnapDist.y = ImMax(0.0f, window->WindowPadding.y - spacing_y);
8167 }
8168 
8169 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8170 // [SECTION] TOOLTIPS
8171 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8172 
8173 void ImGui::BeginTooltip()
8174 {
8175  BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiWindowFlags_None, ImGuiTooltipFlags_None);
8176 }
8177 
8178 void ImGui::BeginTooltipEx(ImGuiWindowFlags extra_flags, ImGuiTooltipFlags tooltip_flags)
8179 {
8180  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8181 
8182  if (g.DragDropWithinSource || g.DragDropWithinTarget)
8183  {
8184  // The default tooltip position is a little offset to give space to see the context menu (it's also clamped within the current viewport/monitor)
8185  // In the context of a dragging tooltip we try to reduce that offset and we enforce following the cursor.
8186  // Whatever we do we want to call SetNextWindowPos() to enforce a tooltip position and disable clipping the tooltip without our display area, like regular tooltip do.
8187  //ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos - g.ActiveIdClickOffset - g.Style.WindowPadding;
8188  ImVec2 tooltip_pos = g.IO.MousePos + ImVec2(16 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale, 8 * g.Style.MouseCursorScale);
8189  SetNextWindowPos(tooltip_pos);
8190  SetNextWindowBgAlpha(g.Style.Colors[ImGuiCol_PopupBg].w * 0.60f);
8191  //PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_Alpha, g.Style.Alpha * 0.60f); // This would be nice but e.g ColorButton with checkboard has issue with transparent colors :(
8192  tooltip_flags |= ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip;
8193  }
8194 
8195  char window_name[16];
8196  ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", g.TooltipOverrideCount);
8197  if (tooltip_flags & ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip)
8198  if (ImGuiWindow *window = FindWindowByName(window_name))
8199  if (window->Active)
8200  {
8201  // Hide previous tooltip from being displayed. We can't easily "reset" the content of a window so we create a new one.
8202  window->Hidden = true;
8203  window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1; // FIXME: This may not be necessary?
8204  ImFormatString(window_name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(window_name), "##Tooltip_%02d", ++g.TooltipOverrideCount);
8205  }
8206  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize;
8207  Begin(window_name, NULL, flags | extra_flags);
8208 }
8209 
8210 void ImGui::EndTooltip()
8211 {
8212  IM_ASSERT(GetCurrentWindowRead()->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip); // Mismatched BeginTooltip()/EndTooltip() calls
8213  End();
8214 }
8215 
8216 void ImGui::SetTooltipV(const char *fmt, va_list args)
8217 {
8218  BeginTooltipEx(0, ImGuiTooltipFlags_OverridePreviousTooltip);
8219  TextV(fmt, args);
8220  EndTooltip();
8221 }
8222 
8223 void ImGui::SetTooltip(const char *fmt, ...)
8224 {
8225  va_list args;
8226  va_start(args, fmt);
8227  SetTooltipV(fmt, args);
8228  va_end(args);
8229 }
8230 
8231 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8232 // [SECTION] POPUPS
8233 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8234 
8235 // Supported flags: ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel
8236 bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8237 {
8238  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8239  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId)
8240  {
8241  // Return true if any popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack
8242  // This may be used to e.g. test for another popups already opened to handle popups priorities at the same level.
8243  IM_ASSERT(id == 0);
8244  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
8245  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0;
8246  else
8247  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
8248  }
8249  else
8250  {
8251  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel)
8252  {
8253  // Return true if the popup is open anywhere in the popup stack
8254  for (int n = 0; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
8255  if (g.OpenPopupStack[n].PopupId == id)
8256  return true;
8257  return false;
8258  }
8259  else
8260  {
8261  // Return true if the popup is open at the current BeginPopup() level of the popup stack (this is the most-common query)
8262  return g.OpenPopupStack.Size > g.BeginPopupStack.Size && g.OpenPopupStack[g.BeginPopupStack.Size].PopupId == id;
8263  }
8264  }
8265 }
8266 
8267 bool ImGui::IsPopupOpen(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8268 {
8269  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8270  ImGuiID id = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId) ? 0 : g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id);
8271  if ((popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel) && id != 0)
8272  IM_ASSERT(0 && "Cannot use IsPopupOpen() with a string id and ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel."); // But non-string version is legal and used internally
8273  return IsPopupOpen(id, popup_flags);
8274 }
8275 
8276 ImGuiWindow *ImGui::GetTopMostPopupModal()
8277 {
8278  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8279  for (int n = g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
8280  if (ImGuiWindow *popup = g.OpenPopupStack.Data[n].Window)
8281  if (popup->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
8282  return popup;
8283  return NULL;
8284 }
8285 
8286 void ImGui::OpenPopup(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8287 {
8288  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8289  OpenPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), popup_flags);
8290 }
8291 
8292 void ImGui::OpenPopup(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8293 {
8294  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8295 }
8296 
8297 // Mark popup as open (toggle toward open state).
8298 // Popups are closed when user click outside, or activate a pressable item, or CloseCurrentPopup() is called within a BeginPopup()/EndPopup() block.
8299 // Popup identifiers are relative to the current ID-stack (so OpenPopup and BeginPopup needs to be at the same level).
8300 // One open popup per level of the popup hierarchy (NB: when assigning we reset the Window member of ImGuiPopupRef to NULL)
8301 void ImGui::OpenPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8302 {
8303  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8304  ImGuiWindow *parent_window = g.CurrentWindow;
8305  const int current_stack_size = g.BeginPopupStack.Size;
8306 
8307  if (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverExistingPopup)
8308  if (IsPopupOpen(0u, ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId))
8309  return;
8310 
8311  ImGuiPopupData popup_ref; // Tagged as new ref as Window will be set back to NULL if we write this into OpenPopupStack.
8312  popup_ref.PopupId = id;
8313  popup_ref.Window = NULL;
8314  popup_ref.SourceWindow = g.NavWindow;
8315  popup_ref.OpenFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
8316  popup_ref.OpenParentId = parent_window->IDStack.back();
8317  popup_ref.OpenPopupPos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
8318  popup_ref.OpenMousePos = IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos) ? g.IO.MousePos : popup_ref.OpenPopupPos;
8319 
8320  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("OpenPopupEx(0x%08X)\n", id);
8321  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size < current_stack_size + 1)
8322  {
8323  g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
8324  }
8325  else
8326  {
8327  // Gently handle the user mistakenly calling OpenPopup() every frame. It is a programming mistake! However, if we were to run the regular code path, the ui
8328  // would become completely unusable because the popup will always be in hidden-while-calculating-size state _while_ claiming focus. Which would be a very confusing
8329  // situation for the programmer. Instead, we silently allow the popup to proceed, it will keep reappearing and the programming error will be more obvious to understand.
8330  if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id && g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1)
8331  {
8332  g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].OpenFrameCount = popup_ref.OpenFrameCount;
8333  }
8334  else
8335  {
8336  // Close child popups if any, then flag popup for open/reopen
8337  ClosePopupToLevel(current_stack_size, false);
8338  g.OpenPopupStack.push_back(popup_ref);
8339  }
8340 
8341  // When reopening a popup we first refocus its parent, otherwise if its parent is itself a popup it would get closed by ClosePopupsOverWindow().
8342  // This is equivalent to what ClosePopupToLevel() does.
8343  //if (g.OpenPopupStack[current_stack_size].PopupId == id)
8344  // FocusWindow(parent_window);
8345  }
8346 }
8347 
8348 // When popups are stacked, clicking on a lower level popups puts focus back to it and close popups above it.
8349 // This function closes any popups that are over 'ref_window'.
8350 void ImGui::ClosePopupsOverWindow(ImGuiWindow *ref_window, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
8351 {
8352  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8353  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size == 0)
8354  return;
8355 
8356  // Don't close our own child popup windows.
8357  int popup_count_to_keep = 0;
8358  if (ref_window)
8359  {
8360  // Find the highest popup which is a descendant of the reference window (generally reference window = NavWindow)
8361  for (; popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; popup_count_to_keep++)
8362  {
8363  ImGuiPopupData &popup = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_count_to_keep];
8364  if (!popup.Window)
8365  continue;
8366  IM_ASSERT((popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) != 0);
8367  if (popup.Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
8368  continue;
8369 
8370  // Trim the stack unless the popup is a direct parent of the reference window (the reference window is often the NavWindow)
8371  // - With this stack of window, clicking/focusing Popup1 will close Popup2 and Popup3:
8372  // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup2 -> Popup3
8373  // - Each popups may contain child windows, which is why we compare ->RootWindow!
8374  // Window -> Popup1 -> Popup1_Child -> Popup2 -> Popup2_Child
8375  bool ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = false;
8376  for (int n = popup_count_to_keep; n < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; n++)
8377  if (ImGuiWindow *popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[n].Window)
8378  if (popup_window->RootWindow == ref_window->RootWindow)
8379  {
8380  ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup = true;
8381  break;
8382  }
8383  if (!ref_window_is_descendent_of_popup)
8384  break;
8385  }
8386  }
8387  if (popup_count_to_keep < g.OpenPopupStack.Size) // This test is not required but it allows to set a convenient breakpoint on the statement below
8388  {
8389  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("ClosePopupsOverWindow(\"%s\") -> ClosePopupToLevel(%d)\n", ref_window->Name, popup_count_to_keep);
8390  ClosePopupToLevel(popup_count_to_keep, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
8391  }
8392 }
8393 
8394 void ImGui::ClosePopupToLevel(int remaining, bool restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
8395 {
8396  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8397  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("ClosePopupToLevel(%d), restore_focus_to_window_under_popup=%d\n", remaining, restore_focus_to_window_under_popup);
8398  IM_ASSERT(remaining >= 0 && remaining < g.OpenPopupStack.Size);
8399 
8400  // Trim open popup stack
8401  ImGuiWindow *focus_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].SourceWindow;
8402  ImGuiWindow *popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[remaining].Window;
8403  g.OpenPopupStack.resize(remaining);
8404 
8405  if (restore_focus_to_window_under_popup)
8406  {
8407  if (focus_window && !focus_window->WasActive && popup_window)
8408  {
8409  // Fallback
8410  FocusTopMostWindowUnderOne(popup_window, NULL);
8411  }
8412  else
8413  {
8414  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main && focus_window)
8415  focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(focus_window);
8416  FocusWindow(focus_window);
8417  }
8418  }
8419 }
8420 
8421 // Close the popup we have begin-ed into.
8422 void ImGui::CloseCurrentPopup()
8423 {
8424  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8425  int popup_idx = g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1;
8426  if (popup_idx < 0 || popup_idx >= g.OpenPopupStack.Size || g.BeginPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId != g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].PopupId)
8427  return;
8428 
8429  // Closing a menu closes its top-most parent popup (unless a modal)
8430  while (popup_idx > 0)
8431  {
8432  ImGuiWindow *popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx].Window;
8433  ImGuiWindow *parent_popup_window = g.OpenPopupStack[popup_idx - 1].Window;
8434  bool close_parent = false;
8435  if (popup_window && (popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8436  if (parent_popup_window == NULL || !(parent_popup_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
8437  close_parent = true;
8438  if (!close_parent)
8439  break;
8440  popup_idx--;
8441  }
8442  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_POPUP("CloseCurrentPopup %d -> %d\n", g.BeginPopupStack.Size - 1, popup_idx);
8443  ClosePopupToLevel(popup_idx, true);
8444 
8445  // A common pattern is to close a popup when selecting a menu item/selectable that will open another window.
8446  // To improve this usage pattern, we avoid nav highlight for a single frame in the parent window.
8447  // Similarly, we could avoid mouse hover highlight in this window but it is less visually problematic.
8448  if (ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWindow)
8449  window->DC.NavHideHighlightOneFrame = true;
8450 }
8451 
8452 // Attention! BeginPopup() adds default flags which BeginPopupEx()!
8453 bool ImGui::BeginPopupEx(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
8454 {
8455  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8456  if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
8457  {
8458  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8459  return false;
8460  }
8461 
8462  char name[20];
8463  if (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
8464  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Menu_%02d", g.BeginPopupStack.Size); // Recycle windows based on depth
8465  else
8466  ImFormatString(name, IM_ARRAYSIZE(name), "##Popup_%08x", id); // Not recycling, so we can close/open during the same frame
8467 
8468  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup;
8469  bool is_open = Begin(name, NULL, flags);
8470  if (!is_open) // NB: Begin can return false when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
8471  EndPopup();
8472 
8473  return is_open;
8474 }
8475 
8476 bool ImGui::BeginPopup(const char *str_id, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
8477 {
8478  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8479  if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size <= g.BeginPopupStack.Size) // Early out for performance
8480  {
8481  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8482  return false;
8483  }
8484  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings;
8485  return BeginPopupEx(g.CurrentWindow->GetID(str_id), flags);
8486 }
8487 
8488 // If 'p_open' is specified for a modal popup window, the popup will have a regular close button which will close the popup.
8489 // Note that popup visibility status is owned by Dear ImGui (and manipulated with e.g. OpenPopup) so the actual value of *p_open is meaningless here.
8490 bool ImGui::BeginPopupModal(const char *name, bool *p_open, ImGuiWindowFlags flags)
8491 {
8492  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8493  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8494  const ImGuiID id = window->GetID(name);
8495  if (!IsPopupOpen(id, ImGuiPopupFlags_None))
8496  {
8497  g.NextWindowData.ClearFlags(); // We behave like Begin() and need to consume those values
8498  return false;
8499  }
8500 
8501  // Center modal windows by default for increased visibility
8502  // (this won't really last as settings will kick in, and is mostly for backward compatibility. user may do the same themselves)
8503  // FIXME: Should test for (PosCond & window->SetWindowPosAllowFlags) with the upcoming window.
8504  if ((g.NextWindowData.Flags & ImGuiNextWindowDataFlags_HasPos) == 0)
8505  {
8506  const ImGuiViewport *viewport = GetMainViewport();
8507  SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_FirstUseEver, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
8508  }
8509 
8510  flags |= ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoCollapse;
8511  const bool is_open = Begin(name, p_open, flags);
8512  if (!is_open || (p_open && !*p_open)) // NB: is_open can be 'false' when the popup is completely clipped (e.g. zero size display)
8513  {
8514  EndPopup();
8515  if (is_open)
8516  ClosePopupToLevel(g.BeginPopupStack.Size, true);
8517  return false;
8518  }
8519  return is_open;
8520 }
8521 
8522 void ImGui::EndPopup()
8523 {
8524  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8525  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8526  IM_ASSERT(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup); // Mismatched BeginPopup()/EndPopup() calls
8527  IM_ASSERT(g.BeginPopupStack.Size > 0);
8528 
8529  // Make all menus and popups wrap around for now, may need to expose that policy.
8530  if (g.NavWindow == window)
8531  NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY);
8532 
8533  // Child-popups don't need to be laid out
8534  IM_ASSERT(g.WithinEndChild == false);
8535  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)
8536  g.WithinEndChild = true;
8537  End();
8538  g.WithinEndChild = false;
8539 }
8540 
8541 // Helper to open a popup if mouse button is released over the item
8542 // - This is essentially the same as BeginPopupContextItem() but without the trailing BeginPopup()
8543 void ImGui::OpenPopupOnItemClick(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8544 {
8545  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8546  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8547  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8548  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
8549  {
8550  ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : g.LastItemData.ID; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
8551  IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
8552  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8553  }
8554 }
8555 
8556 // This is a helper to handle the simplest case of associating one named popup to one given widget.
8557 // - To create a popup associated to the last item, you generally want to pass a NULL value to str_id.
8558 // - To create a popup with a specific identifier, pass it in str_id.
8559 // - This is useful when using using BeginPopupContextItem() on an item which doesn't have an identifier, e.g. a Text() call.
8560 // - This is useful when multiple code locations may want to manipulate/open the same popup, given an explicit id.
8561 // - You may want to handle the whole on user side if you have specific needs (e.g. tweaking IsItemHovered() parameters).
8562 // This is essentially the same as:
8563 // id = str_id ? GetID(str_id) : GetItemID();
8564 // OpenPopupOnItemClick(str_id);
8565 // return BeginPopup(id);
8566 // Which is essentially the same as:
8567 // id = str_id ? GetID(str_id) : GetItemID();
8568 // if (IsItemHovered() && IsMouseReleased(ImGuiMouseButton_Right))
8569 // OpenPopup(id);
8570 // return BeginPopup(id);
8571 // The main difference being that this is tweaked to avoid computing the ID twice.
8572 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextItem(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8573 {
8574  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8575  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8576  if (window->SkipItems)
8577  return false;
8578  ImGuiID id = str_id ? window->GetID(str_id) : g.LastItemData.ID; // If user hasn't passed an ID, we can use the LastItemID. Using LastItemID as a Popup ID won't conflict!
8579  IM_ASSERT(id != 0); // You cannot pass a NULL str_id if the last item has no identifier (e.g. a Text() item)
8580  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8581  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
8582  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8583  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
8584 }
8585 
8586 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextWindow(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8587 {
8588  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8589  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8590  if (!str_id)
8591  str_id = "window_context";
8592  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
8593  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8594  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AllowWhenBlockedByPopup))
8595  if (!(popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems) || !IsAnyItemHovered())
8596  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8597  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
8598 }
8599 
8600 bool ImGui::BeginPopupContextVoid(const char *str_id, ImGuiPopupFlags popup_flags)
8601 {
8602  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8603  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8604  if (!str_id)
8605  str_id = "void_context";
8606  ImGuiID id = window->GetID(str_id);
8607  int mouse_button = (popup_flags & ImGuiPopupFlags_MouseButtonMask_);
8608  if (IsMouseReleased(mouse_button) && !IsWindowHovered(ImGuiHoveredFlags_AnyWindow))
8609  if (GetTopMostPopupModal() == NULL)
8610  OpenPopupEx(id, popup_flags);
8611  return BeginPopupEx(id, ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
8612 }
8613 
8614 // r_avoid = the rectangle to avoid (e.g. for tooltip it is a rectangle around the mouse cursor which we want to avoid. for popups it's a small point around the cursor.)
8615 // r_outer = the visible area rectangle, minus safe area padding. If our popup size won't fit because of safe area padding we ignore it.
8616 // (r_outer is usually equivalent to the viewport rectangle minus padding, but when multi-viewports are enabled and monitor
8617 // information are available, it may represent the entire platform monitor from the frame of reference of the current viewport.
8618 // this allows us to have tooltips/popups displayed out of the parent viewport.)
8619 ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(const ImVec2 &ref_pos, const ImVec2 &size, ImGuiDir *last_dir, const ImRect &r_outer, const ImRect &r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy policy)
8620 {
8621  ImVec2 base_pos_clamped = ImClamp(ref_pos, r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max - size);
8622  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_avoid.Min, r_avoid.Max, IM_COL32(255,0,0,255));
8623  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r_outer.Min, r_outer.Max, IM_COL32(0,255,0,255));
8624 
8625  // Combo Box policy (we want a connecting edge)
8626  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_ComboBox)
8627  {
8628  const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Left, ImGuiDir_Up };
8629  for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
8630  {
8631  const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
8632  if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
8633  continue;
8634  ImVec2 pos;
8635  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Right (default)
8636  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Min.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Right
8637  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Max.y); // Below, Toward Left
8638  if (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) pos = ImVec2(r_avoid.Max.x - size.x, r_avoid.Min.y - size.y); // Above, Toward Left
8639  if (!r_outer.Contains(ImRect(pos, pos + size)))
8640  continue;
8641  *last_dir = dir;
8642  return pos;
8643  }
8644  }
8645 
8646  // Tooltip and Default popup policy
8647  // (Always first try the direction we used on the last frame, if any)
8648  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip || policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default)
8649  {
8650  const ImGuiDir dir_prefered_order[ImGuiDir_COUNT] = { ImGuiDir_Right, ImGuiDir_Down, ImGuiDir_Up, ImGuiDir_Left };
8651  for (int n = (*last_dir != ImGuiDir_None) ? -1 : 0; n < ImGuiDir_COUNT; n++)
8652  {
8653  const ImGuiDir dir = (n == -1) ? *last_dir : dir_prefered_order[n];
8654  if (n != -1 && dir == *last_dir) // Already tried this direction?
8655  continue;
8656 
8657  const float avail_w = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left ? r_avoid.Min.x : r_outer.Max.x) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Right ? r_avoid.Max.x : r_outer.Min.x);
8658  const float avail_h = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up ? r_avoid.Min.y : r_outer.Max.y) - (dir == ImGuiDir_Down ? r_avoid.Max.y : r_outer.Min.y);
8659 
8660  // If there not enough room on one axis, there's no point in positioning on a side on this axis (e.g. when not enough width, use a top/bottom position to maximize available width)
8661  if (avail_w < size.x && (dir == ImGuiDir_Left || dir == ImGuiDir_Right))
8662  continue;
8663  if (avail_h < size.y && (dir == ImGuiDir_Up || dir == ImGuiDir_Down))
8664  continue;
8665 
8666  ImVec2 pos;
8667  pos.x = (dir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? r_avoid.Min.x - size.x : (dir == ImGuiDir_Right) ? r_avoid.Max.x : base_pos_clamped.x;
8668  pos.y = (dir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? r_avoid.Min.y - size.y : (dir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? r_avoid.Max.y : base_pos_clamped.y;
8669 
8670  // Clamp top-left corner of popup
8671  pos.x = ImMax(pos.x, r_outer.Min.x);
8672  pos.y = ImMax(pos.y, r_outer.Min.y);
8673 
8674  *last_dir = dir;
8675  return pos;
8676  }
8677  }
8678 
8679  // Fallback when not enough room:
8680  *last_dir = ImGuiDir_None;
8681 
8682  // For tooltip we prefer avoiding the cursor at all cost even if it means that part of the tooltip won't be visible.
8683  if (policy == ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip)
8684  return ref_pos + ImVec2(2, 2);
8685 
8686  // Otherwise try to keep within display
8687  ImVec2 pos = ref_pos;
8688  pos.x = ImMax(ImMin(pos.x + size.x, r_outer.Max.x) - size.x, r_outer.Min.x);
8689  pos.y = ImMax(ImMin(pos.y + size.y, r_outer.Max.y) - size.y, r_outer.Min.y);
8690  return pos;
8691 }
8692 
8693 // Note that this is used for popups, which can overlap the non work-area of individual viewports.
8694 ImRect ImGui::GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(ImGuiWindow *window)
8695 {
8696  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8697  IM_UNUSED(window);
8698  ImRect r_screen = ((ImGuiViewportP *)(void *)GetMainViewport())->GetMainRect();
8699  ImVec2 padding = g.Style.DisplaySafeAreaPadding;
8700  r_screen.Expand(ImVec2((r_screen.GetWidth() > padding.x * 2) ? -padding.x : 0.0f, (r_screen.GetHeight() > padding.y * 2) ? -padding.y : 0.0f));
8701  return r_screen;
8702 }
8703 
8704 ImVec2 ImGui::FindBestWindowPosForPopup(ImGuiWindow *window)
8705 {
8706  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8707 
8708  ImRect r_outer = GetPopupAllowedExtentRect(window);
8709  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)
8710  {
8711  // Child menus typically request _any_ position within the parent menu item, and then we move the new menu outside the parent bounds.
8712  // This is how we end up with child menus appearing (most-commonly) on the right of the parent menu.
8713  IM_ASSERT(g.CurrentWindow == window);
8714  ImGuiWindow *parent_window = g.CurrentWindowStack[g.CurrentWindowStack.Size - 2].Window;
8715  float horizontal_overlap = g.Style.ItemInnerSpacing.x; // We want some overlap to convey the relative depth of each menu (currently the amount of overlap is hard-coded to style.ItemSpacing.x).
8716  ImRect r_avoid;
8717  if (parent_window->DC.MenuBarAppending)
