8718  r_avoid = ImRect(-FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Min.y, FLT_MAX, parent_window->ClipRect.Max.y); // Avoid parent menu-bar. If we wanted multi-line menu-bar, we may instead want to have the calling window setup e.g. a NextWindowData.PosConstraintAvoidRect field
8719  else
8720  r_avoid = ImRect(parent_window->Pos.x + horizontal_overlap, -FLT_MAX, parent_window->Pos.x + parent_window->Size.x - horizontal_overlap - parent_window->ScrollbarSizes.x, FLT_MAX);
8721  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
8722  }
8723  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
8724  {
8725  ImRect r_avoid = ImRect(window->Pos.x - 1, window->Pos.y - 1, window->Pos.x + 1, window->Pos.y + 1);
8726  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(window->Pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Default);
8727  }
8728  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip)
8729  {
8730  // Position tooltip (always follows mouse)
8731  float sc = g.Style.MouseCursorScale;
8732  ImVec2 ref_pos = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
8733  ImRect r_avoid;
8734  if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && !(g.IO.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos))
8735  r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 16, ref_pos.y + 8);
8736  else
8737  r_avoid = ImRect(ref_pos.x - 16, ref_pos.y - 8, ref_pos.x + 24 * sc, ref_pos.y + 24 * sc); // FIXME: Hard-coded based on mouse cursor shape expectation. Exact dimension not very important.
8738  return FindBestWindowPosForPopupEx(ref_pos, window->Size, &window->AutoPosLastDirection, r_outer, r_avoid, ImGuiPopupPositionPolicy_Tooltip);
8739  }
8740  IM_ASSERT(0);
8741  return window->Pos;
8742 }
8743 
8744 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8745 // [SECTION] KEYBOARD/GAMEPAD NAVIGATION
8746 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
8747 
8748 // FIXME-NAV: The existence of SetNavID vs SetFocusID properly needs to be clarified/reworked.
8749 void ImGui::SetNavID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer, ImGuiID focus_scope_id, const ImRect &rect_rel)
8750 {
8751  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8752  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
8753  IM_ASSERT(nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main || nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu);
8754  g.NavId = id;
8755  g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
8756  g.NavFocusScopeId = focus_scope_id;
8757  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
8758  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = rect_rel;
8759  //g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
8760  //g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
8761 }
8762 
8763 void ImGui::SetFocusID(ImGuiID id, ImGuiWindow *window)
8764 {
8765  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8766  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
8767 
8768  // Assume that SetFocusID() is called in the context where its window->DC.NavLayerCurrent and window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent are valid.
8769  // Note that window may be != g.CurrentWindow (e.g. SetFocusID call in InputTextEx for multi-line text)
8770  const ImGuiNavLayer nav_layer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
8771  if (g.NavWindow != window)
8772  g.NavInitRequest = false;
8773  g.NavWindow = window;
8774  g.NavId = id;
8775  g.NavLayer = nav_layer;
8776  g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
8777  window->NavLastIds[nav_layer] = id;
8778  if (g.LastItemData.ID == id)
8779  window->NavRectRel[nav_layer] = ImRect(g.LastItemData.Rect.Min - window->Pos, g.LastItemData.Rect.Max - window->Pos);
8780 
8781  if (g.ActiveIdSource == ImGuiInputSource_Nav)
8782  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
8783  else
8784  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
8785 }
8786 
8787 ImGuiDir ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(float dx, float dy)
8788 {
8789  if (ImFabs(dx) > ImFabs(dy))
8790  return (dx > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Right : ImGuiDir_Left;
8791  return (dy > 0.0f) ? ImGuiDir_Down : ImGuiDir_Up;
8792 }
8793 
8794 static float inline NavScoreItemDistInterval(float a0, float a1, float b0, float b1)
8795 {
8796  if (a1 < b0)
8797  return a1 - b0;
8798  if (b1 < a0)
8799  return a0 - b1;
8800  return 0.0f;
8801 }
8802 
8803 static void inline NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImRect &r, const ImRect &clip_rect)
8804 {
8805  if (move_dir == ImGuiDir_Left || move_dir == ImGuiDir_Right)
8806  {
8807  r.Min.y = ImClamp(r.Min.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
8808  r.Max.y = ImClamp(r.Max.y, clip_rect.Min.y, clip_rect.Max.y);
8809  }
8810  else
8811  {
8812  r.Min.x = ImClamp(r.Min.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
8813  r.Max.x = ImClamp(r.Max.x, clip_rect.Min.x, clip_rect.Max.x);
8814  }
8815 }
8816 
8817 // Scoring function for gamepad/keyboard directional navigation. Based on https://gist.github.com/rygorous/6981057
8818 static bool ImGui::NavScoreItem(ImGuiNavItemData *result, ImRect cand)
8819 {
8820  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8821  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
8822  if (g.NavLayer != window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
8823  return false;
8824 
8825  const ImRect &curr = g.NavScoringRect; // Current modified source rect (NB: we've applied Max.x = Min.x in NavUpdate() to inhibit the effect of having varied item width)
8826  g.NavScoringCount++;
8827 
8828  // When entering through a NavFlattened border, we consider child window items as fully clipped for scoring
8829  if (window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
8830  {
8831  IM_ASSERT((window->Flags | g.NavWindow->Flags) & ImGuiWindowFlags_NavFlattened);
8832  if (!window->ClipRect.Overlaps(cand))
8833  return false;
8834  cand.ClipWithFull(window->ClipRect); // This allows the scored item to not overlap other candidates in the parent window
8835  }
8836 
8837  // We perform scoring on items bounding box clipped by the current clipping rectangle on the other axis (clipping on our movement axis would give us equal scores for all clipped items)
8838  // For example, this ensure that items in one column are not reached when moving vertically from items in another column.
8839  NavClampRectToVisibleAreaForMoveDir(g.NavMoveClipDir, cand, window->ClipRect);
8840 
8841  // Compute distance between boxes
8842  // FIXME-NAV: Introducing biases for vertical navigation, needs to be removed.
8843  float dbx = NavScoreItemDistInterval(cand.Min.x, cand.Max.x, curr.Min.x, curr.Max.x);
8844  float dby = NavScoreItemDistInterval(ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(cand.Min.y, cand.Max.y, 0.8f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.2f), ImLerp(curr.Min.y, curr.Max.y, 0.8f)); // Scale down on Y to keep using box-distance for vertically touching items
8845  if (dby != 0.0f && dbx != 0.0f)
8846  dbx = (dbx / 1000.0f) + ((dbx > 0.0f) ? +1.0f : -1.0f);
8847  float dist_box = ImFabs(dbx) + ImFabs(dby);
8848 
8849  // Compute distance between centers (this is off by a factor of 2, but we only compare center distances with each other so it doesn't matter)
8850  float dcx = (cand.Min.x + cand.Max.x) - (curr.Min.x + curr.Max.x);
8851  float dcy = (cand.Min.y + cand.Max.y) - (curr.Min.y + curr.Max.y);
8852  float dist_center = ImFabs(dcx) + ImFabs(dcy); // L1 metric (need this for our connectedness guarantee)
8853 
8854  // Determine which quadrant of 'curr' our candidate item 'cand' lies in based on distance
8855  ImGuiDir quadrant;
8856  float dax = 0.0f, day = 0.0f, dist_axial = 0.0f;
8857  if (dbx != 0.0f || dby != 0.0f)
8858  {
8859  // For non-overlapping boxes, use distance between boxes
8860  dax = dbx;
8861  day = dby;
8862  dist_axial = dist_box;
8863  quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dbx, dby);
8864  }
8865  else if (dcx != 0.0f || dcy != 0.0f)
8866  {
8867  // For overlapping boxes with different centers, use distance between centers
8868  dax = dcx;
8869  day = dcy;
8870  dist_axial = dist_center;
8871  quadrant = ImGetDirQuadrantFromDelta(dcx, dcy);
8872  }
8873  else
8874  {
8875  // Degenerate case: two overlapping buttons with same center, break ties arbitrarily (note that LastItemId here is really the _previous_ item order, but it doesn't matter)
8876  quadrant = (g.LastItemData.ID < g.NavId) ? ImGuiDir_Left : ImGuiDir_Right;
8877  }
8878 
8879 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
8880  char buf[128];
8881  if (IsMouseHoveringRect(cand.Min, cand.Max))
8882  {
8883  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "dbox (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\ndcen (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nd (%.2f,%.2f->%.4f)\nnav %c, quadrant %c", dbx, dby, dist_box, dcx, dcy, dist_center, dax, day, dist_axial, "WENS"[g.NavMoveDir], "WENS"[quadrant]);
8884  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
8885  draw_list->AddRect(curr.Min, curr.Max, IM_COL32(255, 200, 0, 100));
8886  draw_list->AddRect(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 200));
8887  draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Max - ImVec2(4, 4), cand.Max + CalcTextSize(buf) + ImVec2(4, 4), IM_COL32(40, 0, 0, 150));
8888  draw_list->AddText(g.IO.FontDefault, 13.0f, cand.Max, ~0U, buf);
8889  }
8890  else if (g.IO.KeyCtrl) // Hold to preview score in matching quadrant. Press C to rotate.
8891  {
8892  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_C))
8893  {
8894  g.NavMoveDirLast = (ImGuiDir)((g.NavMoveDirLast + 1) & 3); g.IO.KeysDownDuration[g.IO.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_C]] = 0.01f;
8895  }
8896  if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
8897  {
8898  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%.0f/%.0f", dist_box, dist_center);
8899  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
8900  draw_list->AddRectFilled(cand.Min, cand.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 200));
8901  draw_list->AddText(g.IO.FontDefault, 13.0f, cand.Min, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
8902  }
8903  }
8904 #endif
8905 
8906  // Is it in the quadrant we're interesting in moving to?
8907  bool new_best = false;
8908  if (quadrant == g.NavMoveDir)
8909  {
8910  // Does it beat the current best candidate?
8911  if (dist_box < result->DistBox)
8912  {
8913  result->DistBox = dist_box;
8914  result->DistCenter = dist_center;
8915  return true;
8916  }
8917  if (dist_box == result->DistBox)
8918  {
8919  // Try using distance between center points to break ties
8920  if (dist_center < result->DistCenter)
8921  {
8922  result->DistCenter = dist_center;
8923  new_best = true;
8924  }
8925  else if (dist_center == result->DistCenter)
8926  {
8927  // Still tied! we need to be extra-careful to make sure everything gets linked properly. We consistently break ties by symbolically moving "later" items
8928  // (with higher index) to the right/downwards by an infinitesimal amount since we the current "best" button already (so it must have a lower index),
8929  // this is fairly easy. This rule ensures that all buttons with dx==dy==0 will end up being linked in order of appearance along the x axis.
8930  if (((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down) ? dby : dbx) < 0.0f) // moving bj to the right/down decreases distance
8931  new_best = true;
8932  }
8933  }
8934  }
8935 
8936  // Axial check: if 'curr' has no link at all in some direction and 'cand' lies roughly in that direction, add a tentative link. This will only be kept if no "real" matches
8937  // are found, so it only augments the graph produced by the above method using extra links. (important, since it doesn't guarantee strong connectedness)
8938  // This is just to avoid buttons having no links in a particular direction when there's a suitable neighbor. you get good graphs without this too.
8939  // 2017/09/29: FIXME: This now currently only enabled inside menu bars, ideally we'd disable it everywhere. Menus in particular need to catch failure. For general navigation it feels awkward.
8940  // Disabling it may lead to disconnected graphs when nodes are very spaced out on different axis. Perhaps consider offering this as an option?
8941  if (result->DistBox == FLT_MAX && dist_axial < result->DistAxial) // Check axial match
8942  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu))
8943  if ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && dax < 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && dax > 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && day < 0.0f) || (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && day > 0.0f))
8944  {
8945  result->DistAxial = dist_axial;
8946  new_best = true;
8947  }
8948 
8949  return new_best;
8950 }
8951 
8952 static void ImGui::NavApplyItemToResult(ImGuiNavItemData *result, ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiID id, const ImRect &nav_bb_rel)
8953 {
8954  result->Window = window;
8955  result->ID = id;
8956  result->FocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
8957  result->RectRel = nav_bb_rel;
8958 }
8959 
8960 // We get there when either NavId == id, or when g.NavAnyRequest is set (which is updated by NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag above)
8961 static void ImGui::NavProcessItem(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImRect &nav_bb, const ImGuiID id)
8962 {
8963  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
8964  //if (!g.IO.NavActive) // [2017/10/06] Removed this possibly redundant test but I am not sure of all the side-effects yet. Some of the feature here will need to work regardless of using a _NoNavInputs flag.
8965  // return;
8966 
8967  const ImGuiItemFlags item_flags = g.LastItemData.InFlags;
8968  const ImRect nav_bb_rel(nav_bb.Min - window->Pos, nav_bb.Max - window->Pos);
8969 
8970  // Process Init Request
8971  if (g.NavInitRequest && g.NavLayer == window->DC.NavLayerCurrent)
8972  {
8973  // Even if 'ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus' is on (typically collapse/close button) we record the first ResultId so they can be used as a fallback
8974  const bool candidate_for_nav_default_focus = (item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_NoNavDefaultFocus | ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled)) == 0;
8975  if (candidate_for_nav_default_focus || g.NavInitResultId == 0)
8976  {
8977  g.NavInitResultId = id;
8978  g.NavInitResultRectRel = nav_bb_rel;
8979  }
8980  if (candidate_for_nav_default_focus)
8981  {
8982  g.NavInitRequest = false; // Found a match, clear request
8983  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
8984  }
8985  }
8986 
8987  // Process Move Request (scoring for navigation)
8988  // FIXME-NAV: Consider policy for double scoring (scoring from NavScoringRectScreen + scoring from a rect wrapped according to current wrapping policy)
8989  if ((g.NavId != id || (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)) && !(item_flags & (ImGuiItemFlags_Disabled | ImGuiItemFlags_NoNav)))
8990  {
8991  ImGuiNavItemData *result = (window == g.NavWindow) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
8992 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING
8993  // [DEBUG] Score all items in NavWindow at all times
8994  if (!g.NavMoveRequest)
8995  g.NavMoveDir = g.NavMoveDirLast;
8996  bool new_best = NavScoreItem(result, nav_bb) && g.NavMoveRequest;
8997 #else
8998  bool new_best = g.NavMoveRequest && NavScoreItem(result, nav_bb);
8999 #endif
9000  if (new_best)
9001  NavApplyItemToResult(result, window, id, nav_bb_rel);
9002 
9003  // Features like PageUp/PageDown need to maintain a separate score for the visible set of items.
9004  const float VISIBLE_RATIO = 0.70f;
9005  if ((g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet) && window->ClipRect.Overlaps(nav_bb))
9006  if (ImClamp(nav_bb.Max.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) - ImClamp(nav_bb.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Min.y, window->ClipRect.Max.y) >= (nav_bb.Max.y - nav_bb.Min.y) * VISIBLE_RATIO)
9007  if (NavScoreItem(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet, nav_bb))
9008  NavApplyItemToResult(&g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet, window, id, nav_bb_rel);
9009  }
9010 
9011  // Update window-relative bounding box of navigated item
9012  if (g.NavId == id)
9013  {
9014  g.NavWindow = window; // Always refresh g.NavWindow, because some operations such as FocusItem() don't have a window.
9015  g.NavLayer = window->DC.NavLayerCurrent;
9016  g.NavFocusScopeId = window->DC.NavFocusScopeIdCurrent;
9017  g.NavIdIsAlive = true;
9018  window->NavRectRel[window->DC.NavLayerCurrent] = nav_bb_rel; // Store item bounding box (relative to window position)
9019  }
9020 }
9021 
9022 bool ImGui::NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet()
9023 {
9024  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9025  return g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0;
9026 }
9027 
9028 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestCancel()
9029 {
9030  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9031  g.NavMoveRequest = false;
9032  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9033 }
9034 
9035 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestForward(ImGuiDir move_dir, ImGuiDir clip_dir, const ImRect &bb_rel, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
9036 {
9037  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9038  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None);
9039  NavMoveRequestCancel();
9040  g.NavMoveDir = move_dir;
9041  g.NavMoveClipDir = clip_dir;
9042  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued;
9043  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = move_flags;
9044  g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] = bb_rel;
9045 }
9046 
9047 void ImGui::NavMoveRequestTryWrapping(ImGuiWindow *window, ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags)
9048 {
9049  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9050 
9051  // Navigation wrap-around logic is delayed to the end of the frame because this operation is only valid after entire
9052  // popup is assembled and in case of appended popups it is not clear which EndPopup() call is final.
9053  g.NavWrapRequestWindow = window;
9054  g.NavWrapRequestFlags = move_flags;
9055 }
9056 
9057 // FIXME: This could be replaced by updating a frame number in each window when (window == NavWindow) and (NavLayer == 0).
9058 // This way we could find the last focused window among our children. It would be much less confusing this way?
9059 static void ImGui::NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(ImGuiWindow *nav_window)
9060 {
9061  ImGuiWindow *parent = nav_window;
9062  while (parent && parent->RootWindow != parent && (parent->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
9063  parent = parent->ParentWindow;
9064  if (parent && parent != nav_window)
9065  parent->NavLastChildNavWindow = nav_window;
9066 }
9067 
9068 // Restore the last focused child.
9069 // Call when we are expected to land on the Main Layer (0) after FocusWindow()
9070 static ImGuiWindow *ImGui::NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(ImGuiWindow *window)
9071 {
9072  if (window->NavLastChildNavWindow && window->NavLastChildNavWindow->WasActive)
9073  return window->NavLastChildNavWindow;
9074  return window;
9075 }
9076 
9077 void ImGui::NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer layer)
9078 {
9079  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9080  if (layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9081  g.NavWindow = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(g.NavWindow);
9082  ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWindow;
9083  if (window->NavLastIds[layer] != 0)
9084  {
9085  SetNavID(window->NavLastIds[layer], layer, 0, window->NavRectRel[layer]);
9086  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9087  g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
9088  }
9089  else
9090  {
9091  g.NavLayer = layer;
9092  NavInitWindow(window, true);
9093  }
9094 }
9095 
9096 static inline void ImGui::NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag()
9097 {
9098  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9099  g.NavAnyRequest = g.NavMoveRequest || g.NavInitRequest || (IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_SCORING && g.NavWindow != NULL);
9100  if (g.NavAnyRequest)
9101  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow != NULL);
9102 }
9103 
9104 // This needs to be called before we submit any widget (aka in or before Begin)
9105 void ImGui::NavInitWindow(ImGuiWindow *window, bool force_reinit)
9106 {
9107  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9108  IM_ASSERT(window == g.NavWindow);
9109 
9110  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs)
9111  {
9112  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9113  return;
9114  }
9115 
9116  bool init_for_nav = false;
9117  if (window == window->RootWindow || (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || (window->NavLastIds[0] == 0) || force_reinit)
9118  init_for_nav = true;
9119  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from NavInitWindow(), init_for_nav=%d, window=\"%s\", layer=%d\n", init_for_nav, window->Name, g.NavLayer);
9120  if (init_for_nav)
9121  {
9122  SetNavID(0, g.NavLayer, 0, ImRect());
9123  g.NavInitRequest = true;
9124  g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
9125  g.NavInitResultId = 0;
9126  g.NavInitResultRectRel = ImRect();
9127  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9128  }
9129  else
9130  {
9131  g.NavId = window->NavLastIds[0];
9132  g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9133  }
9134 }
9135 
9136 static ImVec2 ImGui::NavCalcPreferredRefPos()
9137 {
9138  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9139  if (g.NavDisableHighlight || !g.NavDisableMouseHover || !g.NavWindow)
9140  {
9141  // Mouse (we need a fallback in case the mouse becomes invalid after being used)
9142  if (IsMousePosValid(&g.IO.MousePos))
9143  return g.IO.MousePos;
9144  return g.LastValidMousePos;
9145  }
9146  else
9147  {
9148  // When navigation is active and mouse is disabled, decide on an arbitrary position around the bottom left of the currently navigated item.
9149  const ImRect &rect_rel = g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
9150  ImVec2 pos = g.NavWindow->Pos + ImVec2(rect_rel.Min.x + ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.x * 4, rect_rel.GetWidth()), rect_rel.Max.y - ImMin(g.Style.FramePadding.y, rect_rel.GetHeight()));
9151  ImGuiViewport *viewport = GetMainViewport();
9152  return ImFloor(ImClamp(pos, viewport->Pos, viewport->Pos + viewport->Size)); // ImFloor() is important because non-integer mouse position application in backend might be lossy and result in undesirable non-zero delta.
9153  }
9154 }
9155 
9156 float ImGui::GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput n, ImGuiInputReadMode mode)
9157 {
9158  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9159  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Down)
9160  return g.IO.NavInputs[n]; // Instant, read analog input (0.0f..1.0f, as provided by user)
9161 
9162  const float t = g.IO.NavInputsDownDuration[n];
9163  if (t < 0.0f && mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Released) // Return 1.0f when just released, no repeat, ignore analog input.
9164  return (g.IO.NavInputsDownDurationPrev[n] >= 0.0f ? 1.0f : 0.0f);
9165  if (t < 0.0f)
9166  return 0.0f;
9167  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed) // Return 1.0f when just pressed, no repeat, ignore analog input.
9168  return (t == 0.0f) ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
9169  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat)
9170  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.Time, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.80f);
9171  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow)
9172  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.Time, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 1.25f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 2.00f);
9173  if (mode == ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatFast)
9174  return (float)CalcTypematicRepeatAmount(t - g.IO.Time, t, g.IO.KeyRepeatDelay * 0.72f, g.IO.KeyRepeatRate * 0.30f);
9175  return 0.0f;
9176 }
9177 
9178 ImVec2 ImGui::GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags dir_sources, ImGuiInputReadMode mode, float slow_factor, float fast_factor)
9179 {
9180  ImVec2 delta(0.0f, 0.0f);
9181  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard)
9182  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, mode));
9183  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadDPad)
9184  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, mode));
9185  if (dir_sources & ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick)
9186  delta += ImVec2(GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickRight, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickLeft, mode), GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickDown, mode) - GetNavInputAmount(ImGuiNavInput_LStickUp, mode));
9187  if (slow_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow))
9188  delta *= slow_factor;
9189  if (fast_factor != 0.0f && IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast))
9190  delta *= fast_factor;
9191  return delta;
9192 }
9193 
9194 static void ImGui::NavUpdate()
9195 {
9196  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9197  ImGuiIO &io = g.IO;
9198 
9199  io.WantSetMousePos = false;
9200  g.NavWrapRequestWindow = NULL;
9201  g.NavWrapRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
9202 #if 0
9203  if (g.NavScoringCount > 0) IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("NavScoringCount %d for '%s' layer %d (Init:%d, Move:%d)\n", g.FrameCount, g.NavScoringCount, g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL", g.NavLayer, g.NavInitRequest || g.NavInitResultId != 0, g.NavMoveRequest);
9204 #endif
9205 
9206  // Set input source as Gamepad when buttons are pressed (as some features differs when used with Gamepad vs Keyboard)
9207  // (do it before we map Keyboard input!)
9208  bool nav_keyboard_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard) != 0;
9209  bool nav_gamepad_active = (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableGamepad) != 0 && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasGamepad) != 0;
9210  if (nav_gamepad_active && g.NavInputSource != ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
9211  {
9212  if (io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Activate] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Input] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Cancel] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_Menu] > 0.0f
9213  || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp] > 0.0f || io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown] > 0.0f)
9214  g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad;
9215  }
9216 
9217  // Update Keyboard->Nav inputs mapping
9218  if (nav_keyboard_active)
9219  {
9220 #define NAV_MAP_KEY(_KEY, _NAV_INPUT) do { if (IsKeyDown(io.KeyMap[_KEY])) { io.NavInputs[_NAV_INPUT] = 1.0f; g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard; } } while (0)
9221  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Space, ImGuiNavInput_Activate);
9222  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Enter, ImGuiNavInput_Input);
9223  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_Escape, ImGuiNavInput_Cancel);
9224  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_LeftArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_);
9225  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_RightArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_);
9226  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_UpArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_);
9227  NAV_MAP_KEY(ImGuiKey_DownArrow, ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_);
9228  if (io.KeyCtrl)
9229  io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakSlow] = 1.0f;
9230  if (io.KeyShift)
9231  io.NavInputs[ImGuiNavInput_TweakFast] = 1.0f;
9232 #undef NAV_MAP_KEY
9233  }
9234  memcpy(io.NavInputsDownDurationPrev, io.NavInputsDownDuration, sizeof(io.NavInputsDownDuration));
9235  for (int i = 0; i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(io.NavInputs); i++)
9236  io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] = (io.NavInputs[i] > 0.0f) ? (io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] < 0.0f ? 0.0f : io.NavInputsDownDuration[i] + io.Time) : -1.0f;
9237 
9238  // Process navigation init request (select first/default focus)
9239  if (g.NavInitResultId != 0)
9240  NavUpdateInitResult();
9241  g.NavInitRequest = false;
9242  g.NavInitRequestFromMove = false;
9243  g.NavInitResultId = 0;
9244  g.NavJustMovedToId = 0;
9245 
9246  // Process navigation move request
9247  if (g.NavMoveRequest)
9248  NavUpdateMoveResult();
9249 
9250  // When a forwarded move request failed, we restore the highlight that we disabled during the forward frame
9251  if (g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_ForwardActive)
9252  {
9253  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequest);
9254  if (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0)
9255  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9256  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_None;
9257  }
9258 
9259  // Apply application mouse position movement, after we had a chance to process move request result.
9260  if (g.NavMousePosDirty && g.NavIdIsAlive)
9261  {
9262  // Set mouse position given our knowledge of the navigated item position from last frame
9263  if ((io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableSetMousePos) && (io.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_HasSetMousePos))
9264  if (!g.NavDisableHighlight && g.NavDisableMouseHover && g.NavWindow)
9265  {
9266  io.MousePos = io.MousePosPrev = NavCalcPreferredRefPos();
9267  io.WantSetMousePos = true;
9268  }
9269  g.NavMousePosDirty = false;
9270  }
9271  g.NavIdIsAlive = false;
9272  g.NavJustTabbedId = 0;
9273  IM_ASSERT(g.NavLayer == 0 || g.NavLayer == 1);
9274 
9275  // Store our return window (for returning from Layer 1 to Layer 0) and clear it as soon as we step back in our own Layer 0
9276  if (g.NavWindow)
9277  NavSaveLastChildNavWindowIntoParent(g.NavWindow);
9278  if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow != NULL && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9279  g.NavWindow->NavLastChildNavWindow = NULL;
9280 
9281  // Update CTRL+TAB and Windowing features (hold Square to move/resize/etc.)
9282  NavUpdateWindowing();
9283 
9284  // Set output flags for user application
9285  io.NavActive = (nav_keyboard_active || nav_gamepad_active) && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs);
9286  io.NavVisible = (io.NavActive && g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight) || (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
9287 
9288  // Process NavCancel input (to close a popup, get back to parent, clear focus)
9289  if (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
9290  {
9291  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] ImGuiNavInput_Cancel\n");
9292  if (g.ActiveId != 0)
9293  {
9294  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavInput(ImGuiNavInput_Cancel))
9295  ClearActiveID();
9296  }
9297  else if (g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9298  {
9299  // Leave the "menu" layer
9300  NavRestoreLayer(ImGuiNavLayer_Main);
9301  }
9302  else if (g.NavWindow && g.NavWindow != g.NavWindow->RootWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) && g.NavWindow->ParentWindow)
9303  {
9304  // Exit child window
9305  ImGuiWindow *child_window = g.NavWindow;
9306  ImGuiWindow *parent_window = g.NavWindow->ParentWindow;
9307  IM_ASSERT(child_window->ChildId != 0);
9308  ImRect child_rect = child_window->Rect();
9309  FocusWindow(parent_window);
9310  SetNavID(child_window->ChildId, ImGuiNavLayer_Main, 0, ImRect(child_rect.Min - parent_window->Pos, child_rect.Max - parent_window->Pos));
9311  }
9312  else if (g.OpenPopupStack.Size > 0)
9313  {
9314  // Close open popup/menu
9315  if (!(g.OpenPopupStack.back().Window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal))
9316  ClosePopupToLevel(g.OpenPopupStack.Size - 1, true);
9317  }
9318  else
9319  {
9320  // Clear NavLastId for popups but keep it for regular child window so we can leave one and come back where we were
9321  if (g.NavWindow && ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) || !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow)))
9322  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[0] = 0;
9323  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9324  }
9325  }
9326 
9327  // Process manual activation request
9328  g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavInputId = 0;
9329  if (g.NavId != 0 && !g.NavDisableHighlight && !g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9330  {
9331  bool activate_down = IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Activate);
9332  bool activate_pressed = activate_down && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Activate, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
9333  if (g.ActiveId == 0 && activate_pressed)
9334  g.NavActivateId = g.NavId;
9335  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_down)
9336  g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavId;
9337  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && activate_pressed)
9338  g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavId;
9339  if ((g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveId == g.NavId) && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Input, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed))
9340  g.NavInputId = g.NavId;
9341  }
9342  if (g.NavWindow && (g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9343  g.NavDisableHighlight = true;
9344  if (g.NavActivateId != 0)
9345  IM_ASSERT(g.NavActivateDownId == g.NavActivateId);
9346  g.NavMoveRequest = false;
9347 
9348  // Process programmatic activation request
9349  if (g.NavNextActivateId != 0)
9350  g.NavActivateId = g.NavActivateDownId = g.NavActivatePressedId = g.NavInputId = g.NavNextActivateId;
9351  g.NavNextActivateId = 0;
9352 
9353  // Initiate directional inputs request
9354  if (g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None)
9355  {
9356  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_None;
9357  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_None;
9358  if (g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs))
9359  {
9360  const ImGuiInputReadMode read_mode = ImGuiInputReadMode_Repeat;
9361  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Left) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadLeft, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyLeft_, read_mode)))
9362  {
9363  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Left;
9364  }
9365  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Right) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadRight, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyRight_, read_mode)))
9366  {
9367  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Right;
9368  }
9369  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Up) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadUp, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyUp_, read_mode)))
9370  {
9371  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
9372  }
9373  if (!IsActiveIdUsingNavDir(ImGuiDir_Down) && (IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_DpadDown, read_mode) || IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_KeyDown_, read_mode)))
9374  {
9375  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
9376  }
9377  }
9378  g.NavMoveClipDir = g.NavMoveDir;
9379  }
9380  else
9381  {
9382  // Forwarding previous request (which has been modified, e.g. wrap around menus rewrite the requests with a starting rectangle at the other side of the window)
9383  // (Preserve g.NavMoveRequestFlags, g.NavMoveClipDir which were set by the NavMoveRequestForward() function)
9384  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None && g.NavMoveClipDir != ImGuiDir_None);
9385  IM_ASSERT(g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_ForwardQueued);
9386  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequestForward %d\n", g.NavMoveDir);
9387  g.NavMoveRequestForward = ImGuiNavForward_ForwardActive;
9388  }
9389 
9390  // Update PageUp/PageDown/Home/End scroll
9391  // FIXME-NAV: Consider enabling those keys even without the master ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard flag?
9392  float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
9393  if (nav_keyboard_active)
9394  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = NavUpdatePageUpPageDown();
9395 
9396  // If we initiate a movement request and have no current NavId, we initiate a InitDefautRequest that will be used as a fallback if the direction fails to find a match
9397  if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None)
9398  {
9399  g.NavMoveRequest = true;
9400  g.NavMoveRequestKeyMods = io.KeyMods;
9401  g.NavMoveDirLast = g.NavMoveDir;
9402  }
9403  if (g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavId == 0)
9404  {
9405  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: from move, window \"%s\", layer=%d\n", g.NavWindow->Name, g.NavLayer);
9406  g.NavInitRequest = g.NavInitRequestFromMove = true;
9407  // Reassigning with same value, we're being explicit here.
9408  g.NavInitResultId = 0; // -V1048
9409  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9410  }
9411  NavUpdateAnyRequestFlag();
9412 
9413  // Scrolling
9414  if (g.NavWindow && !(g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) && !g.NavWindowingTarget)
9415  {
9416  // *Fallback* manual-scroll with Nav directional keys when window has no navigable item
9417  ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWindow;
9418  const float scroll_speed = IM_ROUND(window->CalcFontSize() * 100 * io.Time); // We need round the scrolling speed because sub-pixel scroll isn't reliably supported.
9419  if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll && g.NavMoveRequest)
9420  {
9421  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right)
9422  SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
9423  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up || g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down)
9424  SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + ((g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? -1.0f : +1.0f) * scroll_speed));
9425  }
9426 
9427  // *Normal* Manual scroll with NavScrollXXX keys
9428  // Next movement request will clamp the NavId reference rectangle to the visible area, so navigation will resume within those bounds.
9429  ImVec2 scroll_dir = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down, 1.0f / 10.0f, 10.0f);
9430  if (scroll_dir.x != 0.0f && window->ScrollbarX)
9431  SetScrollX(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.x + scroll_dir.x * scroll_speed));
9432  if (scroll_dir.y != 0.0f)
9433  SetScrollY(window, ImFloor(window->Scroll.y + scroll_dir.y * scroll_speed));
9434  }
9435 
9436  // Reset search results
9437  g.NavMoveResultLocal.Clear();
9438  g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.Clear();
9439  g.NavMoveResultOther.Clear();
9440 
9441  // When using gamepad, we project the reference nav bounding box into window visible area.
9442  // This is to allow resuming navigation inside the visible area after doing a large amount of scrolling, since with gamepad every movements are relative
9443  // (can't focus a visible object like we can with the mouse).
9444  if (g.NavMoveRequest && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9445  {
9446  ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWindow;
9447  ImRect window_rect_rel(window->InnerRect.Min - window->Pos - ImVec2(1, 1), window->InnerRect.Max - window->Pos + ImVec2(1, 1));
9448  if (!window_rect_rel.Contains(window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer]))
9449  {
9450  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: clamp NavRectRel\n");
9451  float pad = window->CalcFontSize() * 0.5f;
9452  window_rect_rel.Expand(ImVec2(-ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetWidth(), pad), -ImMin(window_rect_rel.GetHeight(), pad))); // Terrible approximation for the intent of starting navigation from first fully visible item
9453  window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].ClipWithFull(window_rect_rel);
9454  g.NavId = g.NavFocusScopeId = 0;
9455  }
9456  }
9457 
9458  // For scoring we use a single segment on the left side our current item bounding box (not touching the edge to avoid box overlap with zero-spaced items)
9459  ImRect nav_rect_rel = g.NavWindow && !g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer].IsInverted() ? g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer] : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
9460  g.NavScoringRect = g.NavWindow ? ImRect(g.NavWindow->Pos + nav_rect_rel.Min, g.NavWindow->Pos + nav_rect_rel.Max) : ImRect(0, 0, 0, 0);
9461  g.NavScoringRect.TranslateY(nav_scoring_rect_offset_y);
9462  g.NavScoringRect.Min.x = ImMin(g.NavScoringRect.Min.x + 1.0f, g.NavScoringRect.Max.x);
9463  g.NavScoringRect.Max.x = g.NavScoringRect.Min.x;
9464  IM_ASSERT(!g.NavScoringRect.IsInverted()); // Ensure if we have a finite, non-inverted bounding box here will allows us to remove extraneous ImFabs() calls in NavScoreItem().
9465  //GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(g.NavScoringRectScreen.Min, g.NavScoringRectScreen.Max, IM_COL32(255,200,0,255)); // [DEBUG]
9466  g.NavScoringCount = 0;
9467 #if IMGUI_DEBUG_NAV_RECTS
9468  if (g.NavWindow)
9469  {
9470  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(g.NavWindow);
9471  if (1)
9472  {
9473  for (int layer = 0; layer < 2; layer++) draw_list->AddRect(g.NavWindow->Pos + g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer].Min, g.NavWindow->Pos + g.NavWindow->NavRectRel[layer].Max, IM_COL32(255, 200, 0, 255));
9474  } // [DEBUG]
9475  if (1)
9476  {
9477  ImU32 col = (!g.NavWindow->Hidden) ? IM_COL32(255, 0, 255, 255) : IM_COL32(255, 0, 0, 255); ImVec2 p = NavCalcPreferredRefPos(); char buf[32]; ImFormatString(buf, 32, "%d", g.NavLayer); draw_list->AddCircleFilled(p, 3.0f, col); draw_list->AddText(NULL, 13.0f, p + ImVec2(8, -4), col, buf);
9478  }
9479  }
9480 #endif
9481 }
9482 
9483 static void ImGui::NavUpdateInitResult()
9484 {
9485  // In very rare cases g.NavWindow may be null (e.g. clearing focus after requesting an init request, which does happen when releasing Alt while clicking on void)
9486  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9487  if (!g.NavWindow)
9488  return;
9489 
9490  // Apply result from previous navigation init request (will typically select the first item, unless SetItemDefaultFocus() has been called)
9491  // FIXME-NAV: On _NavFlattened windows, g.NavWindow will only be updated during subsequent frame. Not a problem currently.
9492  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavInitRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
9493  SetNavID(g.NavInitResultId, g.NavLayer, 0, g.NavInitResultRectRel);
9494  if (g.NavInitRequestFromMove)
9495  {
9496  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9497  g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
9498  }
9499 }
9500 
9501 // Apply result from previous frame navigation directional move request
9502 static void ImGui::NavUpdateMoveResult()
9503 {
9504  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9505  if (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID == 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID == 0)
9506  {
9507  // In a situation when there is no results but NavId != 0, re-enable the Navigation highlight (because g.NavId is not considered as a possible result)
9508  if (g.NavId != 0)
9509  {
9510  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9511  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9512  }
9513  return;
9514  }
9515 
9516  // Select which result to use
9517  ImGuiNavItemData *result = (g.NavMoveResultLocal.ID != 0) ? &g.NavMoveResultLocal : &g.NavMoveResultOther;
9518 
9519  // PageUp/PageDown behavior first jumps to the bottom/top mostly visible item, _otherwise_ use the result from the previous/next page.
9520  if (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet)
9521  if (g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet.ID != g.NavId)
9522  result = &g.NavMoveResultLocalVisibleSet;
9523 
9524  // Maybe entering a flattened child from the outside? In this case solve the tie using the regular scoring rules.
9525  if (result != &g.NavMoveResultOther && g.NavMoveResultOther.ID != 0 && g.NavMoveResultOther.Window->ParentWindow == g.NavWindow)
9526  if ((g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox < result->DistBox) || (g.NavMoveResultOther.DistBox == result->DistBox && g.NavMoveResultOther.DistCenter < result->DistCenter))
9527  result = &g.NavMoveResultOther;
9528  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindow && result->Window);
9529 
9530  // Scroll to keep newly navigated item fully into view.
9531  if (g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9532  {
9533  ImVec2 delta_scroll;
9534  if (g.NavMoveRequestFlags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge)
9535  {
9536  float scroll_target = (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up) ? result->Window->ScrollMax.y : 0.0f;
9537  delta_scroll.y = result->Window->Scroll.y - scroll_target;
9538  SetScrollY(result->Window, scroll_target);
9539  }
9540  else
9541  {
9542  ImRect rect_abs = ImRect(result->RectRel.Min + result->Window->Pos, result->RectRel.Max + result->Window->Pos);
9543  delta_scroll = ScrollToBringRectIntoView(result->Window, rect_abs);
9544  }
9545 
9546  // Offset our result position so mouse position can be applied immediately after in NavUpdate()
9547  result->RectRel.TranslateX(-delta_scroll.x);
9548  result->RectRel.TranslateY(-delta_scroll.y);
9549  }
9550 
9551  ClearActiveID();
9552  g.NavWindow = result->Window;
9553  if (g.NavId != result->ID)
9554  {
9555  // Don't set NavJustMovedToId if just landed on the same spot (which may happen with ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId)
9556  g.NavJustMovedToId = result->ID;
9557  g.NavJustMovedToFocusScopeId = result->FocusScopeId;
9558  g.NavJustMovedToKeyMods = g.NavMoveRequestKeyMods;
9559  }
9560  IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_NAV("[nav] NavMoveRequest: result NavID 0x%08X in Layer %d Window \"%s\"\n", result->ID, g.NavLayer, g.NavWindow->Name);
9561  SetNavID(result->ID, g.NavLayer, result->FocusScopeId, result->RectRel);
9562  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9563  g.NavDisableMouseHover = g.NavMousePosDirty = true;
9564 }
9565 
9566 // Handle PageUp/PageDown/Home/End keys
9567 static float ImGui::NavUpdatePageUpPageDown()
9568 {
9569  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9570  ImGuiIO &io = g.IO;
9571 
9572  if (g.NavMoveDir != ImGuiDir_None || g.NavWindow == NULL)
9573  return 0.0f;
9574  if ((g.NavWindow->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) || g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL || g.NavLayer != ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9575  return 0.0f;
9576 
9577  ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWindow;
9578  const bool page_up_held = IsKeyDown(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageUp);
9579  const bool page_down_held = IsKeyDown(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_PageDown);
9580  const bool home_pressed = IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_Home]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_Home);
9581  const bool end_pressed = IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_End]) && !IsActiveIdUsingKey(ImGuiKey_End);
9582  if (page_up_held != page_down_held || home_pressed != end_pressed) // If either (not both) are pressed
9583  {
9584  if (window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask == 0x00 && window->DC.NavHasScroll)
9585  {
9586  // Fallback manual-scroll when window has no navigable item
9587  if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp], true))
9588  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y - window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
9589  else if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown], true))
9590  SetScrollY(window, window->Scroll.y + window->InnerRect.GetHeight());
9591  else if (home_pressed)
9592  SetScrollY(window, 0.0f);
9593  else if (end_pressed)
9594  SetScrollY(window, window->ScrollMax.y);
9595  }
9596  else
9597  {
9598  ImRect &nav_rect_rel = window->NavRectRel[g.NavLayer];
9599  const float page_offset_y = ImMax(0.0f, window->InnerRect.GetHeight() - window->CalcFontSize() * 1.0f + nav_rect_rel.GetHeight());
9600  float nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = 0.0f;
9601  if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageUp], true))
9602  {
9603  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = -page_offset_y;
9604  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down; // Because our scoring rect is offset up, we request the down direction (so we can always land on the last item)
9605  g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
9606  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
9607  }
9608  else if (IsKeyPressed(io.KeyMap[ImGuiKey_PageDown], true))
9609  {
9610  nav_scoring_rect_offset_y = +page_offset_y;
9611  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up; // Because our scoring rect is offset down, we request the up direction (so we can always land on the last item)
9612  g.NavMoveClipDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
9613  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AlsoScoreVisibleSet;
9614  }
9615  else if (home_pressed)
9616  {
9617  // FIXME-NAV: handling of Home/End is assuming that the top/bottom most item will be visible with Scroll.y == 0/ScrollMax.y
9618  // Scrolling will be handled via the ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge flag, we don't scroll immediately to avoid scrolling happening before nav result.
9619  // Preserve current horizontal position if we have any.
9620  nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = -window->Scroll.y;
9621  if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
9622  nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
9623  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Down;
9624  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge;
9625  }
9626  else if (end_pressed)
9627  {
9628  nav_rect_rel.Min.y = nav_rect_rel.Max.y = window->ScrollMax.y + window->SizeFull.y - window->Scroll.y;
9629  if (nav_rect_rel.IsInverted())
9630  nav_rect_rel.Min.x = nav_rect_rel.Max.x = 0.0f;
9631  g.NavMoveDir = ImGuiDir_Up;
9632  g.NavMoveRequestFlags = ImGuiNavMoveFlags_AllowCurrentNavId | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_ScrollToEdge;
9633  }
9634  return nav_scoring_rect_offset_y;
9635  }
9636  }
9637  return 0.0f;
9638 }
9639 
9640 static void ImGui::NavEndFrame()
9641 {
9642  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9643 
9644  // Show CTRL+TAB list window
9645  if (g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL)
9646  NavUpdateWindowingOverlay();
9647 
9648  // Perform wrap-around in menus
9649  ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWrapRequestWindow;
9650  ImGuiNavMoveFlags move_flags = g.NavWrapRequestFlags;
9651  if (window != NULL && g.NavWindow == window && NavMoveRequestButNoResultYet() && g.NavMoveRequestForward == ImGuiNavForward_None && g.NavLayer == ImGuiNavLayer_Main)
9652  {
9653  IM_ASSERT(move_flags != 0); // No points calling this with no wrapping
9654  ImRect bb_rel = window->NavRectRel[0];
9655 
9656  ImGuiDir clip_dir = g.NavMoveDir;
9657  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Left && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
9658  {
9659  bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x =
9660  ImMax(window->SizeFull.x, window->ContentSize.x + window->WindowPadding.x * 2.0f) - window->Scroll.x;
9661  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
9662  {
9663  bb_rel.TranslateY(-bb_rel.GetHeight());
9664  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Up;
9665  }
9666  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
9667  }
9668  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Right && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopX)))
9669  {
9670  bb_rel.Min.x = bb_rel.Max.x = -window->Scroll.x;
9671  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapX)
9672  {
9673  bb_rel.TranslateY(+bb_rel.GetHeight());
9674  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Down;
9675  }
9676  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
9677  }
9678  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Up && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
9679  {
9680  bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y =
9681  ImMax(window->SizeFull.y, window->ContentSize.y + window->WindowPadding.y * 2.0f) - window->Scroll.y;
9682  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
9683  {
9684  bb_rel.TranslateX(-bb_rel.GetWidth());
9685  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Left;
9686  }
9687  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
9688  }
9689  if (g.NavMoveDir == ImGuiDir_Down && (move_flags & (ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY | ImGuiNavMoveFlags_LoopY)))
9690  {
9691  bb_rel.Min.y = bb_rel.Max.y = -window->Scroll.y;
9692  if (move_flags & ImGuiNavMoveFlags_WrapY)
9693  {
9694  bb_rel.TranslateX(+bb_rel.GetWidth());
9695  clip_dir = ImGuiDir_Right;
9696  }
9697  NavMoveRequestForward(g.NavMoveDir, clip_dir, bb_rel, move_flags);
9698  }
9699  }
9700 }
9701 
9702 static int ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(ImGuiWindow *window)
9703 {
9704  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9705  IM_UNUSED(g);
9706  int order = window->FocusOrder;
9707  IM_ASSERT(g.WindowsFocusOrder[order] == window);
9708  return order;
9709 }
9710 
9711 static ImGuiWindow *FindWindowNavFocusable(int i_start, int i_stop, int dir) // FIXME-OPT O(N)
9712 {
9713  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9714  for (int i = i_start; i >= 0 && i < g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size && i != i_stop; i += dir)
9715  if (ImGui::IsWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder[i]))
9716  return g.WindowsFocusOrder[i];
9717  return NULL;
9718 }
9719 
9720 static void NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(int focus_change_dir)
9721 {
9722  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9723  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget);
9724  if (g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal)
9725  return;
9726 
9727  const int i_current = ImGui::FindWindowFocusIndex(g.NavWindowingTarget);
9728  ImGuiWindow *window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable(i_current + focus_change_dir, -INT_MAX, focus_change_dir);
9729  if (!window_target)
9730  window_target = FindWindowNavFocusable((focus_change_dir < 0) ? (g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1) : 0, i_current, focus_change_dir);
9731  if (window_target) // Don't reset windowing target if there's a single window in the list
9732  g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window_target;
9733  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
9734 }
9735 
9736 // Windowing management mode
9737 // Keyboard: CTRL+Tab (change focus/move/resize), Alt (toggle menu layer)
9738 // Gamepad: Hold Menu/Square (change focus/move/resize), Tap Menu/Square (toggle menu layer)
9739 static void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowing()
9740 {
9741  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9742  ImGuiIO &io = g.IO;
9743 
9744  ImGuiWindow *apply_focus_window = NULL;
9745  bool apply_toggle_layer = false;
9746 
9747  ImGuiWindow *modal_window = GetTopMostPopupModal();
9748  bool allow_windowing = (modal_window == NULL);
9749  if (!allow_windowing)
9750  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
9751 
9752  // Fade out
9753  if (g.NavWindowingTargetAnim && g.NavWindowingTarget == NULL)
9754  {
9755  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha - io.Time * 10.0f, 0.0f);
9756  if (g.DimBgRatio <= 0.0f && g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha <= 0.0f)
9757  g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = NULL;
9758  }
9759 
9760  // Start CTRL-TAB or Square+L/R window selection
9761  bool start_windowing_with_gamepad = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_Menu, ImGuiInputReadMode_Pressed);
9762  bool start_windowing_with_keyboard = allow_windowing && !g.NavWindowingTarget && io.KeyCtrl && IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab) && (io.ConfigFlags & ImGuiConfigFlags_NavEnableKeyboard);
9763  if (start_windowing_with_gamepad || start_windowing_with_keyboard)
9764  if (ImGuiWindow *window = g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow : FindWindowNavFocusable(g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1, -INT_MAX, -1))
9765  {
9766  g.NavWindowingTarget = g.NavWindowingTargetAnim = window->RootWindow;
9767  g.NavWindowingTimer = g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 0.0f;
9768  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = start_windowing_with_gamepad ? true : false; // Gamepad starts toggling layer
9769  g.NavInputSource = start_windowing_with_keyboard ? ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard : ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad;
9770  }
9771 
9772  // Gamepad update
9773  g.NavWindowingTimer += io.Time;
9774  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
9775  {
9776  // Highlight only appears after a brief time holding the button, so that a fast tap on PadMenu (to toggle NavLayer) doesn't add visual noise
9777  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f));
9778 
9779  // Select window to focus
9780  const int focus_change_dir = (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusPrev, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow) - (int)IsNavInputTest(ImGuiNavInput_FocusNext, ImGuiInputReadMode_RepeatSlow);
9781  if (focus_change_dir != 0)
9782  {
9783  NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(focus_change_dir);
9784  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = 1.0f;
9785  }
9786 
9787  // Single press toggles NavLayer, long press with L/R apply actual focus on release (until then the window was merely rendered top-most)
9788  if (!IsNavInputDown(ImGuiNavInput_Menu))
9789  {
9790  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer &= (g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha < 1.0f); // Once button was held long enough we don't consider it a tap-to-toggle-layer press anymore.
9791  if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavWindow)
9792  apply_toggle_layer = true;
9793  else if (!g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
9794  apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
9795  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
9796  }
9797  }
9798 
9799  // Keyboard: Focus
9800  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)
9801  {
9802  // Visuals only appears after a brief time after pressing TAB the first time, so that a fast CTRL+TAB doesn't add visual noise
9803  g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha = ImMax(g.NavWindowingHighlightAlpha, ImSaturate((g.NavWindowingTimer - NAV_WINDOWING_HIGHLIGHT_DELAY) / 0.05f)); // 1.0f
9804  if (IsKeyPressedMap(ImGuiKey_Tab, true))
9805  NavUpdateWindowingHighlightWindow(io.KeyShift ? +1 : -1);
9806  if (!io.KeyCtrl)
9807  apply_focus_window = g.NavWindowingTarget;
9808  }
9809 
9810  // Keyboard: Press and Release ALT to toggle menu layer
9811  // - Testing that only Alt is tested prevents Alt+Shift or AltGR from toggling menu layer.
9812  // - AltGR is normally Alt+Ctrl but we can't reliably detect it (not all backends/systems/layout emit it as Alt+Ctrl). But even on keyboards without AltGR we don't want Alt+Ctrl to open menu anyway.
9813  if (io.KeyMods == ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt && (io.KeyModsPrev & ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt) == 0)
9814  {
9815  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = true;
9816  g.NavInputSource = ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard;
9817  }
9818  if (g.NavWindowingToggleLayer && g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard)
9819  {
9820  // We cancel toggling nav layer when any text has been typed (generally while holding Alt). (See #370)
9821  // We cancel toggling nav layer when other modifiers are pressed. (See #4439)
9822  if (io.InputQueueCharacters.Size > 0 || io.KeyCtrl || io.KeyShift || io.KeySuper)
9823  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
9824 
9825  // Apply layer toggle on release
9826  // Important: we don't assume that Alt was previously held in order to handle loss of focus when backend calls io.AddFocusEvent(false)
9827  // Important: as before version <18314 we lacked an explicit IO event for focus gain/loss, we also compare mouse validity to detect old backends clearing mouse pos on focus loss.
9828  if (!(io.KeyMods & ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt) && (io.KeyModsPrev & ImGuiKeyModFlags_Alt) && g.NavWindowingToggleLayer)
9829  if (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap)
9830  if (IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePos) == IsMousePosValid(&io.MousePosPrev))
9831  apply_toggle_layer = true;
9832  if (!io.KeyAlt)
9833  g.NavWindowingToggleLayer = false;
9834  }
9835 
9836  // Move window
9837  if (g.NavWindowingTarget && !(g.NavWindowingTarget->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove))
9838  {
9839  ImVec2 move_delta;
9840  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Keyboard && !io.KeyShift)
9841  move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_Keyboard, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
9842  if (g.NavInputSource == ImGuiInputSource_Gamepad)
9843  move_delta = GetNavInputAmount2d(ImGuiNavDirSourceFlags_PadLStick, ImGuiInputReadMode_Down);
9844  if (move_delta.x != 0.0f || move_delta.y != 0.0f)
9845  {
9846  const float NAV_MOVE_SPEED = 800.0f;
9847  const float move_speed = ImFloor(NAV_MOVE_SPEED * io.Time * ImMin(io.DisplayFramebufferScale.x, io.DisplayFramebufferScale.y)); // FIXME: Doesn't handle variable framerate very well
9848  ImGuiWindow *moving_window = g.NavWindowingTarget->RootWindow;
9849  SetWindowPos(moving_window, moving_window->Pos + move_delta * move_speed, ImGuiCond_Always);
9850  MarkIniSettingsDirty(moving_window);
9851  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9852  }
9853  }
9854 
9855  // Apply final focus
9856  if (apply_focus_window && (g.NavWindow == NULL || apply_focus_window != g.NavWindow->RootWindow))
9857  {
9858  ClearActiveID();
9859  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9860  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9861  apply_focus_window = NavRestoreLastChildNavWindow(apply_focus_window);
9862  ClosePopupsOverWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
9863  FocusWindow(apply_focus_window);
9864  if (apply_focus_window->NavLastIds[0] == 0)
9865  NavInitWindow(apply_focus_window, false);
9866 
9867  // If the window has ONLY a menu layer (no main layer), select it directly
9868  // Use NavLayersActiveMaskNext since windows didn't have a chance to be Begin()-ed on this frame,
9869  // so CTRL+Tab where the keys are only held for 1 frame will be able to use correct layers mask since
9870  // the target window as already been previewed once.
9871  // FIXME-NAV: This should be done in NavInit.. or in FocusWindow... However in both of those cases,
9872  // we won't have a guarantee that windows has been visible before and therefore NavLayersActiveMask*
9873  // won't be valid.
9874  if (apply_focus_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMaskNext == (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu))
9875  g.NavLayer = ImGuiNavLayer_Menu;
9876  }
9877  if (apply_focus_window)
9878  g.NavWindowingTarget = NULL;
9879 
9880  // Apply menu/layer toggle
9881  if (apply_toggle_layer && g.NavWindow)
9882  {
9883  ClearActiveID();
9884 
9885  // Move to parent menu if necessary
9886  ImGuiWindow *new_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
9887  while (new_nav_window->ParentWindow
9888  && (new_nav_window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) == 0
9889  && (new_nav_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) != 0
9890  && (new_nav_window->Flags & (ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup | ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu)) == 0)
9891  new_nav_window = new_nav_window->ParentWindow;
9892  if (new_nav_window != g.NavWindow)
9893  {
9894  ImGuiWindow *old_nav_window = g.NavWindow;
9895  FocusWindow(new_nav_window);
9896  new_nav_window->NavLastChildNavWindow = old_nav_window;
9897  }
9898  g.NavDisableHighlight = false;
9899  g.NavDisableMouseHover = true;
9900 
9901  // Reinitialize navigation when entering menu bar with the Alt key.
9902  const ImGuiNavLayer new_nav_layer = (g.NavWindow->DC.NavLayersActiveMask & (1 << ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)) ? (ImGuiNavLayer)((int)g.NavLayer ^ 1) : ImGuiNavLayer_Main;
9903  if (new_nav_layer == ImGuiNavLayer_Menu)
9904  g.NavWindow->NavLastIds[new_nav_layer] = 0;
9905  NavRestoreLayer(new_nav_layer);
9906  }
9907 }
9908 
9909 // Window has already passed the IsWindowNavFocusable()
9910 static const char *GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(ImGuiWindow *window)
9911 {
9912  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup)
9913  return "(Popup)";
9914  if ((window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar) && strcmp(window->Name, "##MainMenuBar") == 0)
9915  return "(Main menu bar)";
9916  return "(Untitled)";
9917 }
9918 
9919 // Overlay displayed when using CTRL+TAB. Called by EndFrame().
9920 void ImGui::NavUpdateWindowingOverlay()
9921 {
9922  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9923  IM_ASSERT(g.NavWindowingTarget != NULL);
9924 
9925  if (g.NavWindowingTimer < NAV_WINDOWING_LIST_APPEAR_DELAY)
9926  return;
9927 
9928  if (g.NavWindowingListWindow == NULL)
9929  g.NavWindowingListWindow = FindWindowByName("###NavWindowingList");
9930  const ImGuiViewport *viewport = GetMainViewport();
9931  SetNextWindowSizeConstraints(ImVec2(viewport->Size.x * 0.20f, viewport->Size.y * 0.20f), ImVec2(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX));
9932  SetNextWindowPos(viewport->GetCenter(), ImGuiCond_Always, ImVec2(0.5f, 0.5f));
9933  PushStyleVar(ImGuiStyleVar_WindowPadding, g.Style.WindowPadding * 2.0f);
9934  Begin("###NavWindowingList", NULL, ImGuiWindowFlags_NoTitleBar | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoFocusOnAppearing | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMove | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoInputs | ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize | ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings);
9935  for (int n = g.WindowsFocusOrder.Size - 1; n >= 0; n--)
9936  {
9937  ImGuiWindow *window = g.WindowsFocusOrder[n];
9938  IM_ASSERT(window != NULL); // Fix static analyzers
9939  if (!IsWindowNavFocusable(window))
9940  continue;
9941  const char *label = window->Name;
9942  if (label == FindRenderedTextEnd(label))
9943  label = GetFallbackWindowNameForWindowingList(window);
9944  Selectable(label, g.NavWindowingTarget == window);
9945  }
9946  End();
9947  PopStyleVar();
9948 }
9949 
9950 
9951 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9952 // [SECTION] DRAG AND DROP
9953 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
9954 
9955 void ImGui::ClearDragDrop()
9956 {
9957  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9958  g.DragDropActive = false;
9959  g.DragDropPayload.Clear();
9960  g.DragDropAcceptFlags = ImGuiDragDropFlags_None;
9961  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev = 0;
9962  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = FLT_MAX;
9963  g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = -1;
9964 
9965  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.clear();
9966  memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
9967 }
9968 
9969 // When this returns true you need to: a) call SetDragDropPayload() exactly once, b) you may render the payload visual/description, c) call EndDragDropSource()
9970 // If the item has an identifier:
9971 // - This assume/require the item to be activated (typically via ButtonBehavior).
9972 // - Therefore if you want to use this with a mouse button other than left mouse button, it is up to the item itself to activate with another button.
9973 // - We then pull and use the mouse button that was used to activate the item and use it to carry on the drag.
9974 // If the item has no identifier:
9975 // - Currently always assume left mouse button.
9976 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropSource(ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
9977 {
9978  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
9979  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
9980 
9981  // FIXME-DRAGDROP: While in the common-most "drag from non-zero active id" case we can tell the mouse button,
9982  // in both SourceExtern and id==0 cases we may requires something else (explicit flags or some heuristic).
9983  ImGuiMouseButton mouse_button = ImGuiMouseButton_Left;
9984 
9985  bool source_drag_active = false;
9986  ImGuiID source_id = 0;
9987  ImGuiID source_parent_id = 0;
9988  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
9989  {
9990  source_id = g.LastItemData.ID;
9991  if (source_id != 0)
9992  {
9993  // Common path: items with ID
9994  if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
9995  return false;
9996  if (g.ActiveIdMouseButton != -1)
9997  mouse_button = g.ActiveIdMouseButton;
9998  if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false)
9999  return false;
10000  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = false;
10001  }
10002  else
10003  {
10004  // Uncommon path: items without ID
10005  if (g.IO.MouseDown[mouse_button] == false)
10006  return false;
10007 
10008  // If you want to use BeginDragDropSource() on an item with no unique identifier for interaction, such as Text() or Image(), you need to:
10009  // A) Read the explanation below, B) Use the ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID flag, C) Swallow your programmer pride.
10010  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceAllowNullID))
10011  {
10012  IM_ASSERT(0);
10013  return false;
10014  }
10015 
10016  // Early out
10017  if ((g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect) == 0 && (g.ActiveId == 0 || g.ActiveIdWindow != window))
10018  return false;
10019 
10020  // Magic fallback (=somehow reprehensible) to handle items with no assigned ID, e.g. Text(), Image()
10021  // We build a throwaway ID based on current ID stack + relative AABB of items in window.
10022  // THE IDENTIFIER WON'T SURVIVE ANY REPOSITIONING OF THE WIDGET, so if your widget moves your dragging operation will be canceled.
10023  // We don't need to maintain/call ClearActiveID() as releasing the button will early out this function and trigger !ActiveIdIsAlive.
10024  // Rely on keeping other window->LastItemXXX fields intact.
10025  source_id = g.LastItemData.ID = window->GetIDFromRectangle(g.LastItemData.Rect);
10026  bool is_hovered = ItemHoverable(g.LastItemData.Rect, source_id);
10027  if (is_hovered && g.IO.MouseClicked[mouse_button])
10028  {
10029  SetActiveID(source_id, window);
10030  FocusWindow(window);
10031  }
10032  if (g.ActiveId == source_id) // Allow the underlying widget to display/return hovered during the mouse release frame, else we would get a flicker.
10033  g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap = is_hovered;
10034  }
10035  if (g.ActiveId != source_id)
10036  return false;
10037  source_parent_id = window->IDStack.back();
10038  source_drag_active = IsMouseDragging(mouse_button);
10039 
10040  // Disable navigation and key inputs while dragging + cancel existing request if any
10041  SetActiveIdUsingNavAndKeys();
10042  }
10043  else
10044  {
10045  window = NULL;
10046  source_id = ImHashStr("#SourceExtern");
10047  source_drag_active = true;
10048  }
10049 
10050  if (source_drag_active)
10051  {
10052  if (!g.DragDropActive)
10053  {
10054  IM_ASSERT(source_id != 0);
10055  ClearDragDrop();
10056  ImGuiPayload &payload = g.DragDropPayload;
10057  payload.SourceId = source_id;
10058  payload.SourceParentId = source_parent_id;
10059  g.DragDropActive = true;
10060  g.DragDropSourceFlags = flags;
10061  g.DragDropMouseButton = mouse_button;
10062  if (payload.SourceId == g.ActiveId)
10063  g.ActiveIdNoClearOnFocusLoss = true;
10064  }
10065  g.DragDropSourceFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10066  g.DragDropWithinSource = true;
10067 
10068  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
10069  {
10070  // Target can request the Source to not display its tooltip (we use a dedicated flag to make this request explicit)
10071  // We unfortunately can't just modify the source flags and skip the call to BeginTooltip, as caller may be emitting contents.
10072  BeginTooltip();
10073  if (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev && (g.DragDropAcceptFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoPreviewTooltip))
10074  {
10075  ImGuiWindow *tooltip_window = g.CurrentWindow;
10076  tooltip_window->Hidden = tooltip_window->SkipItems = true;
10077  tooltip_window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems = 1;
10078  }
10079  }
10080 
10081  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoDisableHover) && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceExtern))
10082  g.LastItemData.StatusFlags &= ~ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect;
10083 
10084  return true;
10085  }
10086  return false;
10087 }
10088 
10089 void ImGui::EndDragDropSource()
10090 {
10091  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10092  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
10093  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinSource && "Not after a BeginDragDropSource()?");
10094 
10095  if (!(g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_SourceNoPreviewTooltip))
10096  EndTooltip();
10097 
10098  // Discard the drag if have not called SetDragDropPayload()
10099  if (g.DragDropPayload.DataFrameCount == -1)
10100  ClearDragDrop();
10101  g.DragDropWithinSource = false;
10102 }
10103 
10104 // Use 'cond' to choose to submit payload on drag start or every frame
10105 bool ImGui::SetDragDropPayload(const char *type, const void *data, size_t data_size, ImGuiCond cond)
10106 {
10107  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10108  ImGuiPayload &payload = g.DragDropPayload;
10109  if (cond == 0)
10110  cond = ImGuiCond_Always;
10111 
10112  IM_ASSERT(type != NULL);
10113  IM_ASSERT(strlen(type) < IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType) && "Payload type can be at most 32 characters long");
10114  IM_ASSERT((data != NULL && data_size > 0) || (data == NULL && data_size == 0));
10115  IM_ASSERT(cond == ImGuiCond_Always || cond == ImGuiCond_Once);
10116  IM_ASSERT(payload.SourceId != 0); // Not called between BeginDragDropSource() and EndDragDropSource()
10117 
10118  if (cond == ImGuiCond_Always || payload.DataFrameCount == -1)
10119  {
10120  // Copy payload
10121  ImStrncpy(payload.DataType, type, IM_ARRAYSIZE(payload.DataType));
10122  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize(0);
10123  if (data_size > sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal))
10124  {
10125  // Store in heap
10126  g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.resize((int)data_size);
10127  payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufHeap.Data;
10128  memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
10129  }
10130  else if (data_size > 0)
10131  {
10132  // Store locally
10133  memset(&g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal, 0, sizeof(g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal));
10134  payload.Data = g.DragDropPayloadBufLocal;
10135  memcpy(payload.Data, data, data_size);
10136  }
10137  else
10138  {
10139  payload.Data = NULL;
10140  }
10141  payload.DataSize = (int)data_size;
10142  }
10143  payload.DataFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10144 
10145  return (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount) || (g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount == g.FrameCount - 1);
10146 }
10147 
10148 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTargetCustom(const ImRect &bb, ImGuiID id)
10149 {
10150  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10151  if (!g.DragDropActive)
10152  return false;
10153 
10154  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
10155  ImGuiWindow *hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
10156  if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindow != hovered_window->RootWindow)
10157  return false;
10158  IM_ASSERT(id != 0);
10159  if (!IsMouseHoveringRect(bb.Min, bb.Max) || (id == g.DragDropPayload.SourceId))
10160  return false;
10161  if (window->SkipItems)
10162  return false;
10163 
10164  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
10165  g.DragDropTargetRect = bb;
10166  g.DragDropTargetId = id;
10167  g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
10168  return true;
10169 }
10170 
10171 // We don't use BeginDragDropTargetCustom() and duplicate its code because:
10172 // 1) we use LastItemRectHoveredRect which handles items that pushes a temporarily clip rectangle in their code. Calling BeginDragDropTargetCustom(LastItemRect) would not handle them.
10173 // 2) and it's faster. as this code may be very frequently called, we want to early out as fast as we can.
10174 // Also note how the HoveredWindow test is positioned differently in both functions (in both functions we optimize for the cheapest early out case)
10175 bool ImGui::BeginDragDropTarget()
10176 {
10177  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10178  if (!g.DragDropActive)
10179  return false;
10180 
10181  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
10182  if (!(g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HoveredRect))
10183  return false;
10184  ImGuiWindow *hovered_window = g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow;
10185  if (hovered_window == NULL || window->RootWindow != hovered_window->RootWindow)
10186  return false;
10187 
10188  const ImRect &display_rect = (g.LastItemData.StatusFlags & ImGuiItemStatusFlags_HasDisplayRect) ? g.LastItemData.DisplayRect : g.LastItemData.Rect;
10189  ImGuiID id = g.LastItemData.ID;
10190  if (id == 0)
10191  id = window->GetIDFromRectangle(display_rect);
10192  if (g.DragDropPayload.SourceId == id)
10193  return false;
10194 
10195  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget == false);
10196  g.DragDropTargetRect = display_rect;
10197  g.DragDropTargetId = id;
10198  g.DragDropWithinTarget = true;
10199  return true;
10200 }
10201 
10202 bool ImGui::IsDragDropPayloadBeingAccepted()
10203 {
10204  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10205  return g.DragDropActive && g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev != 0;
10206 }
10207 
10208 const ImGuiPayload *ImGui::AcceptDragDropPayload(const char *type, ImGuiDragDropFlags flags)
10209 {
10210  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10211  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
10212  ImGuiPayload &payload = g.DragDropPayload;
10213  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive); // Not called between BeginDragDropTarget() and EndDragDropTarget() ?
10214  IM_ASSERT(payload.DataFrameCount != -1); // Forgot to call EndDragDropTarget() ?
10215  if (type != NULL && !payload.IsDataType(type))
10216  return NULL;
10217 
10218  // Accept smallest drag target bounding box, this allows us to nest drag targets conveniently without ordering constraints.
10219  // NB: We currently accept NULL id as target. However, overlapping targets requires a unique ID to function!
10220  const bool was_accepted_previously = (g.DragDropAcceptIdPrev == g.DragDropTargetId);
10221  ImRect r = g.DragDropTargetRect;
10222  float r_surface = r.GetWidth() * r.GetHeight();
10223  if (r_surface <= g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface)
10224  {
10225  g.DragDropAcceptFlags = flags;
10226  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurr = g.DragDropTargetId;
10227  g.DragDropAcceptIdCurrRectSurface = r_surface;
10228  }
10229 
10230  // Render default drop visuals
10231  // FIXME-DRAGDROP: Settle on a proper default visuals for drop target.
10232  payload.Preview = was_accepted_previously;
10233  flags |= (g.DragDropSourceFlags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect); // Source can also inhibit the preview (useful for external sources that lives for 1 frame)
10234  if (!(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptNoDrawDefaultRect) && payload.Preview)
10235  window->DrawList->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(3.5f, 3.5f), r.Max + ImVec2(3.5f, 3.5f), GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_DragDropTarget), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
10236 
10237  g.DragDropAcceptFrameCount = g.FrameCount;
10238  payload.Delivery = was_accepted_previously && !IsMouseDown(g.DragDropMouseButton); // For extern drag sources affecting os window focus, it's easier to just test !IsMouseDown() instead of IsMouseReleased()
10239  if (!payload.Delivery && !(flags & ImGuiDragDropFlags_AcceptBeforeDelivery))
10240  return NULL;
10241 
10242  return &payload;
10243 }
10244 
10245 const ImGuiPayload *ImGui::GetDragDropPayload()
10246 {
10247  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10248  return g.DragDropActive ? &g.DragDropPayload : NULL;
10249 }
10250 
10251 // We don't really use/need this now, but added it for the sake of consistency and because we might need it later.
10252 void ImGui::EndDragDropTarget()
10253 {
10254  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10255  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropActive);
10256  IM_ASSERT(g.DragDropWithinTarget);
10257  g.DragDropWithinTarget = false;
10258 }
10259 
10260 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10261 // [SECTION] LOGGING/CAPTURING
10262 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10263 // All text output from the interface can be captured into tty/file/clipboard.
10264 // By default, tree nodes are automatically opened during logging.
10265 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10266 
10267 // Pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)
10268 static inline void LogTextV(ImGuiContext &g, const char *fmt, va_list args)
10269 {
10270  if (g.LogFile)
10271  {
10272  g.LogBuffer.Buf.resize(0);
10273  g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
10274  ImFileWrite(g.LogBuffer.c_str(), sizeof(char), (ImU64)g.LogBuffer.size(), g.LogFile);
10275  }
10276  else
10277  {
10278  g.LogBuffer.appendfv(fmt, args);
10279  }
10280 }
10281 
10282 void ImGui::LogText(const char *fmt, ...)
10283 {
10284  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10285  if (!g.LogEnabled)
10286  return;
10287 
10288  va_list args;
10289  va_start(args, fmt);
10290  LogTextV(g, fmt, args);
10291  va_end(args);
10292 }
10293 
10294 void ImGui::LogTextV(const char *fmt, va_list args)
10295 {
10296  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10297  if (!g.LogEnabled)
10298  return;
10299 
10300  LogTextV(g, fmt, args);
10301 }
10302 
10303 // Internal version that takes a position to decide on newline placement and pad items according to their depth.
10304 // We split text into individual lines to add current tree level padding
10305 // FIXME: This code is a little complicated perhaps, considering simplifying the whole system.
10306 void ImGui::LogRenderedText(const ImVec2 *ref_pos, const char *text, const char *text_end)
10307 {
10308  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10309  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
10310 
10311  const char *prefix = g.LogNextPrefix;
10312  const char *suffix = g.LogNextSuffix;
10313  g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
10314 
10315  if (!text_end)
10316  text_end = FindRenderedTextEnd(text, text_end);
10317 
10318  const bool log_new_line = ref_pos && (ref_pos->y > g.LogLinePosY + g.Style.FramePadding.y + 1);
10319  if (ref_pos)
10320  g.LogLinePosY = ref_pos->y;
10321  if (log_new_line)
10322  {
10323  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
10324  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
10325  }
10326 
10327  if (prefix)
10328  LogRenderedText(ref_pos, prefix, prefix + strlen(prefix)); // Calculate end ourself to ensure "##" are included here.
10329 
10330  // Re-adjust padding if we have popped out of our starting depth
10331  if (g.LogDepthRef > window->DC.TreeDepth)
10332  g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
10333  const int tree_depth = (window->DC.TreeDepth - g.LogDepthRef);
10334 
10335  const char *text_remaining = text;
10336  for (;;)
10337  {
10338  // Split the string. Each new line (after a '\n') is followed by indentation corresponding to the current depth of our log entry.
10339  // We don't add a trailing \n yet to allow a subsequent item on the same line to be captured.
10340  const char *line_start = text_remaining;
10341  const char *line_end = ImStreolRange(line_start, text_end);
10342  const bool is_last_line = (line_end == text_end);
10343  if (line_start != line_end || !is_last_line)
10344  {
10345  const int line_length = (int)(line_end - line_start);
10346  const int indentation = g.LogLineFirstItem ? tree_depth * 4 : 1;
10347  LogText("%*s%.*s", indentation, "", line_length, line_start);
10348  g.LogLineFirstItem = false;
10349  if (*line_end == '\n')
10350  {
10351  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
10352  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
10353  }
10354  }
10355  if (is_last_line)
10356  break;
10357  text_remaining = line_end + 1;
10358  }
10359 
10360  if (suffix)
10361  LogRenderedText(ref_pos, suffix, suffix + strlen(suffix));
10362 }
10363 
10364 // Start logging/capturing text output
10365 void ImGui::LogBegin(ImGuiLogType type, int auto_open_depth)
10366 {
10367  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10368  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
10369  IM_ASSERT(g.LogEnabled == false);
10370  IM_ASSERT(g.LogFile == NULL);
