10371  IM_ASSERT(g.LogBuffer.empty());
10372  g.LogEnabled = true;
10373  g.LogType = type;
10374  g.LogNextPrefix = g.LogNextSuffix = NULL;
10375  g.LogDepthRef = window->DC.TreeDepth;
10376  g.LogDepthToExpand = ((auto_open_depth >= 0) ? auto_open_depth : g.LogDepthToExpandDefault);
10377  g.LogLinePosY = FLT_MAX;
10378  g.LogLineFirstItem = true;
10379 }
10380 
10381 // Important: doesn't copy underlying data, use carefully (prefix/suffix must be in scope at the time of the next LogRenderedText)
10382 void ImGui::LogSetNextTextDecoration(const char *prefix, const char *suffix)
10383 {
10384  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10385  g.LogNextPrefix = prefix;
10386  g.LogNextSuffix = suffix;
10387 }
10388 
10389 void ImGui::LogToTTY(int auto_open_depth)
10390 {
10391  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10392  if (g.LogEnabled)
10393  return;
10394  IM_UNUSED(auto_open_depth);
10395 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
10396  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_TTY, auto_open_depth);
10397  g.LogFile = stdout;
10398 #endif
10399 }
10400 
10401 // Start logging/capturing text output to given file
10402 void ImGui::LogToFile(int auto_open_depth, const char *filename)
10403 {
10404  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10405  if (g.LogEnabled)
10406  return;
10407 
10408  // FIXME: We could probably open the file in text mode "at", however note that clipboard/buffer logging will still
10409  // be subject to outputting OS-incompatible carriage return if within strings the user doesn't use IM_NEWLINE.
10410  // By opening the file in binary mode "ab" we have consistent output everywhere.
10411  if (!filename)
10412  filename = g.IO.LogFilename;
10413  if (!filename || !filename[0])
10414  return;
10415  ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(filename, "ab");
10416  if (!f)
10417  {
10418  IM_ASSERT(0);
10419  return;
10420  }
10421 
10422  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_File, auto_open_depth);
10423  g.LogFile = f;
10424 }
10425 
10426 // Start logging/capturing text output to clipboard
10427 void ImGui::LogToClipboard(int auto_open_depth)
10428 {
10429  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10430  if (g.LogEnabled)
10431  return;
10432  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Clipboard, auto_open_depth);
10433 }
10434 
10435 void ImGui::LogToBuffer(int auto_open_depth)
10436 {
10437  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10438  if (g.LogEnabled)
10439  return;
10440  LogBegin(ImGuiLogType_Buffer, auto_open_depth);
10441 }
10442 
10443 void ImGui::LogFinish()
10444 {
10445  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10446  if (!g.LogEnabled)
10447  return;
10448 
10449  LogText(IM_NEWLINE);
10450  switch (g.LogType)
10451  {
10452  case ImGuiLogType_TTY:
10453 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
10454  fflush(g.LogFile);
10455 #endif
10456  break;
10457  case ImGuiLogType_File:
10458  ImFileClose(g.LogFile);
10459  break;
10460  case ImGuiLogType_Buffer:
10461  break;
10462  case ImGuiLogType_Clipboard:
10463  if (!g.LogBuffer.empty())
10464  SetClipboardText(g.LogBuffer.begin());
10465  break;
10466  case ImGuiLogType_None:
10467  IM_ASSERT(0);
10468  break;
10469  }
10470 
10471  g.LogEnabled = false;
10472  g.LogType = ImGuiLogType_None;
10473  g.LogFile = NULL;
10474  g.LogBuffer.clear();
10475 }
10476 
10477 // Helper to display logging buttons
10478 // FIXME-OBSOLETE: We should probably obsolete this and let the user have their own helper (this is one of the oldest function alive!)
10479 void ImGui::LogButtons()
10480 {
10481  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10482 
10483  PushID("LogButtons");
10484 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_TTY_FUNCTIONS
10485  const bool log_to_tty = Button("Log To TTY"); SameLine();
10486 #else
10487  const bool log_to_tty = false;
10488 #endif
10489  const bool log_to_file = Button("Log To File"); SameLine();
10490  const bool log_to_clipboard = Button("Log To Clipboard"); SameLine();
10491  PushAllowKeyboardFocus(false);
10492  SetNextItemWidth(80.0f);
10493  SliderInt("Default Depth", &g.LogDepthToExpandDefault, 0, 9, NULL);
10494  PopAllowKeyboardFocus();
10495  PopID();
10496 
10497  // Start logging at the end of the function so that the buttons don't appear in the log
10498  if (log_to_tty)
10499  LogToTTY();
10500  if (log_to_file)
10501  LogToFile();
10502  if (log_to_clipboard)
10503  LogToClipboard();
10504 }
10505 
10506 
10507 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10508 // [SECTION] SETTINGS
10509 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10510 // - UpdateSettings() [Internal]
10511 // - MarkIniSettingsDirty() [Internal]
10512 // - CreateNewWindowSettings() [Internal]
10513 // - FindWindowSettings() [Internal]
10514 // - FindOrCreateWindowSettings() [Internal]
10515 // - FindSettingsHandler() [Internal]
10516 // - ClearIniSettings() [Internal]
10517 // - LoadIniSettingsFromDisk()
10518 // - LoadIniSettingsFromMemory()
10519 // - SaveIniSettingsToDisk()
10520 // - SaveIniSettingsToMemory()
10521 // - WindowSettingsHandler_***() [Internal]
10522 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10523 
10524 // Called by NewFrame()
10525 void ImGui::UpdateSettings()
10526 {
10527  // Load settings on first frame (if not explicitly loaded manually before)
10528  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10529  if (!g.SettingsLoaded)
10530  {
10531  IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsWindows.empty());
10532  if (g.IO.IniFilename)
10533  LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
10534  g.SettingsLoaded = true;
10535  }
10536 
10537  // Save settings (with a delay after the last modification, so we don't spam disk too much)
10538  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer > 0.0f)
10539  {
10540  g.SettingsDirtyTimer -= g.IO.Time;
10541  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
10542  {
10543  if (g.IO.IniFilename != NULL)
10544  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
10545  else
10546  g.IO.WantSaveIniSettings = true; // Let user know they can call SaveIniSettingsToMemory(). user will need to clear io.WantSaveIniSettings themselves.
10547  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
10548  }
10549  }
10550 }
10551 
10552 void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty()
10553 {
10554  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10555  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
10556  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
10557 }
10558 
10559 void ImGui::MarkIniSettingsDirty(ImGuiWindow *window)
10560 {
10561  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10562  if (!(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings))
10563  if (g.SettingsDirtyTimer <= 0.0f)
10564  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = g.IO.IniSavingRate;
10565 }
10566 
10567 ImGuiWindowSettings *ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(const char *name)
10568 {
10569  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10570 
10571 #if !IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS
10572  // Skip to the "###" marker if any. We don't skip past to match the behavior of GetID()
10573  // Preserve the full string when IMGUI_DEBUG_INI_SETTINGS is set to make .ini inspection easier.
10574  if (const char *p = strstr(name, "###"))
10575  name = p;
10576 #endif
10577  const size_t name_len = strlen(name);
10578 
10579  // Allocate chunk
10580  const size_t chunk_size = sizeof(ImGuiWindowSettings) + name_len + 1;
10581  ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = g.SettingsWindows.alloc_chunk(chunk_size);
10582  IM_PLACEMENT_NEW(settings) ImGuiWindowSettings();
10583  settings->ID = ImHashStr(name, name_len);
10584  memcpy(settings->GetName(), name, name_len + 1); // Store with zero terminator
10585 
10586  return settings;
10587 }
10588 
10589 ImGuiWindowSettings *ImGui::FindWindowSettings(ImGuiID id)
10590 {
10591  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10592  for (ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
10593  if (settings->ID == id)
10594  return settings;
10595  return NULL;
10596 }
10597 
10598 ImGuiWindowSettings *ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(const char *name)
10599 {
10600  if (ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = FindWindowSettings(ImHashStr(name)))
10601  return settings;
10602  return CreateNewWindowSettings(name);
10603 }
10604 
10605 ImGuiSettingsHandler *ImGui::FindSettingsHandler(const char *type_name)
10606 {
10607  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10608  const ImGuiID type_hash = ImHashStr(type_name);
10609  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10610  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].TypeHash == type_hash)
10611  return &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
10612  return NULL;
10613 }
10614 
10615 void ImGui::ClearIniSettings()
10616 {
10617  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10618  g.SettingsIniData.clear();
10619  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10620  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn)
10621  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ClearAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
10622 }
10623 
10624 void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(const char *ini_filename)
10625 {
10626  size_t file_data_size = 0;
10627  char *file_data = (char *)ImFileLoadToMemory(ini_filename, "rb", &file_data_size);
10628  if (!file_data)
10629  return;
10630  LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(file_data, (size_t)file_data_size);
10631  IM_FREE(file_data);
10632 }
10633 
10634 // Zero-tolerance, no error reporting, cheap .ini parsing
10635 void ImGui::LoadIniSettingsFromMemory(const char *ini_data, size_t ini_size)
10636 {
10637  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10638  IM_ASSERT(g.Initialized);
10639  //IM_ASSERT(!g.WithinFrameScope && "Cannot be called between NewFrame() and EndFrame()");
10640  //IM_ASSERT(g.SettingsLoaded == false && g.FrameCount == 0);
10641 
10642  // For user convenience, we allow passing a non zero-terminated string (hence the ini_size parameter).
10643  // For our convenience and to make the code simpler, we'll also write zero-terminators within the buffer. So let's create a writable copy..
10644  if (ini_size == 0)
10645  ini_size = strlen(ini_data);
10646  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize((int)ini_size + 1);
10647  char *const buf = g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Data;
10648  char *const buf_end = buf + ini_size;
10649  memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
10650  buf_end[0] = 0;
10651 
10652  // Call pre-read handlers
10653  // Some types will clear their data (e.g. dock information) some types will allow merge/override (window)
10654  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10655  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn)
10656  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ReadInitFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
10657 
10658  void *entry_data = NULL;
10659  ImGuiSettingsHandler *entry_handler = NULL;
10660 
10661  char *line_end = NULL;
10662  for (char *line = buf; line < buf_end; line = line_end + 1)
10663  {
10664  // Skip new lines markers, then find end of the line
10665  while (*line == '\n' || *line == '\r')
10666  line++;
10667  line_end = line;
10668  while (line_end < buf_end && *line_end != '\n' && *line_end != '\r')
10669  line_end++;
10670  line_end[0] = 0;
10671  if (line[0] == ';')
10672  continue;
10673  if (line[0] == '[' && line_end > line && line_end[-1] == ']')
10674  {
10675  // Parse "[Type][Name]". Note that 'Name' can itself contains [] characters, which is acceptable with the current format and parsing code.
10676  line_end[-1] = 0;
10677  const char *name_end = line_end - 1;
10678  const char *type_start = line + 1;
10679  char *type_end = (char *)(void *)ImStrchrRange(type_start, name_end, ']');
10680  const char *name_start = type_end ? ImStrchrRange(type_end + 1, name_end, '[') : NULL;
10681  if (!type_end || !name_start)
10682  continue;
10683  *type_end = 0; // Overwrite first ']'
10684  name_start++; // Skip second '['
10685  entry_handler = FindSettingsHandler(type_start);
10686  entry_data = entry_handler ? entry_handler->ReadOpenFn(&g, entry_handler, name_start) : NULL;
10687  }
10688  else if (entry_handler != NULL && entry_data != NULL)
10689  {
10690  // Let type handler parse the line
10691  entry_handler->ReadLineFn(&g, entry_handler, entry_data, line);
10692  }
10693  }
10694  g.SettingsLoaded = true;
10695 
10696  // [DEBUG] Restore untouched copy so it can be browsed in Metrics (not strictly necessary)
10697  memcpy(buf, ini_data, ini_size);
10698 
10699  // Call post-read handlers
10700  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10701  if (g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn)
10702  g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n].ApplyAllFn(&g, &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n]);
10703 }
10704 
10705 void ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToDisk(const char *ini_filename)
10706 {
10707  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10708  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
10709  if (!ini_filename)
10710  return;
10711 
10712  size_t ini_data_size = 0;
10713  const char *ini_data = SaveIniSettingsToMemory(&ini_data_size);
10714  ImFileHandle f = ImFileOpen(ini_filename, "wt");
10715  if (!f)
10716  return;
10717  ImFileWrite(ini_data, sizeof(char), ini_data_size, f);
10718  ImFileClose(f);
10719 }
10720 
10721 // Call registered handlers (e.g. SettingsHandlerWindow_WriteAll() + custom handlers) to write their stuff into a text buffer
10722 const char *ImGui::SaveIniSettingsToMemory(size_t *out_size)
10723 {
10724  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10725  g.SettingsDirtyTimer = 0.0f;
10726  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.resize(0);
10727  g.SettingsIniData.Buf.push_back(0);
10728  for (int handler_n = 0; handler_n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; handler_n++)
10729  {
10730  ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler = &g.SettingsHandlers[handler_n];
10731  handler->WriteAllFn(&g, handler, &g.SettingsIniData);
10732  }
10733  if (out_size)
10734  *out_size = (size_t)g.SettingsIniData.size();
10735  return g.SettingsIniData.c_str();
10736 }
10737 
10738 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ClearAll(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *)
10739 {
10740  ImGuiContext &g = *ctx;
10741  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
10742  g.Windows[i]->SettingsOffset = -1;
10743  g.SettingsWindows.clear();
10744 }
10745 
10746 static void *WindowSettingsHandler_ReadOpen(ImGuiContext *, ImGuiSettingsHandler *, const char *name)
10747 {
10748  ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = ImGui::FindOrCreateWindowSettings(name);
10749  ImGuiID id = settings->ID;
10750  *settings = ImGuiWindowSettings(); // Clear existing if recycling previous entry
10751  settings->ID = id;
10752  settings->WantApply = true;
10753  return (void *)settings;
10754 }
10755 
10756 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ReadLine(ImGuiContext *, ImGuiSettingsHandler *, void *entry, const char *line)
10757 {
10758  ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = (ImGuiWindowSettings *)entry;
10759  int x, y;
10760  int i;
10761  if (sscanf(line, "Pos=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2)
10762  {
10763  settings->Pos = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y);
10764  }
10765  else if (sscanf(line, "Size=%i,%i", &x, &y) == 2)
10766  {
10767  settings->Size = ImVec2ih((short)x, (short)y);
10768  }
10769  else if (sscanf(line, "Collapsed=%d", &i) == 1)
10770  {
10771  settings->Collapsed = (i != 0);
10772  }
10773 }
10774 
10775 // Apply to existing windows (if any)
10776 static void WindowSettingsHandler_ApplyAll(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *)
10777 {
10778  ImGuiContext &g = *ctx;
10779  for (ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
10780  if (settings->WantApply)
10781  {
10782  if (ImGuiWindow *window = ImGui::FindWindowByID(settings->ID))
10783  ApplyWindowSettings(window, settings);
10784  settings->WantApply = false;
10785  }
10786 }
10787 
10788 static void WindowSettingsHandler_WriteAll(ImGuiContext *ctx, ImGuiSettingsHandler *handler, ImGuiTextBuffer *buf)
10789 {
10790  // Gather data from windows that were active during this session
10791  // (if a window wasn't opened in this session we preserve its settings)
10792  ImGuiContext &g = *ctx;
10793  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
10794  {
10795  ImGuiWindow *window = g.Windows[i];
10796  if (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings)
10797  continue;
10798 
10799  ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = (window->SettingsOffset != -1) ? g.SettingsWindows.ptr_from_offset(window->SettingsOffset) : ImGui::FindWindowSettings(window->ID);
10800  if (!settings)
10801  {
10802  settings = ImGui::CreateNewWindowSettings(window->Name);
10803  window->SettingsOffset = g.SettingsWindows.offset_from_ptr(settings);
10804  }
10805  IM_ASSERT(settings->ID == window->ID);
10806  settings->Pos = ImVec2ih(window->Pos);
10807  settings->Size = ImVec2ih(window->SizeFull);
10808 
10809  settings->Collapsed = window->Collapsed;
10810  }
10811 
10812  // Write to text buffer
10813  buf->reserve(buf->size() + g.SettingsWindows.size() * 6); // ballpark reserve
10814  for (ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
10815  {
10816  const char *settings_name = settings->GetName();
10817  buf->appendf("[%s][%s]\n", handler->TypeName, settings_name);
10818  buf->appendf("Pos=%d,%d\n", settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y);
10819  buf->appendf("Size=%d,%d\n", settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y);
10820  buf->appendf("Collapsed=%d\n", settings->Collapsed);
10821  buf->append("\n");
10822  }
10823 }
10824 
10825 
10826 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10827 // [SECTION] VIEWPORTS, PLATFORM WINDOWS
10828 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10829 // - GetMainViewport()
10830 // - UpdateViewportsNewFrame() [Internal]
10831 // (this section is more complete in the 'docking' branch)
10832 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10833 
10834 ImGuiViewport *ImGui::GetMainViewport()
10835 {
10836  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10837  return g.Viewports[0];
10838 }
10839 
10840 // Update viewports and monitor infos
10841 static void ImGui::UpdateViewportsNewFrame()
10842 {
10843  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10844  IM_ASSERT(g.Viewports.Size == 1);
10845 
10846  // Update main viewport with current platform position.
10847  // FIXME-VIEWPORT: Size is driven by backend/user code for backward-compatibility but we should aim to make this more consistent.
10848  ImGuiViewportP *main_viewport = g.Viewports[0];
10849  main_viewport->Flags = ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow | ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp;
10850  main_viewport->Pos = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
10851  main_viewport->Size = g.IO.DisplaySize;
10852 
10853  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
10854  {
10855  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[n];
10856 
10857  // Lock down space taken by menu bars and status bars, reset the offset for fucntions like BeginMainMenuBar() to alter them again.
10858  viewport->WorkOffsetMin = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin;
10859  viewport->WorkOffsetMax = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax;
10860  viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMin = viewport->BuildWorkOffsetMax = ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f);
10861  viewport->UpdateWorkRect();
10862  }
10863 }
10864 
10865 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10866 // [SECTION] DOCKING
10867 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10868 
10869 // (this section is filled in the 'docking' branch)
10870 
10871 
10872 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10873 // [SECTION] PLATFORM DEPENDENT HELPERS
10874 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
10875 
10876 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
10877 
10878 #ifdef _MSC_VER
10879 #pragma comment(lib, "user32")
10880 #pragma comment(lib, "kernel32")
10881 #endif
10882 
10883 // Win32 clipboard implementation
10884 // We use g.ClipboardHandlerData for temporary storage to ensure it is freed on Shutdown()
10885 static const char *GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void *)
10886 {
10887  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10888  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
10889  if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
10890  return NULL;
10891  HANDLE wbuf_handle = ::GetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT);
10892  if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
10893  {
10894  ::CloseClipboard();
10895  return NULL;
10896  }
10897  if (const WCHAR *wbuf_global = (const WCHAR *)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle))
10898  {
10899  int buf_len = ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL);
10900  g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(buf_len);
10901  ::WideCharToMultiByte(CP_UTF8, 0, wbuf_global, -1, g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data, buf_len, NULL, NULL);
10902  }
10903  ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
10904  ::CloseClipboard();
10905  return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
10906 }
10907 
10908 static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void *, const char *text)
10909 {
10910  if (!::OpenClipboard(NULL))
10911  return;
10912  const int wbuf_length = ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, NULL, 0);
10913  HGLOBAL wbuf_handle = ::GlobalAlloc(GMEM_MOVEABLE, (SIZE_T)wbuf_length * sizeof(WCHAR));
10914  if (wbuf_handle == NULL)
10915  {
10916  ::CloseClipboard();
10917  return;
10918  }
10919  WCHAR *wbuf_global = (WCHAR *)::GlobalLock(wbuf_handle);
10920  ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, text, -1, wbuf_global, wbuf_length);
10921  ::GlobalUnlock(wbuf_handle);
10922  ::EmptyClipboard();
10923  if (::SetClipboardData(CF_UNICODETEXT, wbuf_handle) == NULL)
10924  ::GlobalFree(wbuf_handle);
10925  ::CloseClipboard();
10926 }
10927 
10928 #elif defined(__APPLE__) && TARGET_OS_OSX && defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_OSX_DEFAULT_CLIPBOARD_FUNCTIONS)
10929 
10930 #include <Carbon/Carbon.h> // Use old API to avoid need for separate .mm file
10931 static PasteboardRef main_clipboard = 0;
10932 
10933 // OSX clipboard implementation
10934 // If you enable this you will need to add '-framework ApplicationServices' to your linker command-line!
10935 static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void *, const char *text)
10936 {
10937  if (!main_clipboard)
10938  PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
10939  PasteboardClear(main_clipboard);
10940  CFDataRef cf_data = CFDataCreate(kCFAllocatorDefault, (const UInt8 *)text, strlen(text));
10941  if (cf_data)
10942  {
10943  PasteboardPutItemFlavor(main_clipboard, (PasteboardItemID)1, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), cf_data, 0);
10944  CFRelease(cf_data);
10945  }
10946 }
10947 
10948 static const char *GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void *)
10949 {
10950  if (!main_clipboard)
10951  PasteboardCreate(kPasteboardClipboard, &main_clipboard);
10952  PasteboardSynchronize(main_clipboard);
10953 
10954  ItemCount item_count = 0;
10955  PasteboardGetItemCount(main_clipboard, &item_count);
10956  for (ItemCount i = 0; i < item_count; i++)
10957  {
10958  PasteboardItemID item_id = 0;
10959  PasteboardGetItemIdentifier(main_clipboard, i + 1, &item_id);
10960  CFArrayRef flavor_type_array = 0;
10961  PasteboardCopyItemFlavors(main_clipboard, item_id, &flavor_type_array);
10962  for (CFIndex j = 0, nj = CFArrayGetCount(flavor_type_array); j < nj; j++)
10963  {
10964  CFDataRef cf_data;
10965  if (PasteboardCopyItemFlavorData(main_clipboard, item_id, CFSTR("public.utf8-plain-text"), &cf_data) == noErr)
10966  {
10967  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10968  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
10969  int length = (int)CFDataGetLength(cf_data);
10970  g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize(length + 1);
10971  CFDataGetBytes(cf_data, CFRangeMake(0, length), (UInt8 *)g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data);
10972  g.ClipboardHandlerData[length] = 0;
10973  CFRelease(cf_data);
10974  return g.ClipboardHandlerData.Data;
10975  }
10976  }
10977  }
10978  return NULL;
10979 }
10980 
10981 #else
10982 
10983 // Local Dear ImGui-only clipboard implementation, if user hasn't defined better clipboard handlers.
10984 static const char *GetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void *)
10985 {
10986  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10987  return g.ClipboardHandlerData.empty() ? NULL : g.ClipboardHandlerData.begin();
10988 }
10989 
10990 static void SetClipboardTextFn_DefaultImpl(void *, const char *text)
10991 {
10992  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
10993  g.ClipboardHandlerData.clear();
10994  const char *text_end = text + strlen(text);
10995  g.ClipboardHandlerData.resize((int)(text_end - text) + 1);
10996  memcpy(&g.ClipboardHandlerData[0], text, (size_t)(text_end - text));
10997  g.ClipboardHandlerData[(int)(text_end - text)] = 0;
10998 }
10999 
11000 #endif
11001 
11002 // Win32 API IME support (for Asian languages, etc.)
11003 #if defined(_WIN32) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_FUNCTIONS) && !defined(IMGUI_DISABLE_WIN32_DEFAULT_IME_FUNCTIONS)
11004 
11005 #include <imm.h>
11006 #ifdef _MSC_VER
11007 #pragma comment(lib, "imm32")
11008 #endif
11009 
11010 static void ImeSetInputScreenPosFn_DefaultImpl(int x, int y)
11011 {
11012  // Notify OS Input Method Editor of text input position
11013  ImGuiIO &io = ImGui::GetIO();
11014  if (HWND hwnd = (HWND)io.ImeWindowHandle)
11015  if (HIMC himc = ::ImmGetContext(hwnd))
11016  {
11017  COMPOSITIONFORM cf;
11018  cf.ptCurrentPos.x = x;
11019  cf.ptCurrentPos.y = y;
11020  cf.dwStyle = CFS_FORCE_POSITION;
11021  ::ImmSetCompositionWindow(himc, &cf);
11022  ::ImmReleaseContext(hwnd, himc);
11023  }
11024 }
11025 
11026 #else
11027 
11028 static void ImeSetInputScreenPosFn_DefaultImpl(int, int)
11029 {}
11030 
11031 #endif
11032 
11033 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11034 // [SECTION] METRICS/DEBUGGER WINDOW
11035 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11036 // - RenderViewportThumbnail() [Internal]
11037 // - RenderViewportsThumbnails() [Internal]
11038 // - MetricsHelpMarker() [Internal]
11039 // - ShowMetricsWindow()
11040 // - DebugNodeColumns() [Internal]
11041 // - DebugNodeDrawList() [Internal]
11042 // - DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox() [Internal]
11043 // - DebugNodeStorage() [Internal]
11044 // - DebugNodeTabBar() [Internal]
11045 // - DebugNodeViewport() [Internal]
11046 // - DebugNodeWindow() [Internal]
11047 // - DebugNodeWindowSettings() [Internal]
11048 // - DebugNodeWindowsList() [Internal]
11049 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
11050 
11051 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_METRICS_WINDOW
11052 
11053 void ImGui::DebugRenderViewportThumbnail(ImDrawList *draw_list, ImGuiViewportP *viewport, const ImRect &bb)
11054 {
11055  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
11056  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
11057 
11058  ImVec2 scale = bb.GetSize() / viewport->Size;
11059  ImVec2 off = bb.Min - viewport->Pos * scale;
11060  float alpha_mul = 1.0f;
11061  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul * 0.40f));
11062  for (int i = 0; i != g.Windows.Size; i++)
11063  {
11064  ImGuiWindow *thumb_window = g.Windows[i];
11065  if (!thumb_window->WasActive || (thumb_window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
11066  continue;
11067 
11068  ImRect thumb_r = thumb_window->Rect();
11069  ImRect title_r = thumb_window->TitleBarRect();
11070  thumb_r = ImRect(ImFloor(off + thumb_r.Min * scale), ImFloor(off + thumb_r.Max * scale));
11071  title_r = ImRect(ImFloor(off + title_r.Min * scale), ImFloor(off + ImVec2(title_r.Max.x, title_r.Min.y) * scale) + ImVec2(0, 5)); // Exaggerate title bar height
11072  thumb_r.ClipWithFull(bb);
11073  title_r.ClipWithFull(bb);
11074  const bool window_is_focused = (g.NavWindow && thumb_window->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight == g.NavWindow->RootWindowForTitleBarHighlight);
11075  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(thumb_r.Min, thumb_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_WindowBg, alpha_mul));
11076  window->DrawList->AddRectFilled(title_r.Min, title_r.Max, GetColorU32(window_is_focused ? ImGuiCol_TitleBgActive : ImGuiCol_TitleBg, alpha_mul));
11077  window->DrawList->AddRect(thumb_r.Min, thumb_r.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul));
11078  window->DrawList->AddText(g.Font, g.FontSize * 1.0f, title_r.Min, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text, alpha_mul), thumb_window->Name, FindRenderedTextEnd(thumb_window->Name));
11079  }
11080  draw_list->AddRect(bb.Min, bb.Max, GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Border, alpha_mul));
11081 }
11082 
11083 static void RenderViewportsThumbnails()
11084 {
11085  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
11086  ImGuiWindow *window = g.CurrentWindow;
11087 
11088  // We don't display full monitor bounds (we could, but it often looks awkward), instead we display just enough to cover all of our viewports.
11089  float SCALE = 1.0f / 8.0f;
11090  ImRect bb_full(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
11091  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
11092  bb_full.Add(g.Viewports[n]->GetMainRect());
11093  ImVec2 p = window->DC.CursorPos;
11094  ImVec2 off = p - bb_full.Min * SCALE;
11095  for (int n = 0; n < g.Viewports.Size; n++)
11096  {
11097  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[n];
11098  ImRect viewport_draw_bb(off + (viewport->Pos) * SCALE, off + (viewport->Pos + viewport->Size) * SCALE);
11099  ImGui::DebugRenderViewportThumbnail(window->DrawList, viewport, viewport_draw_bb);
11100  }
11101  ImGui::Dummy(bb_full.GetSize() * SCALE);
11102 }
11103 
11104 // Avoid naming collision with imgui_demo.cpp's HelpMarker() for unity builds.
11105 static void MetricsHelpMarker(const char *desc)
11106 {
11107  ImGui::TextDisabled("(?)");
11108  if (ImGui::IsItemHovered())
11109  {
11110  ImGui::BeginTooltip();
11111  ImGui::PushTextWrapPos(ImGui::GetFontSize() * 35.0f);
11112  ImGui::TextUnformatted(desc);
11113  ImGui::PopTextWrapPos();
11114  ImGui::EndTooltip();
11115  }
11116 }
11117 
11118 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS
11119 namespace ImGui
11120 {
11121  void ShowFontAtlas(ImFontAtlas *atlas);
11122 }
11123 #endif
11124 
11125 void ImGui::ShowMetricsWindow(bool *p_open)
11126 {
11127  if (!Begin("Dear ImGui Metrics/Debugger", p_open))
11128  {
11129  End();
11130  return;
11131  }
11132 
11133  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
11134  ImGuiIO &io = g.IO;
11135  ImGuiMetricsConfig *cfg = &g.DebugMetricsConfig;
11136 
11137  // Basic info
11138  Text("Dear ImGui %s", GetVersion());
11139  Text("Application average %.3f ms/frame (%.1f FPS)", 1000.0f / io.Framerate, io.Framerate);
11140  Text("%d vertices, %d indices (%d triangles)", io.MetricsRenderVertices, io.MetricsRenderIndices, io.MetricsRenderIndices / 3);
11141  Text("%d active windows (%d visible)", io.MetricsActiveWindows, io.MetricsRenderWindows);
11142  Text("%d active allocations", io.MetricsActiveAllocations);
11143  //SameLine(); if (SmallButton("GC")) { g.GcCompactAll = true; }
11144 
11145  Separator();
11146 
11147  // Debugging enums
11148  enum
11149  {
11150  WRT_OuterRect, WRT_OuterRectClipped, WRT_InnerRect, WRT_InnerClipRect, WRT_WorkRect, WRT_Content, WRT_ContentIdeal, WRT_ContentRegionRect, WRT_Count
11151  }; // Windows Rect Type
11152  const char *wrt_rects_names[WRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "OuterRectClipped", "InnerRect", "InnerClipRect", "WorkRect", "Content", "ContentIdeal", "ContentRegionRect" };
11153  enum
11154  {
11155  TRT_OuterRect, TRT_InnerRect, TRT_WorkRect, TRT_HostClipRect, TRT_InnerClipRect, TRT_BackgroundClipRect, TRT_ColumnsRect, TRT_ColumnsWorkRect, TRT_ColumnsClipRect, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed, TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal, TRT_ColumnsContentFrozen, TRT_ColumnsContentUnfrozen, TRT_Count
11156  }; // Tables Rect Type
11157  const char *trt_rects_names[TRT_Count] = { "OuterRect", "InnerRect", "WorkRect", "HostClipRect", "InnerClipRect", "BackgroundClipRect", "ColumnsRect", "ColumnsWorkRect", "ColumnsClipRect", "ColumnsContentHeadersUsed", "ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal", "ColumnsContentFrozen", "ColumnsContentUnfrozen" };
11158  if (cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType < 0)
11159  cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType = WRT_WorkRect;
11160  if (cfg->ShowTablesRectsType < 0)
11161  cfg->ShowTablesRectsType = TRT_WorkRect;
11162 
11163  struct Funcs
11164  {
11165  static ImRect GetTableRect(ImGuiTable *table, int rect_type, int n)
11166  {
11167  if (rect_type == TRT_OuterRect)
11168  {
11169  return table->OuterRect;
11170  }
11171  else if (rect_type == TRT_InnerRect)
11172  {
11173  return table->InnerRect;
11174  }
11175  else if (rect_type == TRT_WorkRect)
11176  {
11177  return table->WorkRect;
11178  }
11179  else if (rect_type == TRT_HostClipRect)
11180  {
11181  return table->HostClipRect;
11182  }
11183  else if (rect_type == TRT_InnerClipRect)
11184  {
11185  return table->InnerClipRect;
11186  }
11187  else if (rect_type == TRT_BackgroundClipRect)
11188  {
11189  return table->BgClipRect;
11190  }
11191  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsRect)
11192  {
11193  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->MinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->MaxX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastOuterHeight);
11194  }
11195  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsWorkRect)
11196  {
11197  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->WorkRect.Min.y, c->WorkMaxX, table->WorkRect.Max.y);
11198  }
11199  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsClipRect)
11200  {
11201  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return c->ClipRect;
11202  }
11203  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersUsed)
11204  {
11205  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXHeadersUsed, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight);
11206  } // Note: y1/y2 not always accurate
11207  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentHeadersIdeal)
11208  {
11209  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXHeadersIdeal, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight);
11210  }
11211  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentFrozen)
11212  {
11213  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y, c->ContentMaxXFrozen, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight);
11214  }
11215  else if (rect_type == TRT_ColumnsContentUnfrozen)
11216  {
11217  ImGuiTableColumn *c = &table->Columns[n]; return ImRect(c->WorkMinX, table->InnerClipRect.Min.y + table->LastFirstRowHeight, c->ContentMaxXUnfrozen, table->InnerClipRect.Max.y);
11218  }
11219  IM_ASSERT(0);
11220  return ImRect();
11221  }
11222 
11223  static ImRect GetWindowRect(ImGuiWindow *window, int rect_type)
11224  {
11225  if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRect)
11226  {
11227  return window->Rect();
11228  }
11229  else if (rect_type == WRT_OuterRectClipped)
11230  {
11231  return window->OuterRectClipped;
11232  }
11233  else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerRect)
11234  {
11235  return window->InnerRect;
11236  }
11237  else if (rect_type == WRT_InnerClipRect)
11238  {
11239  return window->InnerClipRect;
11240  }
11241  else if (rect_type == WRT_WorkRect)
11242  {
11243  return window->WorkRect;
11244  }
11245  else if (rect_type == WRT_Content)
11246  {
11247  ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSize);
11248  }
11249  else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentIdeal)
11250  {
11251  ImVec2 min = window->InnerRect.Min - window->Scroll + window->WindowPadding; return ImRect(min, min + window->ContentSizeIdeal);
11252  }
11253  else if (rect_type == WRT_ContentRegionRect)
11254  {
11255  return window->ContentRegionRect;
11256  }
11257  IM_ASSERT(0);
11258  return ImRect();
11259  }
11260  };
11261 
11262  // Tools
11263  if (TreeNode("Tools"))
11264  {
11265  // The Item Picker tool is super useful to visually select an item and break into the call-stack of where it was submitted.
11266  if (Button("Item Picker.."))
11267  DebugStartItemPicker();
11268  SameLine();
11269  MetricsHelpMarker("Will call the IM_DEBUG_BREAK() macro to break in debugger.\nWarning: If you don't have a debugger attached, this will probably crash.");
11270 
11271  Checkbox("Show windows begin order", &cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder);
11272  Checkbox("Show windows rectangles", &cfg->ShowWindowsRects);
11273  SameLine();
11274  SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 12);
11275  cfg->ShowWindowsRects |= Combo("##show_windows_rect_type", &cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType, wrt_rects_names, WRT_Count, WRT_Count);
11276  if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects && g.NavWindow != NULL)
11277  {
11278  BulletText("'%s':", g.NavWindow->Name);
11279  Indent();
11280  for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < WRT_Count; rect_n++)
11281  {
11282  ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(g.NavWindow, rect_n);
11283  Text("(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), wrt_rects_names[rect_n]);
11284  }
11285  Unindent();
11286  }
11287  Checkbox("Show ImDrawCmd mesh when hovering", &cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh);
11288  Checkbox("Show ImDrawCmd bounding boxes when hovering", &cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes);
11289 
11290  Checkbox("Show tables rectangles", &cfg->ShowTablesRects);
11291  SameLine();
11292  SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 12);
11293  cfg->ShowTablesRects |= Combo("##show_table_rects_type", &cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, trt_rects_names, TRT_Count, TRT_Count);
11294  if (cfg->ShowTablesRects && g.NavWindow != NULL)
11295  {
11296  for (int table_n = 0; table_n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); table_n++)
11297  {
11298  ImGuiTable *table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(table_n);
11299  if (table == NULL || table->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1 || (table->OuterWindow != g.NavWindow && table->InnerWindow != g.NavWindow))
11300  continue;
11301 
11302  BulletText("Table 0x%08X (%d columns, in '%s')", table->ID, table->ColumnsCount, table->OuterWindow->Name);
11303  if (IsItemHovered())
11304  GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(table->OuterRect.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), table->OuterRect.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
11305  Indent();
11306  char buf[128];
11307  for (int rect_n = 0; rect_n < TRT_Count; rect_n++)
11308  {
11309  if (rect_n >= TRT_ColumnsRect)
11310  {
11311  if (rect_n != TRT_ColumnsRect && rect_n != TRT_ColumnsClipRect)
11312  continue;
11313  for (int column_n = 0; column_n < table->ColumnsCount; column_n++)
11314  {
11315  ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, rect_n, column_n);
11316  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) Col %d %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), column_n, trt_rects_names[rect_n]);
11317  Selectable(buf);
11318  if (IsItemHovered())
11319  GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
11320  }
11321  }
11322  else
11323  {
11324  ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, rect_n, -1);
11325  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "(%6.1f,%6.1f) (%6.1f,%6.1f) Size (%6.1f,%6.1f) %s", r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y, r.GetWidth(), r.GetHeight(), trt_rects_names[rect_n]);
11326  Selectable(buf);
11327  if (IsItemHovered())
11328  GetForegroundDrawList()->AddRect(r.Min - ImVec2(1, 1), r.Max + ImVec2(1, 1), IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), 0.0f, 0, 2.0f);
11329  }
11330  }
11331  Unindent();
11332  }
11333  }
11334 
11335  TreePop();
11336  }
11337 
11338  // Windows
11339  DebugNodeWindowsList(&g.Windows, "Windows");
11340  //DebugNodeWindowsList(&g.WindowsFocusOrder, "WindowsFocusOrder");
11341 
11342  // DrawLists
11343  int drawlist_count = 0;
11344  for (int viewport_i = 0; viewport_i < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_i++)
11345  drawlist_count += g.Viewports[viewport_i]->DrawDataBuilder.GetDrawListCount();
11346  if (TreeNode("DrawLists", "DrawLists (%d)", drawlist_count))
11347  {
11348  for (int viewport_i = 0; viewport_i < g.Viewports.Size; viewport_i++)
11349  {
11350  ImGuiViewportP *viewport = g.Viewports[viewport_i];
11351  for (int layer_i = 0; layer_i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers); layer_i++)
11352  for (int draw_list_i = 0; draw_list_i < viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i].Size; draw_list_i++)
11353  DebugNodeDrawList(NULL, viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i][draw_list_i], "DrawList");
11354  }
11355  TreePop();
11356  }
11357 
11358  // Viewports
11359  if (TreeNode("Viewports", "Viewports (%d)", g.Viewports.Size))
11360  {
11361  Indent(GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
11362  RenderViewportsThumbnails();
11363  Unindent(GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing());
11364  for (int i = 0; i < g.Viewports.Size; i++)
11365  DebugNodeViewport(g.Viewports[i]);
11366  TreePop();
11367  }
11368 
11369  // Details for Popups
11370  if (TreeNode("Popups", "Popups (%d)", g.OpenPopupStack.Size))
11371  {
11372  for (int i = 0; i < g.OpenPopupStack.Size; i++)
11373  {
11374  ImGuiWindow *window = g.OpenPopupStack[i].Window;
11375  BulletText("PopupID: %08x, Window: '%s'%s%s", g.OpenPopupStack[i].PopupId, window ? window->Name : "NULL", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? " ChildWindow" : "", window && (window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? " ChildMenu" : "");
11376  }
11377  TreePop();
11378  }
11379 
11380  // Details for TabBars
11381  if (TreeNode("TabBars", "Tab Bars (%d)", g.TabBars.GetAliveCount()))
11382  {
11383  for (int n = 0; n < g.TabBars.GetMapSize(); n++)
11384  if (ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar = g.TabBars.TryGetMapData(n))
11385  {
11386  PushID(tab_bar);
11387  DebugNodeTabBar(tab_bar, "TabBar");
11388  PopID();
11389  }
11390  TreePop();
11391  }
11392 
11393  // Details for Tables
11394  if (TreeNode("Tables", "Tables (%d)", g.Tables.GetAliveCount()))
11395  {
11396  for (int n = 0; n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); n++)
11397  if (ImGuiTable *table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(n))
11398  DebugNodeTable(table);
11399  TreePop();
11400  }
11401 
11402  // Details for Fonts
11403 #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEMO_WINDOWS
11404  ImFontAtlas *atlas = g.IO.Fonts;
11405  if (TreeNode("Fonts", "Fonts (%d)", atlas->Fonts.Size))
11406  {
11407  ShowFontAtlas(atlas);
11408  TreePop();
11409  }
11410 #endif
11411 
11412  // Details for Docking
11413 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
11414  if (TreeNode("Docking"))
11415  {
11416  TreePop();
11417  }
11418 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
11419 
11420  // Settings
11421  if (TreeNode("Settings"))
11422  {
11423  if (SmallButton("Clear"))
11424  ClearIniSettings();
11425  SameLine();
11426  if (SmallButton("Save to memory"))
11427  SaveIniSettingsToMemory();
11428  SameLine();
11429  if (SmallButton("Save to disk"))
11430  SaveIniSettingsToDisk(g.IO.IniFilename);
11431  SameLine();
11432  if (g.IO.IniFilename)
11433  Text("\"%s\"", g.IO.IniFilename);
11434  else
11435  TextUnformatted("<NULL>");
11436  Text("SettingsDirtyTimer %.2f", g.SettingsDirtyTimer);
11437  if (TreeNode("SettingsHandlers", "Settings handlers: (%d)", g.SettingsHandlers.Size))
11438  {
11439  for (int n = 0; n < g.SettingsHandlers.Size; n++)
11440  BulletText("%s", g.SettingsHandlers[n].TypeName);
11441  TreePop();
11442  }
11443  if (TreeNode("SettingsWindows", "Settings packed data: Windows: %d bytes", g.SettingsWindows.size()))
11444  {
11445  for (ImGuiWindowSettings *settings = g.SettingsWindows.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsWindows.next_chunk(settings))
11446  DebugNodeWindowSettings(settings);
11447  TreePop();
11448  }
11449 
11450  if (TreeNode("SettingsTables", "Settings packed data: Tables: %d bytes", g.SettingsTables.size()))
11451  {
11452  for (ImGuiTableSettings *settings = g.SettingsTables.begin(); settings != NULL; settings = g.SettingsTables.next_chunk(settings))
11453  DebugNodeTableSettings(settings);
11454  TreePop();
11455  }
11456 
11457 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
11458 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
11459 
11460  if (TreeNode("SettingsIniData", "Settings unpacked data (.ini): %d bytes", g.SettingsIniData.size()))
11461  {
11462  InputTextMultiline("##Ini", (char *)(void *)g.SettingsIniData.c_str(), g.SettingsIniData.Buf.Size, ImVec2(-FLT_MIN, GetTextLineHeight() * 20), ImGuiInputTextFlags_ReadOnly);
11463  TreePop();
11464  }
11465  TreePop();
11466  }
11467 
11468  // Misc Details
11469  if (TreeNode("Internal state"))
11470  {
11471  const char *input_source_names[] = { "None", "Mouse", "Keyboard", "Gamepad", "Nav", "Clipboard" }; IM_ASSERT(IM_ARRAYSIZE(input_source_names) == ImGuiInputSource_COUNT);
11472 
11473  Text("WINDOWING");
11474  Indent();
11475  Text("HoveredWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->Name : "NULL");
11476  Text("HoveredWindow->Root: '%s'", g.HoveredWindow ? g.HoveredWindow->RootWindow->Name : "NULL");
11477  Text("HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow: '%s'", g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow ? g.HoveredWindowUnderMovingWindow->Name : "NULL");
11478  Text("MovingWindow: '%s'", g.MovingWindow ? g.MovingWindow->Name : "NULL");
11479  Unindent();
11480 
11481  Text("ITEMS");
11482  Indent();
11483  Text("ActiveId: 0x%08X/0x%08X (%.2f sec), AllowOverlap: %d, Source: %s", g.ActiveId, g.ActiveIdPreviousFrame, g.ActiveIdTimer, g.ActiveIdAllowOverlap, input_source_names[g.ActiveIdSource]);
11484  Text("ActiveIdWindow: '%s'", g.ActiveIdWindow ? g.ActiveIdWindow->Name : "NULL");
11485  Text("ActiveIdUsing: Wheel: %d, NavDirMask: %X, NavInputMask: %X, KeyInputMask: %llX", g.ActiveIdUsingMouseWheel, g.ActiveIdUsingNavDirMask, g.ActiveIdUsingNavInputMask, g.ActiveIdUsingKeyInputMask);
11486  Text("HoveredId: 0x%08X (%.2f sec), AllowOverlap: %d", g.HoveredIdPreviousFrame, g.HoveredIdTimer, g.HoveredIdAllowOverlap); // Not displaying g.HoveredId as it is update mid-frame
11487  Text("DragDrop: %d, SourceId = 0x%08X, Payload \"%s\" (%d bytes)", g.DragDropActive, g.DragDropPayload.SourceId, g.DragDropPayload.DataType, g.DragDropPayload.DataSize);
11488  Unindent();
11489 
11490  Text("NAV,FOCUS");
11491  Indent();
11492  Text("NavWindow: '%s'", g.NavWindow ? g.NavWindow->Name : "NULL");
11493  Text("NavId: 0x%08X, NavLayer: %d", g.NavId, g.NavLayer);
11494  Text("NavInputSource: %s", input_source_names[g.NavInputSource]);
11495  Text("NavActive: %d, NavVisible: %d", g.IO.NavActive, g.IO.NavVisible);
11496  Text("NavActivateId: 0x%08X, NavInputId: 0x%08X", g.NavActivateId, g.NavInputId);
11497  Text("NavDisableHighlight: %d, NavDisableMouseHover: %d", g.NavDisableHighlight, g.NavDisableMouseHover);
11498  Text("NavFocusScopeId = 0x%08X", g.NavFocusScopeId);
11499  Text("NavWindowingTarget: '%s'", g.NavWindowingTarget ? g.NavWindowingTarget->Name : "NULL");
11500  Unindent();
11501 
11502  TreePop();
11503  }
11504 
11505  // Overlay: Display windows Rectangles and Begin Order
11506  if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects || cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder)
11507  {
11508  for (int n = 0; n < g.Windows.Size; n++)
11509  {
11510  ImGuiWindow *window = g.Windows[n];
11511  if (!window->WasActive)
11512  continue;
11513  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window);
11514  if (cfg->ShowWindowsRects)
11515  {
11516  ImRect r = Funcs::GetWindowRect(window, cfg->ShowWindowsRectsType);
11517  draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255));
11518  }
11519  if (cfg->ShowWindowsBeginOrder && !(window->Flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow))
11520  {
11521  char buf[32];
11522  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "%d", window->BeginOrderWithinContext);
11523  float font_size = GetFontSize();
11524  draw_list->AddRectFilled(window->Pos, window->Pos + ImVec2(font_size, font_size), IM_COL32(200, 100, 100, 255));
11525  draw_list->AddText(window->Pos, IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 255), buf);
11526  }
11527  }
11528  }
11529 
11530  // Overlay: Display Tables Rectangles
11531  if (cfg->ShowTablesRects)
11532  {
11533  for (int table_n = 0; table_n < g.Tables.GetMapSize(); table_n++)
11534  {
11535  ImGuiTable *table = g.Tables.TryGetMapData(table_n);
11536  if (table == NULL || table->LastFrameActive < g.FrameCount - 1)
11537  continue;
11538  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(table->OuterWindow);
11539  if (cfg->ShowTablesRectsType >= TRT_ColumnsRect)
11540  {
11541  for (int column_n = 0; column_n < table->ColumnsCount; column_n++)
11542  {
11543  ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, column_n);
11544  ImU32 col = (table->HoveredColumnBody == column_n) ? IM_COL32(255, 255, 128, 255) : IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255);
11545  float thickness = (table->HoveredColumnBody == column_n) ? 3.0f : 1.0f;
11546  draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, col, 0.0f, 0, thickness);
11547  }
11548  }
11549  else
11550  {
11551  ImRect r = Funcs::GetTableRect(table, cfg->ShowTablesRectsType, -1);
11552  draw_list->AddRect(r.Min, r.Max, IM_COL32(255, 0, 128, 255));
11553  }
11554  }
11555  }
11556 
11557 #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
11558  // Overlay: Display Docking info
11559  if (show_docking_nodes && g.IO.KeyCtrl)
11560  {
11561  }
11562 #endif // #ifdef IMGUI_HAS_DOCK
11563 
11564  End();
11565 }
11566 
11567 // [DEBUG] List fonts in a font atlas and display its texture
11568 void ImGui::ShowFontAtlas(ImFontAtlas *atlas)
11569 {
11570  for (int i = 0; i < atlas->Fonts.Size; i++)
11571  {
11572  ImFont *font = atlas->Fonts[i];
11573  PushID(font);
11574  DebugNodeFont(font);
11575  PopID();
11576  }
11577  if (TreeNode("Atlas texture", "Atlas texture (%dx%d pixels)", atlas->TexWidth, atlas->TexHeight))
11578  {
11579  ImVec4 tint_col = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f);
11580  ImVec4 border_col = ImVec4(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 0.5f);
11581  Image(atlas->TexID, ImVec2((float)atlas->TexWidth, (float)atlas->TexHeight), ImVec2(0.0f, 0.0f), ImVec2(1.0f, 1.0f), tint_col, border_col);
11582  TreePop();
11583  }
11584 }
11585 
11586 // [DEBUG] Display contents of Columns
11587 void ImGui::DebugNodeColumns(ImGuiOldColumns *columns)
11588 {
11589  if (!TreeNode((void *)(uintptr_t)columns->ID, "Columns Id: 0x%08X, Count: %d, Flags: 0x%04X", columns->ID, columns->Count, columns->Flags))
11590  return;
11591  BulletText("Width: %.1f (MinX: %.1f, MaxX: %.1f)", columns->OffMaxX - columns->OffMinX, columns->OffMinX, columns->OffMaxX);
11592  for (int column_n = 0; column_n < columns->Columns.Size; column_n++)
11593  BulletText("Column %02d: OffsetNorm %.3f (= %.1f px)", column_n, columns->Columns[column_n].OffsetNorm, GetColumnOffsetFromNorm(columns, columns->Columns[column_n].OffsetNorm));
11594  TreePop();
11595 }
11596 
11597 // [DEBUG] Display contents of ImDrawList
11598 void ImGui::DebugNodeDrawList(ImGuiWindow *window, const ImDrawList *draw_list, const char *label)
11599 {
11600  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
11601  ImGuiMetricsConfig *cfg = &g.DebugMetricsConfig;
11602  int cmd_count = draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size;
11603  if (cmd_count > 0 && draw_list->CmdBuffer.back().ElemCount == 0 && draw_list->CmdBuffer.back().UserCallback == NULL)
11604  cmd_count--;
11605  bool node_open = TreeNode(draw_list, "%s: '%s' %d vtx, %d indices, %d cmds", label, draw_list->_OwnerName ? draw_list->_OwnerName : "", draw_list->VtxBuffer.Size, draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size, cmd_count);
11606  if (draw_list == GetWindowDrawList())
11607  {
11608  SameLine();
11609  TextColored(ImVec4(1.0f, 0.4f, 0.4f, 1.0f), "CURRENTLY APPENDING"); // Can't display stats for active draw list! (we don't have the data double-buffered)
11610  if (node_open)
11611  TreePop();
11612  return;
11613  }
11614 
11615  ImDrawList *fg_draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList(window); // Render additional visuals into the top-most draw list
11616  if (window && IsItemHovered())
11617  fg_draw_list->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
11618  if (!node_open)
11619  return;
11620 
11621  if (window && !window->WasActive)
11622  TextDisabled("Warning: owning Window is inactive. This DrawList is not being rendered!");
11623 
11624  for (const ImDrawCmd *pcmd = draw_list->CmdBuffer.Data; pcmd < draw_list->CmdBuffer.Data + cmd_count; pcmd++)
11625  {
11626  if (pcmd->UserCallback)
11627  {
11628  BulletText("Callback %p, user_data %p", pcmd->UserCallback, pcmd->UserCallbackData);
11629  continue;
11630  }
11631 
11632  char buf[300];
11633  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "DrawCmd:%5d tris, Tex 0x%p, ClipRect (%4.0f,%4.0f)-(%4.0f,%4.0f)",
11634  pcmd->ElemCount / 3, (void *)(intptr_t)pcmd->TextureId,
11635  pcmd->ClipRect.x, pcmd->ClipRect.y, pcmd->ClipRect.z, pcmd->ClipRect.w);
11636  bool pcmd_node_open = TreeNode((void *)(pcmd - draw_list->CmdBuffer.begin()), "%s", buf);
11637  if (IsItemHovered() && (cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh || cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes) && fg_draw_list)
11638  DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(fg_draw_list, draw_list, pcmd, cfg->ShowDrawCmdMesh, cfg->ShowDrawCmdBoundingBoxes);
11639  if (!pcmd_node_open)
11640  continue;
11641 
11642  // Calculate approximate coverage area (touched pixel count)
11643  // This will be in pixels squared as long there's no post-scaling happening to the renderer output.
11644  const ImDrawIdx *idx_buffer = (draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size > 0) ? draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data : NULL;
11645  const ImDrawVert *vtx_buffer = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + pcmd->VtxOffset;
11646  float total_area = 0.0f;
11647  for (unsigned int idx_n = pcmd->IdxOffset; idx_n < pcmd->IdxOffset + pcmd->ElemCount; )
11648  {
11649  ImVec2 triangle[3];
11650  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_n++)
11651  triangle[n] = vtx_buffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_n] : idx_n].pos;
11652  total_area += ImTriangleArea(triangle[0], triangle[1], triangle[2]);
11653  }
11654 
11655  // Display vertex information summary. Hover to get all triangles drawn in wire-frame
11656  ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "Mesh: ElemCount: %d, VtxOffset: +%d, IdxOffset: +%d, Area: ~%0.f px", pcmd->ElemCount, pcmd->VtxOffset, pcmd->IdxOffset, total_area);
11657  Selectable(buf);
11658  if (IsItemHovered() && fg_draw_list)
11659  DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(fg_draw_list, draw_list, pcmd, true, false);
11660 
11661  // Display individual triangles/vertices. Hover on to get the corresponding triangle highlighted.
11662  ImGuiListClipper clipper;
11663  clipper.Begin(pcmd->ElemCount / 3); // Manually coarse clip our print out of individual vertices to save CPU, only items that may be visible.
11664  while (clipper.Step())
11665  for (int prim = clipper.DisplayStart, idx_i = pcmd->IdxOffset + clipper.DisplayStart * 3; prim < clipper.DisplayEnd; prim++)
11666  {
11667  char *buf_p = buf, *buf_end = buf + IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf);
11668  ImVec2 triangle[3];
11669  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_i++)
11670  {
11671  const ImDrawVert &v = vtx_buffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_i] : idx_i];
11672  triangle[n] = v.pos;
11673  buf_p += ImFormatString(buf_p, buf_end - buf_p, "%s %04d: pos (%8.2f,%8.2f), uv (%.6f,%.6f), col %08X\n",
11674  (n == 0) ? "Vert:" : " ", idx_i, v.pos.x, v.pos.y, v.uv.x, v.uv.y, v.col);
11675  }
11676 
11677  Selectable(buf, false);
11678  if (fg_draw_list && IsItemHovered())
11679  {
11680  ImDrawListFlags backup_flags = fg_draw_list->Flags;
11681  fg_draw_list->Flags &= ~ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines; // Disable AA on triangle outlines is more readable for very large and thin triangles.
11682  fg_draw_list->AddPolyline(triangle, 3, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), ImDrawFlags_Closed, 1.0f);
11683  fg_draw_list->Flags = backup_flags;
11684  }
11685  }
11686  TreePop();
11687  }
11688  TreePop();
11689 }
11690 
11691 // [DEBUG] Display mesh/aabb of a ImDrawCmd
11692 void ImGui::DebugNodeDrawCmdShowMeshAndBoundingBox(ImDrawList *out_draw_list, const ImDrawList *draw_list, const ImDrawCmd *draw_cmd, bool show_mesh, bool show_aabb)
11693 {
11694  IM_ASSERT(show_mesh || show_aabb);
11695 
11696  // Draw wire-frame version of all triangles
11697  ImRect clip_rect = draw_cmd->ClipRect;
11698  ImRect vtxs_rect(FLT_MAX, FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX, -FLT_MAX);
11699  ImDrawListFlags backup_flags = out_draw_list->Flags;
11700  out_draw_list->Flags &= ~ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines; // Disable AA on triangle outlines is more readable for very large and thin triangles.
11701  for (unsigned int idx_n = draw_cmd->IdxOffset, idx_end = draw_cmd->IdxOffset + draw_cmd->ElemCount; idx_n < idx_end; )
11702  {
11703  ImDrawIdx *idx_buffer = (draw_list->IdxBuffer.Size > 0) ? draw_list->IdxBuffer.Data : NULL; // We don't hold on those pointers past iterations as ->AddPolyline() may invalidate them if out_draw_list==draw_list
11704  ImDrawVert *vtx_buffer = draw_list->VtxBuffer.Data + draw_cmd->VtxOffset;
11705 
11706  ImVec2 triangle[3];
11707  for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++, idx_n++)
11708  vtxs_rect.Add((triangle[n] = vtx_buffer[idx_buffer ? idx_buffer[idx_n] : idx_n].pos));
11709  if (show_mesh)
11710  out_draw_list->AddPolyline(triangle, 3, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255), ImDrawFlags_Closed, 1.0f); // In yellow: mesh triangles
11711  }
11712  // Draw bounding boxes
11713  if (show_aabb)
11714  {
11715  out_draw_list->AddRect(ImFloor(clip_rect.Min), ImFloor(clip_rect.Max), IM_COL32(255, 0, 255, 255)); // In pink: clipping rectangle submitted to GPU
11716  out_draw_list->AddRect(ImFloor(vtxs_rect.Min), ImFloor(vtxs_rect.Max), IM_COL32(0, 255, 255, 255)); // In cyan: bounding box of triangles
11717  }
11718  out_draw_list->Flags = backup_flags;
11719 }
11720 
11721 // [DEBUG] Display details for a single font, called by ShowStyleEditor().
11722 void ImGui::DebugNodeFont(ImFont *font)
11723 {
11724  bool opened = TreeNode(font, "Font: \"%s\"\n%.2f px, %d glyphs, %d file(s)",
11725  font->ConfigData ? font->ConfigData[0].Name : "", font->FontSize, font->Glyphs.Size, font->ConfigDataCount);
11726  SameLine();
11727  if (SmallButton("Set as default"))
11728  GetIO().FontDefault = font;
11729  if (!opened)
11730  return;
11731 
11732  // Display preview text
11733  PushFont(font);
11734  Text("The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog");
11735  PopFont();
11736 
11737  // Display details
11738  SetNextItemWidth(GetFontSize() * 8);
11739  DragFloat("Font scale", &font->Scale, 0.005f, 0.3f, 2.0f, "%.1f");
11740  SameLine(); MetricsHelpMarker(
11741  "Note than the default embedded font is NOT meant to be scaled.\n\n"
11742  "Font are currently rendered into bitmaps at a given size at the time of building the atlas. "
11743  "You may oversample them to get some flexibility with scaling. "
11744  "You can also render at multiple sizes and select which one to use at runtime.\n\n"
11745  "(Glimmer of hope: the atlas system will be rewritten in the future to make scaling more flexible.)");
11746  Text("Ascent: %f, Descent: %f, Height: %f", font->Ascent, font->Descent, font->Ascent - font->Descent);
11747  char c_str[5];
11748  Text("Fallback character: '%s' (U+%04X)", ImTextCharToUtf8(c_str, font->FallbackChar), font->FallbackChar);
11749  Text("Ellipsis character: '%s' (U+%04X)", ImTextCharToUtf8(c_str, font->EllipsisChar), font->EllipsisChar);
11750  const int surface_sqrt = (int)ImSqrt((float)font->MetricsTotalSurface);
11751  Text("Texture Area: about %d px ~%dx%d px", font->MetricsTotalSurface, surface_sqrt, surface_sqrt);
11752  for (int config_i = 0; config_i < font->ConfigDataCount; config_i++)
11753  if (font->ConfigData)
11754  if (const ImFontConfig *cfg = &font->ConfigData[config_i])
11755  BulletText("Input %d: \'%s\', Oversample: (%d,%d), PixelSnapH: %d, Offset: (%.1f,%.1f)",
11756  config_i, cfg->Name, cfg->OversampleH, cfg->OversampleV, cfg->PixelSnapH, cfg->GlyphOffset.x, cfg->GlyphOffset.y);
11757 
11758  // Display all glyphs of the fonts in separate pages of 256 characters
11759  if (TreeNode("Glyphs", "Glyphs (%d)", font->Glyphs.Size))
11760  {
11761  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetWindowDrawList();
11762  const ImU32 glyph_col = GetColorU32(ImGuiCol_Text);
11763  const float cell_size = font->FontSize * 1;
11764  const float cell_spacing = GetStyle().ItemSpacing.y;
11765  for (unsigned int base = 0; base <= IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_MAX; base += 256)
11766  {
11767  // Skip ahead if a large bunch of glyphs are not present in the font (test in chunks of 4k)
11768  // This is only a small optimization to reduce the number of iterations when IM_UNICODE_MAX_CODEPOINT
11769  // is large // (if ImWchar==ImWchar32 we will do at least about 272 queries here)
11770  if (!(base & 4095) && font->IsGlyphRangeUnused(base, base + 4095))
11771  {
11772  base += 4096 - 256;
11773  continue;
11774  }
11775 
11776  int count = 0;
11777  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < 256; n++)
11778  if (font->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)(base + n)))
11779  count++;
11780  if (count <= 0)
11781  continue;
11782  if (!TreeNode((void *)(intptr_t)base, "U+%04X..U+%04X (%d %s)", base, base + 255, count, count > 1 ? "glyphs" : "glyph"))
11783  continue;
11784 
11785  // Draw a 16x16 grid of glyphs
11786  ImVec2 base_pos = GetCursorScreenPos();
11787  for (unsigned int n = 0; n < 256; n++)
11788  {
11789  // We use ImFont::RenderChar as a shortcut because we don't have UTF-8 conversion functions
11790  // available here and thus cannot easily generate a zero-terminated UTF-8 encoded string.
11791  ImVec2 cell_p1(base_pos.x + (n % 16) * (cell_size + cell_spacing), base_pos.y + (n / 16) * (cell_size + cell_spacing));
11792  ImVec2 cell_p2(cell_p1.x + cell_size, cell_p1.y + cell_size);
11793  const ImFontGlyph *glyph = font->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)(base + n));
11794  draw_list->AddRect(cell_p1, cell_p2, glyph ? IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 100) : IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 50));
11795  if (glyph)
11796  font->RenderChar(draw_list, cell_size, cell_p1, glyph_col, (ImWchar)(base + n));
11797  if (glyph && IsMouseHoveringRect(cell_p1, cell_p2))
11798  {
11799  BeginTooltip();
11800  Text("Codepoint: U+%04X", base + n);
11801  Separator();
11802  Text("Visible: %d", glyph->Visible);
11803  Text("AdvanceX: %.1f", glyph->AdvanceX);
11804  Text("Pos: (%.2f,%.2f)->(%.2f,%.2f)", glyph->X0, glyph->Y0, glyph->X1, glyph->Y1);
11805  Text("UV: (%.3f,%.3f)->(%.3f,%.3f)", glyph->U0, glyph->V0, glyph->U1, glyph->V1);
11806  EndTooltip();
11807  }
11808  }
11809  Dummy(ImVec2((cell_size + cell_spacing) * 16, (cell_size + cell_spacing) * 16));
11810  TreePop();
11811  }
11812  TreePop();
11813  }
11814  TreePop();
11815 }
11816 
11817 // [DEBUG] Display contents of ImGuiStorage
11818 void ImGui::DebugNodeStorage(ImGuiStorage *storage, const char *label)
11819 {
11820  if (!TreeNode(label, "%s: %d entries, %d bytes", label, storage->Data.Size, storage->Data.size_in_bytes()))
11821  return;
11822  for (int n = 0; n < storage->Data.Size; n++)
11823  {
11824  const ImGuiStorage::ImGuiStoragePair &p = storage->Data[n];
11825  BulletText("Key 0x%08X Value { i: %d }", p.key, p.val_i); // Important: we currently don't store a type, real value may not be integer.
11826  }
11827  TreePop();
11828 }
11829 
11830 // [DEBUG] Display contents of ImGuiTabBar
11831 void ImGui::DebugNodeTabBar(ImGuiTabBar *tab_bar, const char *label)
11832 {
11833  // Standalone tab bars (not associated to docking/windows functionality) currently hold no discernible strings.
11834  char buf[256];
11835  char *p = buf;
11836  const char *buf_end = buf + IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf);
11837  const bool is_active = (tab_bar->PrevFrameVisible >= GetFrameCount() - 2);
11838  p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, "%s 0x%08X (%d tabs)%s", label, tab_bar->ID, tab_bar->Tabs.Size, is_active ? "" : " *Inactive*");
11839  p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, " { ");
11840  for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < ImMin(tab_bar->Tabs.Size, 3); tab_n++)
11841  {
11842  ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
11843  p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, "%s'%s'",
11844  tab_n > 0 ? ", " : "", (tab->NameOffset != -1) ? tab_bar->GetTabName(tab) : "???");
11845  }
11846  p += ImFormatString(p, buf_end - p, (tab_bar->Tabs.Size > 3) ? " ... }" : " } ");
11847  if (!is_active)
11848  {
11849  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_TextDisabled));
11850  }
11851  bool open = TreeNode(label, "%s", buf);
11852  if (!is_active)
11853  {
11854  PopStyleColor();
11855  }
11856  if (is_active && IsItemHovered())
11857  {
11858  ImDrawList *draw_list = GetForegroundDrawList();
11859  draw_list->AddRect(tab_bar->BarRect.Min, tab_bar->BarRect.Max, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
11860  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMinX, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
11861  draw_list->AddLine(ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, tab_bar->BarRect.Min.y), ImVec2(tab_bar->ScrollingRectMaxX, tab_bar->BarRect.Max.y), IM_COL32(0, 255, 0, 255));
11862  }
11863  if (open)
11864  {
11865  for (int tab_n = 0; tab_n < tab_bar->Tabs.Size; tab_n++)
11866  {
11867  const ImGuiTabItem *tab = &tab_bar->Tabs[tab_n];
11868  PushID(tab);
11869  if (SmallButton("<"))
11870  {
11871  TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, tab, -1);
11872  } SameLine(0, 2);
11873  if (SmallButton(">"))
11874  {
11875  TabBarQueueReorder(tab_bar, tab, +1);
11876  } SameLine();
11877  Text("%02d%c Tab 0x%08X '%s' Offset: %.1f, Width: %.1f/%.1f",
11878  tab_n, (tab->ID == tab_bar->SelectedTabId) ? '*' : ' ', tab->ID, (tab->NameOffset != -1) ? tab_bar->GetTabName(tab) : "???", tab->Offset, tab->Width, tab->ContentWidth);
11879  PopID();
11880  }
11881  TreePop();
11882  }
11883 }
11884 
11885 void ImGui::DebugNodeViewport(ImGuiViewportP *viewport)
11886 {
11887  SetNextItemOpen(true, ImGuiCond_Once);
11888  if (TreeNode("viewport0", "Viewport #%d", 0))
11889  {
11890  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = viewport->Flags;
11891  BulletText("Main Pos: (%.0f,%.0f), Size: (%.0f,%.0f)\nWorkArea Offset Left: %.0f Top: %.0f, Right: %.0f, Bottom: %.0f",
11892  viewport->Pos.x, viewport->Pos.y, viewport->Size.x, viewport->Size.y,
11893  viewport->WorkOffsetMin.x, viewport->WorkOffsetMin.y, viewport->WorkOffsetMax.x, viewport->WorkOffsetMax.y);
11894  BulletText("Flags: 0x%04X =%s%s%s", viewport->Flags,
11895  (flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformWindow) ? " IsPlatformWindow" : "",
11896  (flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_IsPlatformMonitor) ? " IsPlatformMonitor" : "",
11897  (flags & ImGuiViewportFlags_OwnedByApp) ? " OwnedByApp" : "");
11898  for (int layer_i = 0; layer_i < IM_ARRAYSIZE(viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers); layer_i++)
11899  for (int draw_list_i = 0; draw_list_i < viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i].Size; draw_list_i++)
11900  DebugNodeDrawList(NULL, viewport->DrawDataBuilder.Layers[layer_i][draw_list_i], "DrawList");
11901  TreePop();
11902  }
11903 }
11904 
11905 void ImGui::DebugNodeWindow(ImGuiWindow *window, const char *label)
11906 {
11907  if (window == NULL)
11908  {
11909  BulletText("%s: NULL", label);
11910  return;
11911  }
11912 
11913  ImGuiContext &g = *GImGui;
11914  const bool is_active = window->WasActive;
11915  ImGuiTreeNodeFlags tree_node_flags = (window == g.NavWindow) ? ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_Selected : ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_None;
11916  if (!is_active)
11917  {
11918  PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, GetStyleColorVec4(ImGuiCol_TextDisabled));
11919  }
11920  const bool open = TreeNodeEx(label, tree_node_flags, "%s '%s'%s", label, window->Name, is_active ? "" : " *Inactive*");
11921  if (!is_active)
11922  {
11923  PopStyleColor();
11924  }
11925  if (IsItemHovered() && is_active)
11926  GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(window->Pos, window->Pos + window->Size, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
11927  if (!open)
11928  return;
11929 
11930  if (window->MemoryCompacted)
11931  TextDisabled("Note: some memory buffers have been compacted/freed.");
11932 
11933  ImGuiWindowFlags flags = window->Flags;
11934  DebugNodeDrawList(window, window->DrawList, "DrawList");
11935  BulletText("Pos: (%.1f,%.1f), Size: (%.1f,%.1f), ContentSize (%.1f,%.1f) Ideal (%.1f,%.1f)", window->Pos.x, window->Pos.y, window->Size.x, window->Size.y, window->ContentSize.x, window->ContentSize.y, window->ContentSizeIdeal.x, window->ContentSizeIdeal.y);
11936  BulletText("Flags: 0x%08X (%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s%s..)", flags,
11937  (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildWindow) ? "Child " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Tooltip) ? "Tooltip " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Popup) ? "Popup " : "",
11938  (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal) ? "Modal " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_ChildMenu) ? "ChildMenu " : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoSavedSettings) ? "NoSavedSettings " : "",
11939  (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoMouseInputs) ? "NoMouseInputs" : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_NoNavInputs) ? "NoNavInputs" : "", (flags & ImGuiWindowFlags_AlwaysAutoResize) ? "AlwaysAutoResize" : "");
11940  BulletText("Scroll: (%.2f/%.2f,%.2f/%.2f) Scrollbar:%s%s", window->Scroll.x, window->ScrollMax.x, window->Scroll.y, window->ScrollMax.y, window->ScrollbarX ? "X" : "", window->ScrollbarY ? "Y" : "");
11941  BulletText("Active: %d/%d, WriteAccessed: %d, BeginOrderWithinContext: %d", window->Active, window->WasActive, window->WriteAccessed, (window->Active || window->WasActive) ? window->BeginOrderWithinContext : -1);
11942  BulletText("Appearing: %d, Hidden: %d (CanSkip %d Cannot %d), SkipItems: %d", window->Appearing, window->Hidden, window->HiddenFramesCanSkipItems, window->HiddenFramesCannotSkipItems, window->SkipItems);
11943  for (int layer = 0; layer < ImGuiNavLayer_COUNT; layer++)
11944  {
11945  ImRect r = window->NavRectRel[layer];
11946  if (r.Min.x >= r.Max.y && r.Min.y >= r.Max.y)
11947  {
11948  BulletText("NavLastIds[%d]: 0x%08X", layer, window->NavLastIds[layer]);
11949  continue;
11950  }
11951  BulletText("NavLastIds[%d]: 0x%08X at +(%.1f,%.1f)(%.1f,%.1f)", layer, window->NavLastIds[layer], r.Min.x, r.Min.y, r.Max.x, r.Max.y);
11952  if (IsItemHovered())
11953  GetForegroundDrawList(window)->AddRect(r.Min + window->Pos, r.Max + window->Pos, IM_COL32(255, 255, 0, 255));
11954  }
11955  BulletText("NavLayersActiveMask: %X, NavLastChildNavWindow: %s", window->DC.NavLayersActiveMask, window->NavLastChildNavWindow ? window->NavLastChildNavWindow->Name : "NULL");
11956  if (window->RootWindow != window)
11957  {
11958  DebugNodeWindow(window->RootWindow, "RootWindow");
11959  }
11960  if (window->ParentWindow != NULL)
11961  {
11962  DebugNodeWindow(window->ParentWindow, "ParentWindow");
11963  }
11964  if (window->DC.ChildWindows.Size > 0)
11965  {
11966  DebugNodeWindowsList(&window->DC.ChildWindows, "ChildWindows");
11967  }
11968  if (window->ColumnsStorage.Size > 0 && TreeNode("Columns", "Columns sets (%d)", window->ColumnsStorage.Size))
11969  {
11970  for (int n = 0; n < window->ColumnsStorage.Size; n++)
11971  DebugNodeColumns(&window->ColumnsStorage[n]);
11972  TreePop();
11973  }
11974  DebugNodeStorage(&window->StateStorage, "Storage");
11975  TreePop();
11976 }
11977 
11978 void ImGui::DebugNodeWindowSettings(ImGuiWindowSettings *settings)
11979 {
11980  Text("0x%08X \"%s\" Pos (%d,%d) Size (%d,%d) Collapsed=%d",
11981  settings->ID, settings->GetName(), settings->Pos.x, settings->Pos.y, settings->Size.x, settings->Size.y, settings->Collapsed);
11982 }
11983 
11984 void ImGui::DebugNodeWindowsList(ImVector<ImGuiWindow *> *windows, const char *label)
11985 {
11986  if (!TreeNode(label, "%s (%d)", label, windows->Size))
11987  return;
11988  Text("(In front-to-back order:)");
11989  for (int i = windows->Size - 1; i >= 0; i--) // Iterate front to back
11990  {
11991  PushID((*windows)[i]);
11992  DebugNodeWindow((*windows)[i], "Window");
11993  PopID();
11994  }
11995  TreePop();
11996 }

12027 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12028 
12029 // Include imgui_user.inl at the end of imgui.cpp to access private data/functions that aren't exposed.
12030 // Prefer just including imgui_internal.h from your code rather than using this define. If a declaration is missing from imgui_internal.h add it or request it on the github.
12031 #ifdef IMGUI_INCLUDE_IMGUI_USER_INL
12032 #include "imgui_user.inl"
12033 #endif
12034 
12035 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
12036 
12037 #endif // #ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE
ImDrawCmd
